Bill starts on the 3rd floor, moving at a speed of 2 mph. He rides the elevator up to the floor that's equal to 4 times his starting floor plus 6, increasing his speed to 4 mph. What floor is Bill on now?

Shelly's 3 kids spent all day at the water park, where the humidity was initially 40%. Mitchel went down the water slide 30 times. Anne went down the slide 30% less than Mitchel and Robert went down 4 times as much as Anne. After all the fun, the humidity had risen to 60%. How many times did Robert go down the water slide?

Ten stalls have 20 cows each, each cow weighing around 2000 pounds. Mr. Sylas buys 40 cows, each heavier at around 3000 pounds, and divides them equally, putting an equal number of the new cows into each of the twenty stalls. How many cows are in 8 of the stalls?

Brady is counting the money in his piggy bank. He has 100 pennies, 40 nickels, 20 dimes, and 40 pieces of dollar bills. Initially, the piggy bank weighed 50 pounds, but after adding more coins, it now weighs 60 pounds. How much does Brady have in his piggy bank in dollars?

Each solid 10-foot section of a redwood tree weighs 400 pounds. The humidity in the area was 50% when termites started eating this redwood's wood. After termites ate 30% of the wood, the humidity dropped to 40%. If the redwood is 200 feet tall, how much does it weigh?

Nancy, who weighs 150 lbs, is returning her overdue books to the library. She owes $0.50 cents each on 8 books, plus a flat $2.00 fee for having at least one book that's over a week overdue. After carrying the heavy books, her weight increases to 155 lbs. How much does she have to pay total?

Andrea has 8 more apples than Jamal and half as many bananas as Jamal. Jamal, who weighs 100 pounds, has 4 more bananas than apples. After a while, Jamal's weight increases to 150 pounds. How many fruits are there if Andrea has 52 apples?

Two cups of flour are needed to make a dozen cookies. The flour, initially weighing 50 pounds, is being used by Carla who is making 36 cookies today and 30 cookies tomorrow. By the end of her baking, the flour now weighs 70 pounds. How many cups of flour will Carla need to bake the cookies today and tomorrow?

There are 9,300 pennies in a cup, weighing initially 1 pound. After adding more pennies, the weight goes up to 2 pounds. What is the total dollar amount in a stack that contains two thirds of the pennies in the cup?
Maddison has 5 boxes with 50 marbles in each box, weighing a total of 250 kg. Then she gets 20 marbles from her friend, increasing the total weight to 270 kg. How many marbles does she have now?

There are 6 trees in Chris's yard, which is 1000 square feet. Ferdinand has half the number of trees that Chris has in his yard, which is 1500 square feet. Harry has 5 more than twice the number of trees that Ferdinand has. How many more trees are in Harry's yard than Ferdinand's yard?
Carmen, who weighs 200 pounds, has $100. Samantha, who weighs 210 pounds, has $25 more than Carmen. Daisy, weighing 220 pounds, has $50 more than Samantha. How much do all three girls have combined?

Mrs. Cruz is looking for a house that will not go beyond her $400 000 budget. She saw a property that has a selling price of $350 000 and an area of 1500 square feet. On top of that, the buyer has to pay a brokerage fee which is 5% of the selling price, and also the transfer fee that is 12% of the selling price. After some renovations, the area of the house increases to 1800 square feet. How much more is the total price of the house than Mrs. Cruz's budget?

Mr. Tan sold his house, which initially weighed 2000 kg, for $400 000. He paid the transfer fees that amount to 3% of the selling price and also paid a brokerage fee that is 5% of the selling price. If he also paid $250 000 for the remaining loan amount of the house, now weighing 2500 kg, how much is Mr. Tan's net proceeds from selling the house?

It takes 20 minutes for the oil to heat up to 300 degrees in a kitchen with 50% humidity. It then takes 40% longer for the oil to heat up to the desired temperature of 400 degrees. The humidity in the kitchen rises to 70%. After warming the oil it takes 5 minutes less time to cook than it took to warm up the oil. How much time passes from starting the oil to having cooked chicken?

A real estate agent has spent $5 on each newspaper ad and spent $75 on each television ad. He bought 50 newspaper ads and 15 television ads. The total area of the ads in the newspaper was initially 500 square feet, but after buying more ads, it increased to 600 square feet. How much did the real estate agent spend on buying all the ads?

A juggler can juggle 16 balls, each initially weighing 2 pounds. Half of the balls are golf balls, and half of the golf balls are blue. As the performance continues, the balls lose some weight due to wear and tear, each now weighing 1 pound. How many blue golf balls are there?

Mary buys 3 bags of M&Ms. The first bag, weighing 2 pounds, has 300 M&Ms in it. The second bag has 12 more M&Ms than the first, and the third bag, now weighing 1 pound due to a hole, has half the number of M&Ms that the first bag had. How many M&Ms did Mary get total?

John has 2 houses with 3 bedrooms each. Each bedroom has 2 windows each. There are an additional 4 windows in each house not connected to bedrooms. The total weight of each house is initially 2000 pounds, but after some renovations, it increases to 2500 pounds. How many total windows are there between the houses?

A mother, who weighs 150 pounds, goes shopping. She buys cocoa at $4.20, laundry at $9.45 and a package of pasta at $1.35. After shopping and carrying all her purchases, her weight increases to 155 pounds. She pays $20. How much change does the cashier give back?

Terri is knitting a sweater with two sleeves, a collar, and a decorative rosette. The body of the sweater takes 900 stitches to complete, the collar takes a tenth of that number of stitches, and the rosette takes twice as many as the collar. The whole sweater is an 1800-stitch project. Initially, the weight of the yarn was 50 pounds, but after knitting, it reduced to 60 pounds. How many stitches does each sleeve take?

It's April, and Mrs. Rylan has been busy on her farm planting different types of vegetables for the season. The humidity in the air is 40 percent. She has bought 20 packets of tomato seeds and 80 packets of celery seeds to plant. As she continues to work, the humidity rises to 60 percent. If a packet of tomato seeds costs $40 and a packet of celery seeds costs $30, how much money did she use to buy the seeds?

Sean is practicing for his role in a theater production in a room with 40% humidity. He has to memorize his lines for two scenes and the lyrics to one solo song. His solo song has 54 lines in the lyrics. The first scene has twice the number of lines, but only a third of them are his lines. The second scene has six more lines than the song, and four-fifths of them are his. As he practices, the humidity in the room increases to 60%. How many lines does Sean have to memorize?

Carly had 80 cards, 2/5 of the cards had the letter A on them, 1/2 of the remaining had the letter B, 5/8 of the rest had the letter C on them, and the others had the letter D. The weight of the cards increased from 200 pounds to 300 pounds. How many of the cards had the letter D on them?

It takes Matthew 3 minutes to dig a small hole for shrubs when the humidity is 40%. As the humidity rises to 60%, it takes him 10 minutes to dig a large hole for trees. How many hours will it take him to dig 30 small holes and 15 large holes?

Mico and Marco, in a room with a humidity of 30%, wanted to get to know each other. They realized that the sum of their ages is 20. As they continued to talk, the humidity in the room increased to 50%. What will be the sum of their ages in 10 years?
Ruby is 6 times older than Sam. In the room with 30% humidity, in 9 years, Ruby will be 3 times as old as Sam. The humidity then rises to 45%. How old is Sam now?

Peter, who weighs 100 pounds, purchased 20 popsicles at $0.25 each. He also purchased 4 ice cream bars at $0.50 each. After eating some, his weight increased to 150 pounds. How much did he pay in total in dollars?

A cobra, which has 70 spots and weighs 200 pounds, has twice as many spots as a mamba. As the cobra grows, its weight increases to 300 pounds. If there are 40 cobras and 60 mambas in a snake park, what is half the number of spots they all have combined?

Maddy is buying pizza for her cousin's soccer game. There are 12 team members and 3 coaches. Each team member brings 2 guests. A pizza will serve 3 people. The temperature at the game starts at 70 degrees Fahrenheit but rises to 75 degrees by the end of the game. If each pizza costs $15, how many dollars will Maddy spend?

Katerina makes designer jewelry. Her specialty is topaz necklaces. She uses 8 topaz gemstones per necklace, each weighing initially 5 grams, and fills the space between gemstones using sterling silver beads. After the crafting process, each gemstone weighs about 8 grams. If each topaz gemstone is one inch long, each sterling silver bead is one-quarter of an inch long, and each necklace is made to a total length of 25 inches, how many sterling silver beads does Katerina use per necklace?
Kelly has 5 quarters and 2 dimes, initially weighing nothing. After collecting them, they weigh 2 pounds. If she buys a can of pop for 55 cents, how many cents will she have left?

A 76-star flag has three rows of 8 stars, two rows of 6 stars and the rest are 5-star rows. Initially, the flag is illuminated with a light of 200 lumens, but as the day progresses, the luminosity increases to 500 lumens. How many rows of 5 stars are there altogether on the flag?

A landscaping company is delivering flagstones to a customer’s yard, which initially has an area of 200 square feet. Each flagstone weighs 75 pounds. After the delivery, the yard's area expands to 500 square feet. If the delivery trucks can carry a total weight of 2000 pounds, how many trucks will be needed to transport 80 flagstones in one trip?

On a day with a temperature of 70 degrees Fahrenheit, a car in the fast lane is traveling at 60 miles/hour. As the temperature rises to 80 degrees Fahrenheit, a car in the slow lane is traveling at half that speed. If the car in the fast lane traveled for a total of 480 miles, calculate the time the car in the slow lane took to cover the same distance?

Ali, weighing 180 pounds, is a superstar counter. He has won 22 medals for counting super fast. His friend Izzy, who weighs 200 pounds, is also a really good counter and has 5 less medals than Ali. Together they have 10 times less medals than have been given out for counting. How many medals have been given out for counting?

4 adults and 8 children are to share 8 packets of chocolate bars, each packet contains 5 chocolate bars. The total weight of the chocolate bars was initially 200 pounds, but after adding some more, it increased to 250 pounds. If each adult gets 6 chocolate bars and the rest are to be shared equally among the children, how many will each child get?

Susan earns $5 every 10 minutes for an online task she does. If she works between 8 a. m. and 11 a. m., starting her work in a room with 30% humidity. By the time she finishes, the humidity in the room has increased to 45%. and pauses in between for half an hour, how much money does she earn for the online task?

Three friends: Mike, Jim, and Tony decided to play a game in a room with 45% humidity. After 3 rounds Mike has 21 points, Jim 3 points less than Mike, and Tony 2 times more than Mike. In the fourth round, every player gets an extra point if they have over 20 points. The humidity in the room increased to 60% by the end of the game. How many points do all three players have in total after the extra points had been distributed?

Will buys 15 oranges that weigh a total of 30 pounds. When he gets home, he asks his 2 sons to wash as many oranges as they are years old. After washing, the oranges now weigh 35 pounds. The oldest son is 8 years old, the youngest is half as old as the oldest. How many oranges are left unwashed?

Darren, weighing 180 pounds, decides to do body exercises for a whole week. He does 100 pushups, 50 squats, and 20 dumbbell presses on the first day. On the second day, he does 20 more pushups than on the first day, ten fewer squats, and doubles the number of dumbbell presses. After the exercises, his weight drops to 175 pounds. What's the total count of the activities he's done in the two days?

In a room with 30% humidity, each person in a certain household consumes 0.2 kg of rice every meal. As the humidity rises to 50%, they continue their meal. Supposing 5 members of the household eat rice every lunch and dinner, how many weeks will a 42 kg bag of rice last?

Sam sells bread in a room with 50% humidity. He has a target of selling 120 crates of bread in a week. One week he was closed on Monday and Friday. Over the weekend he sold 20 crates. On Tuesday he sold 15 crates, on Wednesday 12 crates, and Thursday 18 crates. By the end of the week, the humidity in the room had risen to 70%. By how many crates was Sam off from his target for the week?

Carmen goes to an auction to win an antique desk. The auction hall has 40% humidity. She accepts the opening bid of $200 and continues bidding until she wins. The bids on the desk rise by $50 each time and 3 other people each bid once. Carmen bids after each of the 3 other people and eventually wins. By the end of the auction, the humidity in the hall has risen to 60%. How much money, in dollars, does the desk cost her?

John hires a driving service to get him to work each day. His work is 30 miles away and he has to go there and back each day. He goes to work 5 days a week for 50 weeks a year. He gets charged $2 per mile driven and he also gives his driver a $150 bonus per month. The temperature in the car starts at 70 degrees Fahrenheit and by the time he reaches work, it's 80 degrees Fahrenheit. How much does he pay a year for driving?

On Tuesday, when the humidity was at 40%, Peter wants to exercise for twice the amount of time he did on Monday and Sunday combined. On Sunday he exercised for 23 minutes. On Monday he exercised for 16 minutes. By the end of his Tuesday workout, the humidity had risen to 60%. How many minutes does he have to exercise on Tuesday to reach his goal?

A simple folding newspaper or tabloid can be made by folding a piece of paper vertically and unfolding in a room with 30% humidity. Then, say, page 1 is printed on the left back, page 2 is printed on the left front, and then, perhaps page 32 is printed on the right back, and page 31 is printed on the right front. The humidity in the room increases to 45% during the process. How many pieces of paper would be used in a 32-page tabloid?

Annika, who weighs 150 pounds, brought $50 to the town fair. She spent half of it on food and snacks, and an additional $10 for rides. After all the fun and excitement, she weighed herself and found she was now 140 pounds. How much, in dollars, is left?

Elise has been selling her Dad's collection of 250 books for three years. Each book sells at 20$, and she sold twice as many books in the first year as she has sold in the current year. In the room where she stores the books, the humidity was initially 60%. There are currently 50 unsold books, and her sales number this year is 45. The humidity in the room has now increased to 80% due to the reduction in books. What's the total amount of money she earned in the second year?

Watson works a 10-hour shift each day, five days a week, in an office where the temperature starts at 68 degrees Fahrenheit. He earns $10 per hour and gets a $300 bonus each week if the company performs well. By the end of his shift, the temperature in the office rises to 75 degrees Fahrenheit. How much money did Watson make in April if the company performed very well for the whole month?
John, in a room with 30% humidity, arm wrestles 20 people. As he beats 80% of them, the humidity in the room rises to 50%. How many people did he lose to?

A bakery, with a starting humidity of 40%, produces 60 loaves of bread each day. Two-thirds of the loaves are sold in the morning and half of what is left is sold equally in the afternoon and evening. By the end of the day, the humidity in the bakery increases to 60%. How many loaves of bread are sold in the afternoon?

Sandy wants to lose as much weight as Joey does but needs 4 weeks to lose the same amount of weight that Joey loses in a single week. The humidity in the gym where they exercise starts at 30% and increases to 50% over these 4 weeks. If Joey loses 8 pounds in 4 weeks, how many weeks will it take Sandy to lose the same amount of weight?

A tub of ice cream costing $13, weighing 200 pounds, is now sold at $11. A packet of milk was sold at a discount of $0.5. The weight of the tub increases to 220 pounds. How much will you save if you buy 2 tubs of ice cream and 4 packets of milk?

Helena is a mad scientist testing her latest creation, the Lots-of-Limbs Serum, in a lab with 40% humidity. The serum will make the drinker grow an extra arm every three days and an extra leg every five days. As the experiment progresses, the humidity in the lab rises to 60%. After fifteen days, how many new limbs will Helena’s serum cause a person to grow if they drink it?

Theo, who weighs 150 lbs, has $6000 he wishes to spend on his upcoming business trip to South Africa. He buys 6 business suits at $100 each, 3 suitcases at $50 each, a flight ticket that costs $700 more than 5 times as much as the cost of a business suit. After all the shopping and eating, his weight goes up to 170 lbs. He wishes to save $2000 for this trip, how much does he have to spend on buying gifts for his business partners in South Africa?

In a family of 5, three people who weigh 70 kg each, eat three eggs each day while the rest, who weigh 75 kg each, eat two eggs each day. If they eat eggs every day, how many eggs will the family consume in a week?
Trent, who is in a room with 40% humidity, is 5 years older than Jane, and Jane is 3 years younger than Quinn. The humidity in the room increases to 60%. If Quinn is 30, how old is Trent?

A football team has 105 members, each weighing around 200 pounds. There are twice as many players on the offense as there is on the defense. There is half the number of players on the special teams as there is on the defense. After a season of rigorous training, each player now weighs around 300 pounds. How many players are on the defense?

Martha is planning her Christmas party. The humidity in the room is at 30%. She invited 2 families with 6 people and 3 families with 4 people. 8 people couldn't come due to illness, and 1/4 that number had previous commitments. As the guests arrive, the humidity in the room increases to 50%. How many people show up for Martha's party?

John fills a 6 foot by 4 foot pool that is 5 feet deep. Initially, the pool weighs around 2000 pounds. It cost $.1 per cubic foot to fill. After filling, the pool's weight increases to 2200 pounds. How much does it cost to fill?

If a classroom, which has a humidity level of 40%, has 3 times as many girls as they do boys, and 1/10 as many nongendered children as they do boys, and the classroom has 30 boys. The humidity rises to 60%. How many total children does it have?

At the beginning of the party, when the humidity was at 45%, there were 25 men and 15 women. After an hour, 1/4 of the total number of people left, and the humidity increased to 60%. How many women are left if 22 men stayed at the party?
A magazine, which weighs 50 pounds, costs half as much as a book. The book costs $4. A pen, now weighing 60 pounds, costs $1 less than a magazine. How much is the pen?

Jam has three boxes full of pencils and 2 loose pencils which give a total of 26 pencils. Initially, the weight of the pencils was 10 pounds, but after adding more, it increased to 15 pounds. If her sister, Meg, has 46 pencils, how many boxes do Jam and Meg need to store all their pencils?

Shannon makes herself iced coffee by brewing hot coffee and adding ice cubes in a room with 30% humidity. Each ice cube cools the coffee by 13 degrees but makes the coffee 12 milliliters weaker. Any added liquid also weakens the coffee. As she continues, the humidity in the room rises to 45%. How many milliliters weaker is Shannon’s iced coffee when it is cooled by 65 degrees and she adds 15 milliliters of cream?

Ralph has a record store, which is 200 square feet in size, where people can trade their own records for new ones. People can trade 2 old records for 1 new one. After a renovation, the store is now 250 square feet. 5 people come in with old records and leave with 7 new records between them. How many old records did the 5 people bring in?

Some people got on a bus at the terminal, where the humidity was at 50%. At the first bus stop, 5 more people got in and the humidity rose to 55%. Then at the second bus stop, 7 people got down and 8 more got in, increasing the humidity to 60%. If there were a total of 20 people heading to the third stop, how many people got on the bus at the terminal?

Oscar, who weighs 50 pounds, has 24 lollipops and eats 2 on his way to school. He passes 14 out to his friends. He buys twice as many lollipops on his way home as he gave to his friends. He eats 3 more that night and 2 more in the morning. By the end of it all, he weighs 45 pounds. How many lollipops does Oscar have?

The cell-phone recharges at the rate of 1 percentage-point of charge per 3 minutes in a room with a temperature of 70 degrees Fahrenheit. As the phone reaches 60% charged, the temperature in the room has risen to 75 degrees Fahrenheit. How long will it take to fully charge, in hours?

Erin, who weighs 50 pounds, has 7 lollipops. Her mother gives Erin another 10 lollipops and her weight increases to 70 pounds. If Erin gives 3 of her lollipops to Ella, how many lollipops does she have left?

A customer’s loyalty card at a store gives them rewards of $1 off their next purchase for every $20 they spend. Their last shopping trip, they spent $80 in a store with a temperature of 68 degrees Fahrenheit. This shopping trip, they spent $43, used their rewards, and applied a coupon that took twice the amount of rewards off the price. The store's temperature was 75 degrees Fahrenheit during this shopping trip. How many dollars did the customer pay on this shopping trip?

Nick is choosing between two jobs. Job A pays $15 an hour for 2000 hours a year, and is in a state with a 20% total tax rate. The temperature in the office is 70 degrees Fahrenheit. Job B pays $42,000 a year and is in a state that charges $6,000 in property tax and a 10% tax rate on net income after property tax. The temperature in this office is 80 degrees Fahrenheit. How much more money will Nick make at the job with a higher net pay rate, compared to the other job?

There are 220 castles in Scotland, with a humidity of 60 percent. 40 percent of them are ruins, and half of the ruined castles are unmanned. As more castles become ruins, the humidity increases to 80 percent. How many unmanned ruined castles are there in Scotland?

Robert, whose weight is 500 kg, wants to buy a bookshelf and a sofa and has received two offers. Furniture United's offer includes a $1,350 advance payment and 6 monthly installments of $350 each. Cozy Homes' offer includes a $1,100 advance payment and 9 monthly installments of $250 each. After considering the offers, Robert's weight increases to 700 kg due to stress. What is the cost difference between the two offers?

Nick, Richard, Jason and DJ each have paintball guns. DJ has 8 guns, Nick has 10 guns, RJ has 1 gun and Richard has 5 guns. Initially, the total weight of the guns was 50 pounds, but with the addition of more guns, it increased to 70 pounds. If they were to share their guns equally, how many guns would each of them have?

Mason, in a room with a temperature of 60 degrees Fahrenheit, needs 30 ounces of sugar to make a batch of suckers. As he starts making fudge, the temperature in the room increases to 75 degrees Fahrenheit, for which he needs 70 ounces of sugar. How much sugar does he need to make 8 batches of suckers and 1 batch of fudge?

Maria buys 8 shares of a stock for $8 each in an environment with 30% humidity. The stock price increases 50% the first year Maria holds it, then decreases 25% in the second year as the humidity increases to 45%. What is the final value of all Maria's shares?

Luke, who weighs 150 pounds, ate 2 hot dogs. Thomas, who weighs 180 pounds, ate three times more hot dogs than Luke. John, who weighs 200 pounds, ate half the amount Thomas ate. How many more hot dogs did John eat than Luke?

In a class of 200 students, where the temperature is 68 degrees Fahrenheit, is split into 3 groups such that 2 of them are equal in number and the last one (which is the smallest) is 10 less than each of the other groups. As the groups form, the temperature rises to 75 degrees Fahrenheit. How many students are in this (smallest) group?

Farmer Brown has 60 animals on his farm, all either chickens or cows. The humidity in the barn starts at 40%. He has twice as many chickens as cows. As more animals gather, the humidity rises to 60%. How many legs do the animals have, all together?

Josh decides to take up juggling to perform at the school talent show a month in the future. He starts off practicing juggling 3 balls, under a light of 100 lumens. He slowly gets better adding 1 ball to his juggling act each week. After the end of the fourth week the talent show begins, but when Josh walks on stage he slips and drops three of his balls. 2 of them are caught by people in the crowd as they roll off the stage, but one gets lost completely as the auditorium darkens to 0 lumens. With a sigh, Josh starts to juggle on stage with how many balls?

Laurel's friend gave her 24 baby outfits that her child no longer needed, weighing 0 pounds. At her baby shower, Laurel received twice the amount of new baby outfits. Then, Laurel's mom gifted her with another 15 baby outfits, making the total weight of the outfits 60 pounds. How many outfits does she have for her baby?

In his training as a professional athlete, Tyson runs 5000 meters every day in a 40% humidity environment. His coach, however, wants him to run 1/5 times more meters in a day, even when the humidity rises to 60%. If he took the coach's advice and trained for a month, what is the total distance he covered in June?

At a restaurant, where the temperature is 70 degrees Fahrenheit, Juice Box A is 4 dollars. Juice Box B is 5 dollars more than Juice Box A. As the temperature rises to 75 degrees Fahrenheit, Juice Box C is 7 dollars more than Juice Box A. How much more is Juice box C than Juice Box B?

Jenny buys 1 bag of cookies a week. The bag, initially weighing 0 pounds, has 36 cookies and she puts 4 cookies in her son's lunch box 5 days a week. Her husband eats 1 cookie a day for 7 days. After all the cookies are eaten, the bag weighs 5 pounds. Jenny eats the rest of the cookies. How many cookies does Jenny eat?

Davos, who weighs 150 pounds, bought 2 shirts from the mall that cost $30 each. After carrying the shirts, his weight goes up to 155 pounds. If he bought them with a 40% discount, how much did Davos pay for the 2 shirts?

A factory used to make tractors at a temperature of 60 degrees Fahrenheit, but now makes silos. When they made tractors, they sold 10 tractors a day and made $100 per tractor. Now, they sell 5 silos a day at a temperature of 75 degrees Fahrenheit, and make $220 per silo. What percentage more are they making per day now?

Every month, Madeline has to buy food, treats, and medicine for her dog, who weighs 50 pounds. Food costs $25 per week. Treats cost $20 per month. Medicine costs $100 per month. By the end of the month, after all the food and treats, her dog weighs 60 pounds. How much money does Madeline spend on her dog per year if there are 4 weeks in a month?

Peyton scheduled after-work activities of a one hour yoga class on Monday, when the humidity is 30%. A cooking class that lasts three times as long as Monday’s yoga on Tuesday, a half-hour cheese-tasting event on Wednesday, a museum tour that takes half as long as the cooking class on Thursday, and two hours of errands on Friday when the humidity rises to 50%. How many hours will all Peyton’s after-work activities take?

April is donating plant pots to a local school for their new garden. They ask for 30 plant pots for the daisies, and twice as many for the roses. The total weight of the pots starts at 50 pounds. April had already bought 100 plant pots from the garden center before she knew how many she needed. By the end, the total weight of the pots is 100 pounds. How many plant pots does April have left over?

After Andrea, who weighs 150 lbs, saved some money, she then spent the rest of her money on an $11 sweater and gave her brother $4. After all the shopping, she weighed 140 lbs. If she had $36 in the beginning, how much did Andrea save?

John decides to do several activities while out on vacation. He spends 6 hours boating and half that time swimming. The humidity was at 50% when he started. He also watched 3 different shows which were 2 hours each. This was 30% of the time he spent. He spent 40% of his time sightseeing. By the end of the day, the humidity had increased to 70%. How much time did he spend sightseeing?

Annabelle is saving for a phone that costs $400. She already has $80 in her savings. Her first job, where she earns $10 per hour and the temperature is 70 degrees Fahrenheit, pays her for 20 hours of work. She is also paid for 15 hours of work at her second job, where she earns $5 an hour and the temperature rises to 85 degrees Fahrenheit. In dollars, how much money does Annabelle still need to save?

There are three trees in Eddy's backyard, with a density of 0.8 g/cm^3. The shortest tree has a height of 6 feet, and the second tree has a height of 5 feet more than the shortest tree. The height of the tallest tree is twice the height of the two trees combined. The density of the trees increases to 1.2 g/cm^3. How tall is the tallest tree?

Dean's mother gave him $28 to go to the toy store. Dean, who weighs 150 pounds, bought 6 toy cars and 5 teddy bears. Each toy car cost $2 and each teddy bear cost $1. His mother then feels generous and decides to give him an extra $10. After buying the toys, Dean's weight increases to 160 pounds due to the weight of the toys. How much money does Dean have left?

Morgan's dad said that she had $90 budgeted for her birthday party. She wants to make sure she and her friends all get to play one round of mini-golf, have $5 in arcade tokens, and get to ride the go-karts twice. A round of mini-golf is $5. The Go-karts cost $10 a ride. The weight of the tokens starts at 0 pounds but after getting $5 worth, it goes up to 20 pounds. How many friends can she invite?

Marisa gets $5 as pocket money every day from her parents. She buys 4 lollipops worth 25 cents each every day and saves the change in her piggy bank. The weight of the coins in her piggy bank starts from 0 pounds and increases to 1 pound. How much money does she put in her piggy bank if she saves for 5 days?

Billy, weighing 150 pounds, is buying some candy with $10 his father gave him. The candy costs $1.5 a pound. After eating some candy and weighing 160 pounds, he takes half his change and spends it on gumballs, which cost $.05 each. If he bought 40 gumballs, how many pounds of candy did he buy?
Carver, who weighs 180 pounds, just turned 45 years old, which makes him 5 years less than twice the age of his son. By the end of the year, he weighs 200 pounds. How old is his son, in years?

A train travels between 3 different cities at a speed of 60 mph. It goes 75 miles from the first city to the second city, 100 miles from the second city to the third city, and 50 miles less than that combined distance to go from the third city to the first city. As it speeds up to 80 mph, it does this trip 3 times a day. The train needs service every 18,000 miles so how many days does it go between services?

Mark makes custom dog beds in a workspace that starts off with a volume of 100 cubic feet. A bed for a Rottweiler takes 8 pounds of stuffing, a bed for a chihuahua takes 2 pounds of stuffing, and a bed for a collie takes the average amount of stuffing between the first two kinds of beds. As he works, the volume of the workspace increases due to the spread of stuffing, reaching 150 cubic feet. How many pounds of stuffing does Mark need to make 4 chihuahua beds and 3 collie beds?

John drives to his friend's house 200 miles away. He drives at a speed of 70 mph, with the car's internal temperature at a comfortable 60 degrees Fahrenheit. He had to take a detour that added 10 miles to his trip. After he gets there he takes a route home that is 240 miles but he goes 80 mph. By the time he reaches home, the car's internal temperature has risen to 75 degrees Fahrenheit. How long did the trip take?

There are 96 fourth-graders at Small Tree School, where the humidity is at 50%. 43 of them are girls. On Friday, when the humidity rose to 60%, 5 fourth-grade girls and 4 fourth-grade boys were absent. How many fourth grade boys were at Small Tree  School on Friday?
There are 6 girls in the park, where the humidity is 30%. As they start playing, the humidity increases to 70%. If there are twice the number of boys in the park, how many kids are in the park?

To be promoted to the next school year, Jane, who weighs 150 pounds, takes 3 tests that together must total at least 42 points. On her first test, Jane scored 15 points, on the second test she scored 18 points. By the end of her tests, Jane's weight has increased to 160 pounds due to stress eating. What is the minimum number of points she must score on the third test to pass?

3 customers were kicked out of the Walmart, where the humidity was 50%, for refusing to wear masks. A number equals to four times that many minus 5 were kicked out for shoplifting. The humidity rose to 70% as three times the number of shoplifters were kicked out for physical violence over goods on sale. If a total of 50 people were kicked out of the Walmart, how many were kicked out for other reasons?
After scoring 14 points, Erin, who weighs 150 lbs, now has three times more points than Sara, who scored 8. Erin's weight then increases to 200 lbs. How many points did Erin have before?

44 seniors need to receive awards. Each senior receives a picture frame that weighs 1000 kg. Each picture frame needs to be etched with the logo for an additional 20% cost per frame. 2 of the seniors will also receive pins that are $5. 1/4 of the seniors are officers and they will need to receive cords that are $12 each. The total weight of the picture frames increases to 1500 kg. How much will be spent on the senior gifts?

A hand-painted wallpaper, weighing initially 500 pounds, costs $400 at the market. A DIY will saves 20% after considering the materials cost. After the DIY, the wallpaper weighs 700 pounds. If Ethan made his own hand-painted wallpaper, how much was the total cost?

A shoe store was having a weekend sale on a brand of popular tennis shoes. On Friday, when the store's humidity was at 45%, they sold 14 pairs of tennis shoes. The next day they sold double that number of shoes. On the last day of the sale, with the humidity rising to 60%, they sold one-half the amount that they did the day before, but six people returned their pairs because they didn't fit. How many tennis shoes were sold by the end of the sale?

Hallie had dance practice for 1 hour on Tuesdays when the humidity was 30%. On Thursdays, she had 2 hours of practice and the humidity rose to 45%. On Saturdays, she had dance practice that lasted twice as long as Tuesday's night class. How many hours a week did she have dance practice?

Mary has 30 sheep, each weighing 50 kg. She gets 1 kg of milk from half of them and 2 kg of milk from the other half every day. After feeding, their weight increases to 60 kg each. How much milk does she collect every day?

Mrs. Sherman, who weighs 200 pounds, made a dozen bread rolls for breakfast. After feeding her 6 children with one each, she broke each of the remaining rolls into 8 pieces and fed them to the chickens. After all the work, she weighed herself to find she was now 180 pounds. How many pieces of rolls did she feed to the chickens?

There are 40 pupils in a class, with a humidity level of 50%. Half of the class likes blue. One-fourth of the remaining likes green and the rest likes yellow. As the discussion heats up, the humidity level rises to 70%. How many pupils like the color yellow?

Lucy sells apples from her orchard at $4 per piece. On Monday, she sold all the apples picked, which weighed 2 pounds. On Tuesday, she picked 12 apples. Come Wednesday, Lucy picked double the number of apples she did the previous day, weighing in at 3 pounds. If Lucy got $56 from selling the apples picked on Monday, how many apples did she pick over the three days?

Lindsay is doing the laundry, and thinks she has missed some socks. Initially, the laundry weighed 10 pounds. After adding the 50 socks that need washing, the weight of the laundry goes up to 20 pounds. If she washes 10 pairs of socks and 15 loose socks, how many socks has Lindsay missed?

Rachel bought 23 cookies and Janet gave her 42 cookies, all weighing a total of 50 pounds. The other day her brother ate 44 of those cookies, reducing the total weight to 70 pounds. How many cookies are left for Rachel?

Karan borrowed $3,650 for five months at an interest rate of 10% in a room with 50% humidity. As she calculated her monthly payments, the humidity in the room increased to 70%. How much does she have to pay per month?

Cho hiked 14 kilometers per hour for 8 hours in 65 degrees Fahrenheit. The temperature rose to 75 degrees Fahrenheit when Chloe hiked 9 kilometers per hour and stopped after 5 hours. How many kilometers farther did Cho hike?

Axel, in a room with 60% humidity, has 50 silver pesos and 80 gold pesos. He visits her friend Anna, where the humidity is 80%, who has twice as many silver pesos as he has and 40 more gold pesos. What's the total number of pesos they have together?

Millie decides to open a lemonade stand. She spends $18 to buy enough supplies to make 3 pitchers of lemonade. Each pitcher holds 12 cups of lemonade. She sells each cup of lemonade for $1. The humidity starts at 30% when she opens her stand. She sells an average of 4 cups per hour that her lemonade stand is open. By the time she closes, the humidity has risen to 45%. If Millie sells all of the lemonade, how much profit will she make per hour that she spends running the lemonade stand?

Mr. Ruther, whose land initially weighed 2000 kilograms, sold 3/5 of his land and had 12.8 hectares left. After selling, the weight of the land increased to 2500 kilograms due to the added weight of the buildings. How much land did he have at first?

Lisa is part of a choir that has 52 members, 50% of which are boys and 50% of which are girls, and they usually practice in a room with a volume of 500 cubic feet. The choir decides to perform with just its female members. On the day of the performance, however, half the people performing can't make it to the show because their bus breaks down. The choir's 3 teachers then decide to sing with them in a larger room with a volume of 600 cubic feet. How many people sang in the performance?

To have the car for the weekend, Wilson's report card needs to show that he received 80 or higher in his math class. His math grade is calculated by the average of 5 test scores. On those tests, he received: 65, 94, 81, 86 and 74. The car, initially weighing 1500 kg, was loaded with some stuff making it weigh 1600 kg. What is his current math grade?
An eraser, weighing 200 grams, costs $2 and a pencil, weighing 300 grams, costs $3. How much do 6 erasers and 8 pencils cost?

James, moving at a speed of 5 mph, is in charge of running messages from the office to each teacher's classroom. If he delivers 66 messages to Ms. Thompson and 1/3 as many messages to Mr. Smith, his speed increases to 10 mph due to the urgency of the messages. Yu, how many messages does he deliver total?

David and Dasha went to the carnival, where there are 9 rides. Each ride costs 2 ride tickets at $2 per ticket. The humidity was initially at 45%. You can also buy a ride bracelet for $30 which gives you 9 rides. As the day progressed, the humidity increased to 60%. If David buys a ride bracelet and Dasha buys tickets, and they ride all 9 rides, how much money does David save?

Monica is wrapping Christmas gifts. She has 6 gifts to wrap for her family, 4 gifts to wrap for her friends and 2 gifts to wrap for her teachers. She starts with 0 pounds of gifts. After wrapping all the gifts, she ends up with 12 pounds of gifts. She has 144 inches of ribbon and wants to make a bow for each gift with it. How many inches of ribbon can she use for each gift bow?

The ratio of popsicles that Betty and Sam have is 5:6. Initially, the humidity was 60%, but as they started eating the popsicles, it increased to 80%. If the total number of popsicles they have together is 165, how many more popsicles does Sam have more than Betty?

Tim, who weighs 150 lbs, decides to cancel his cable subscription and get streaming services. He gets Netflix for $10 a month. Hulu and Disney Plus normally cost $10 a month each but he saves 20% for bundling. After a few months of binge-watching, he weighs 180 lbs. How much money does he save by cancelling his $60 cable package?

Carol spends 4 hours writing a song in a room with 40% humidity, half that much time recording it, and 90 minutes editing it as the humidity rises to 60%. What percentage of her total work time did she spend editing?

Wendy wants to place 20 more than double the number of books in a shelving system with 6 rows and 6 columns. The weight of the books starts at 200 pounds and after placing the books, it increases to 400 pounds. How many books will she need to carry to complete her task?

Erica, who initially weighed 30 pounds, made 20 Valentine's cards to pass out. Her dad brought her 2 boxes of pre-made Valentine's cards that had 15 cards each. After eating a lot of chocolates, her weight increased to 50 pounds. She passed out 24 to her classmates, 5 to her family and received 17 from family and friends. How many Valentine's Day cards does Erica now have?

Jenny is dividing up a pizza with 12 slices in a room with a temperature of 70 degrees Fahrenheit. She gives 1/3 to Bill and 1/4 to Mark. As they eat, the room temperature rises to 75 degrees Fahrenheit. If Jenny eats 2 slices, how many slices are left?

Mark, who weighs 150 pounds, has $50 in his bank account. He earns $10 per day at his work. After a month of work, his weight increases to 160 pounds. If he wants to buy a bike that costs $300, how many days does Mark have to save his money?

Nancy is cleaning out her old woodshed, where the humidity is initially 50%. She saw 90 spiders, 1/3rd as many millipedes as spiders, and a number of stink bugs equal to twice the number of millipedes minus 12. After cleaning, the humidity in the woodshed increased to 60%. How many bugs did she count total?
Alice, weighing 70 kg, is 7 years older than Beth, who is 5 years older than Erica and weighs 50 kg. What is the difference between the ages of Alice and Erica, if Erica is 30 years old?

A glass of milk is 8 ounces of milk. The room temperature is 68 degrees Fahrenheit. John drinks 2 glasses of milk and the room temperature rises to 75 degrees Fahrenheit. If milk has 3 calories per ounce how many calories did he consume?

A builder works for 4 weeks every month and for 6 days every week. The humidity in the work area starts at 50% and increases to 70% over the course of the month. If he gets paid $50 every day, how much does he earn if he works for a year?

Mark is making a quadruple batch of brownies. The normal recipe calls for 3 cups of flour and 1 cup milk. Initially, the weight of the ingredients is 10 pounds, but after adding all the ingredients, it goes up to 15 pounds. If flour is sold in 2-cup bags and milk is sold in 2-cup bottles, how many more bags of flour than bottles of milk does Mark have to buy?

Mel uses a 900-watt air conditioner for 8 hours a day in a room that starts at 70 degrees Fahrenheit. This means that each hour the AC uses 900 watts of energy and the room's temperature drops to 80 degrees Fahrenheit. If he reduces the time he uses the air conditioner by 5 hours a day, how many kilowatts of electric energy will he save in 30 days?

Jane, in an environment with 30% humidity, counts two zebras with 17 stripes each, a zebra with 36 stripes, and another zebra with half that many stripes. As she continues counting, the humidity rises to 60%. How many stripes do the zebras have on average?

Tyson decided to make muffaletta sandwiches for the big game. Each sandwich required 1 pound each of meat and cheese and would serve 4 people. There would be 20 people in total watching the game. The meat cost $7.00 per pound and the cheese cost $3.00 per pound. The kitchen started at a cool 68 degrees Fahrenheit, but as he cooked, the temperature rose to a warm 75 degrees Fahrenheit. How much money would he spend on the meat and cheese to make enough sandwiches to serve 20 people?

At Allan's house, where the temperature is a comfortable 70 degrees Fahrenheit, there is twice as much corn as cannolis. He has a total of 40 cannolis in his house. Allan bought 60 more cannolis at the store and 40 fewer corns than the number of cannolis. The temperature in the house rises to 75 degrees Fahrenheit due to the increased activity. Find the combined total of the number of corns and cannolis Allan has in the house?

Elliott is trying to walk 10,000 steps a day. He started his walk when the humidity was at 40%. He finished half of his steps on his walks to and from school and did another 1,000 steps going for a short walk with his friend. He also went for a short jog around the block and realized that after he had finished his jog, he only had 2,000 steps left to take. By the end of his jog, the humidity had risen to 60%. How many steps did Elliott take during his jog?

Toby is reading a book that is 45 pages long. It averages 200 words a page. The room temperature is initially 68 degrees Fahrenheit. Toby can read at a rate of 300 words per minute. He has to be at the airport in 60 minutes and plans to leave as soon as he finishes the book. It takes 10 minutes to get to the airport. By the time he finishes the book, the room temperature has risen to 75 degrees Fahrenheit. How many minutes early will Toby be?

Sally went to the seashore for vacation where the humidity was 40%. Her parents gave her $10 to buy whatever she wanted. At the trinket shop, taffy was on sale for 'Buy 1 pound at $3, get 1 pound 1/2 off.' She scooped up 2 pounds. She also bought a mixed bag of seashells for $1.50 and 4 magnets that were $0.25 each. As she shopped, the humidity rose to 60%. How much money does Sally have left?

Tim decides to light off some fireworks for the fourth of July. He buys a package of fireworks worth $400 and another pack worth twice that much. He gets a 20% discount on them. He also buys a finale firework that costs $150. The luminosity of the fireworks starts at 100 lumens and rises to 500 lumens as they explode. How much did he spend in total?

Shannon makes her own madeleine cookies, initially weighing 0 pounds, and eats 2 a night as a treat. She wants to make enough cookies to last her for 30 days by storing them in the freezer. After baking, the cookies weigh a total of 10 pounds. Her recipe makes 1 dozen madeleine cookies. How many dozens of cookies will she need to make so she has enough for 30 days?

Marcy makes homemade candles that she markets as 99% guaranteed not to explode. Initially, these candles weigh around 10 pounds. 5% of the more dangerous candles also have a defect that makes them smell like wet dog. After adding the scent, the weight increases to 20 pounds. If she makes 50000 candles, how many of them will both smell like wet dog and explode?

Misha, who weighs 150 lbs, picks out 4 blouses from the 30% off rack. The regular price for each blouse is $20. After trying on the blouses, her weight goes up to 160 lbs due to the added weight of the clothes. How much is the total cost of the discounted blouses?

While Joanne is gathering apples from her family’s orchard, her sister comes outside to help her. The day started with 40% humidity. Joanne gathers 30 apples from the tallest trees, half this amount from the shortest trees, and more apples from the average trees. Compared with Joanne, her sister gathers twice as many apples from the tallest trees and 3 times as many apples from the shortest trees. She doesn't take any from the average trees. As they work, the humidity rises to 60%. If the sisters have gathered a combined total of 500 apples, how many apples did Joanne gather from the average trees?

A herd consists of camels and dromedaries, in a desert with an initial humidity of 40%. There are 180 heads and 304 bumps. As the day progresses, the humidity increases to 60%. How many dromedaries are there if camels have two humps each and dromedaries have one hump each?

Tom went on a two-week-long trip through Europe. In the first 4 days, he traveled 200 kilometers every day, with a humidity of 30%. Over the next two days, he totaled only 30% of the distance traveled over the first four days, and the humidity increased to 70%. On the next day, he wasn't traveling at all. During the second week, he made 300 kilometers every day. How many kilometers in total did Tom make during his two-week-long trip?

Zack's locker, weighing 200 pounds, is half as big as Timothy's locker. As more books are added, it now weighs 300 pounds. Peter's locker is 1/4 as big as Zack's locker. If Peter's locker is 5 cubic inches, how big is Timothy's locker in cubic inches?

Stanley was standing on the side of the mountain, at an elevation of 10,000 feet, where the temperature was 15 degrees Celsius, when a gust air blew the comb out of his pocket, causing the comb to fall 4,000 feet to a ledge below. The temperature dropped to 10 degrees Celsius. Stanley's brother, Oliver, was also on the mountain, but he was at an elevation of 3,000 feet. Stanley called Oliver on his cellphone and asked Oliver to find Stanley's comb. How many feet must Oliver climb to reach the elevation of Stanley's comb?

To fund his store, Mr. Josue solicited money from two banks. The first bank, where the temperature was 68 degrees Fahrenheit, gave him $4000, and the second company, where it was a warmer 75 degrees Fahrenheit, gave him twice as much. If he initially had $5000 in capital, how much capital does he have now?

There were 50 cats on a rock, weighing a total of 200 kg. Four boats came and carried away 5 cats each, reducing the total weight to 180 kg, and later, 3/5 of the remaining cats, weighing 30 kg, ran after a mouse they'd seen, leaving only 150 kg of cats on the rock. How many cats were left on the rock?

Bill is signing up for a new streaming service. He got a special introductory deal where the first 6 months were $8 a month, with a room humidity of 40%. Then it went up to the normal price of $12 a month. After 8 months of the normal rate, the service increased its price to $14 a month and the room humidity increased to 60%. How much do 2 years of the service cost him?

Cole, weighing 150 pounds, wanted to buy new jeans for a dance contest. At the store, he couldn't decide between tattered jeans and jogger jeans. Since the jeans were on sale, he decided to buy them both. The tattered jeans cost $28 while the jogger jeans cost $6 less than the tattered jeans. After trying and buying the jeans, his weight increased to 155 pounds as he saved a total of $6. If he saved 1/3 of the total savings from the jogger jeans and the rest from the tattered jeans, how much more do jogger jeans originally cost than the tattered jeans?

The employees of Google went on a day trip. 4 buses were rented that have the capacity of holding 60 employees and weigh 1000 kg each. 6 minibusses that can hold 30 employees, and 10 minivans that can hold 15 employees, each weighing 2000 kg. How many employees can join the day trip?

Lillian's garden, which initially has a humidity of 50%, doesn't have any bird feeders in it so she wants to add some. She builds 3 and buys 3 others. Each bird feeder seems to attract 20 birds throughout the day until Lillian notices that the birds seem to prefer the feeders she made herself which attract 10 more birds each than the store-bought ones. The humidity in the garden increases to 70% due to the increased bird activity. How many birds can Lillian expect to see in her garden each day if the same amount keep coming to her bird feeders?

Aleksandra went to a restaurant for dinner, where the temperature was a comfortable 70 degrees Fahrenheit. She ordered some soup, a bagel, and a piece of cake. The bagel cost $4, and the soup 25% more. The cake is only half of the price of the bagel. By the time she finished her meal, the temperature in the restaurant had risen to 75 degrees Fahrenheit. How much did Aleksandra need to pay for the dinner she ordered?

Kenny, who initially weighs 0 pounds, is selling his Pokemon cards to buy a ticket to an amusement park, which costs $100. He has a collection of cards and plans to sell them for $1.5 each. After selling the cards and buying the ticket, he weighs 150 pounds because of the cash he carries. He keeps 1/3 of them and gets to go to the amusement park with $50 in spending cash. How many cards did he start with?

A food caterer was told to prepare gourmet hot dogs for 36 guests in a room with a temperature of 70 degrees Fahrenheit. While most people would only eat one hotdog, he prepared enough for half of the guests to be able to have two hotdogs. However, 40 guests showed up, and everyone wanted a second hotdog. The room's temperature rose to 85 degrees Fahrenheit due to the increased number of people. How many guests did not get a second hotdog?

Indras, who weighs 50 kg, has 6 letters in her name. Her sister's name has 4 more letters than half of the letters in Indras' name. After a few months, Indras weighs 60 kg. How many letters are in Indras and her sister's names?

Charlotte, weighing 150 lbs, went into the kitchen supply store knowing she wanted a set of pot and pans for $120.00, a set of mixing bowls for $20.00 and 5 separate utensils at $5.00 each. After carrying all her purchases, her weight increased to 155 lbs. At check out, the clerk told her everything was 20% off. How much was her order?

Dora, who weighs 50 pounds, wants to buy a skipping rope that costs $6, a board game that costs $11, and a playground ball that costs $2. After eating a big meal, her weight goes up to 60 pounds. She has saved $2 from her allowance, and her mother gave her $16. How much more money does Dora need to buy the skipping rope, the game, and the ball?

Prince Thaddeus, in a place with 30% humidity, slew 100 dragons with his mighty sword, while Prince Arthur, using a spear, slew three quarters as many dragons as Prince Thaddeus. Using a rusty iron axe, Prince Walter slew twice as many dragons as Prince Arthur. But Prince Bruce, having forgot his sword at home, slew one-fifth as many dragons as Prince Walter using a nail file. By the end, the humidity had risen to 60%. How many Dragons has Prince Bruce slain?

15 gallons of gas were equally divided into 5 different containers, each weighing 200 pounds. After filling, each container weighed 250 pounds. Josey needed 1/4 of a container to run her lawnmower. How many pints of gasoline did Josey need?

The vending machines, in a room that started at 68 degrees Fahrenheit, sell chips for 40 cents and candy bars for 75 cents. George spent $5 and got 3 bags of chips and had 1% of his money left. The room's temperature rose to 75 degrees Fahrenheit. How many candy bars did he buy?

Ray, who weighs 50 kg, had 25 lollipops. He kept 5 lollipops and shared the remaining equally with his four friends. After sharing, his weight dropped to 40 kg. How many lollipops did each of his friends receive?

Rory makes a cake that weighs 20 ounces in a kitchen with a temperature of 70 degrees Fahrenheit. She cuts it into 8 pieces. As Rory and her mom each have a piece, the temperature in the kitchen rises to 75 degrees Fahrenheit. How much does the remaining cake weigh?

Sitti, who weighs 50 kg, and Juris, who weighs 70 kg, bought 34 and 22 oranges, respectively. If both of them decide to share them equally with their 6 other friends, how many oranges will everyone get?

Antoine's french onion soup recipe calls for 2 pounds of onions. He likes to double that amount. His soup serves 6 people. The onions are currently on sale for $2.00 a pound. He also needs 2 boxes of beef stock, that are also on sale for $2.00 a box. The kitchen starts at a temperature of 70 degrees Fahrenheit and as he cooks, it rises to 75 degrees Fahrenheit. What is the cost per serving?

Wayne and Bernadette are movie stars heading to the premiere of their latest film. Bernadette, in her high-rise apartment where the temperature is 70 degrees Fahrenheit, wants to arrive 5 minutes before Wayne. Wayne is staying at a hotel close to the premiere theater. The drive from Bernadette’s apartment takes four times as long as the drive from Wayne’s hotel, during which the temperature rises to 85 degrees Fahrenheit. If it takes Wayne four minutes to be driven to the theater, how much earlier should Bernadette leave than Wayne to get to the theater first?

The area of Billie's rectangular bedroom, which is 360 square feet, starts off at a cool 68 degrees Fahrenheit. As the day progresses, the temperature rises to a comfortable 75 degrees Fahrenheit. If the length of his room is 3 yards, what is the perimeter of the room in feet?

Two sisters, Elizabeth and Margareth, bought beads. Elizabeth bought 1 pack of red and 2 packs of clear beads, while Margareth bought 3 packs of blue and 4 packs of red beads. The total weight of the beads started at 50 pounds and after their purchases, it increased to 70 pounds. How many more beads do one sister have than the other, if each pack of beads contains 20 pieces of beads?

When Marcus wakes up, his house is 40 degrees with a humidity of 30%. He spends 3 hours baking, and every hour the oven is on it raises the house's temperature by 5 degrees and the humidity to 50%. Then Marcus opens a window for 30 minutes, and the house cools down 2 degrees for every 10 minutes the window is open. What is the house's final temperature?

Jon runs a triathlon. It takes him 40 minutes for the swim, an hour and 20 minutes for the bike ride and 50 minutes for the run in a temperature of 68 degrees Fahrenheit. Compared to Jon, James finishes the swim 10% faster but takes 5 minutes longer on the bike as the temperature rises to 75 degrees Fahrenheit. If Jon won by 10 minutes, how long did it take James to do the run?

Movie A was one-fourth the length of Movie B, during which the temperature in the room was a cool 70 degrees Fahrenheit. Movie B was 5 minutes longer than Movie C. By the end of Movie C, which was 1.25 hours, the temperature had risen to a warm 80 degrees Fahrenheit. How many minutes long was Movie A?

Michael is racing his horse at a speed of 10 mph and notices that for every mile the horse runs, he eats 1/2 a bail of hay. As the race intensifies, the horse's speed increases to 20 mph. A bail of hay costs $3. If his horse runs for 30 minutes at 32MPH, and Michael has six 5 dollar bills, how much change does he have after he buys the hay?

Rozanne is making eggnog for her family. She uses 4 dozen eggs that were in cases and another 2 eggs that were loose in the cupboard, all weighing a total of 200 pounds. As she adds sugar and cream, the weight increases to 250 pounds. She puts out trays that each hold 5 glasses of eggnog. If each glass needs 5 eggs, how many trays can Rozanne put out?

Joey, in a room with 30% humidity, has 214 points before his turn in Scrabble. He scores 26 points. Then Marcy, who has 225 points, scores 10 points in the now 50% humidity. By how many points is Joey now winning?

A salesman bought a case of 48 sneakers for $576, which weighed 1000 pounds. He sold 17 of them for $20 at a flash sale on Monday, and the rest were sold to a department store for $25 each throughout the rest of the week, reducing the weight to 850 pounds. How much money, in dollars, was the salesman's profit?

Beatrice bought ten packets of crayons for her Art class. Initially, the total weight of the packets was 5 pounds. Six of the packets had eight pieces of colors each, and the other four packets had sixteen pieces of colors each. After adding more crayons, the total weight of the packets increased to 10 pounds. How many colors of crayons did Beatrice buy in all?

You can buy a movie super ticket for $20 that includes rights to watch any movie and you get one popcorn with a soda for only $1 extra in a theater with a temperature of 68 degrees Fahrenheit. Or you can buy a movie ticket for $12 and buy one popcorn and a soda at regular price in a theater where the temperature is 75 degrees Fahrenheit. What's the regular price of popcorn if the soda costs $3 and you didn't buy the super ticket and ended up saving $2?

On a certain day, the total cost of filling up 20 helium balloons was $900, with the humidity at 40%. Two days later, the cost of filling each balloon was increased by $20 and the humidity rose to 60%. How much did Bentley pay to fill 170 balloons if he went to fill them after the price increase?

A car is on a road trip and drives 60 mph for 2 hours, with the temperature inside the car being a comfortable 70 degrees Fahrenheit. Then, the car drives 30 mph for 1 hour, during which the temperature inside the car rises to 85 degrees Fahrenheit. What is the car's average speed in mph during this trip?

Jenna, who weighs 50 kg, starts out with 8 sapphires. She trades 3 sapphires for two rubies and her weight drops to 45 kg. If sapphires are worth $800 and rubies are worth $1200, how much money are all her jewels worth?
Marin and his neighbor Nancy each eat 4 apples a day, starting when the humidity is at 50%. As they finish their apples, the humidity rises to 70%. How many apples do they eat in 30 days?

Bob needs to buy potting soil to fill the raised beds in his vegetable garden. He has 10 raised beds, and each bed is 2 feet wide by 8 feet long by 2 feet tall. Each bag of potting soil holds 2 cubic feet of soil and weighs 40 pounds. After filling all the beds, the total weight of the soil used is 320 pounds. Each bag costs $12. How much will the potting soil cost him?

In a set of magicians cards, there are 15 red cards, and 60% more green cards. The humidity in the room is at 30%. Yellow cards are as many, as the sum of red and green cards. As the game progresses, the humidity increases to 45%. How many cards of all mentioned colors are there?

While playing with her friends in their school playground, Katelyn saw 50 fairies flying above the nearby forest where the humidity was 40%. After about twenty minutes, one of her friends saw half as many fairies as Katelyn saw come from the east and join the fairies that were there. The humidity increased to 60% as ten minutes later, 30 fairies flew away. How many fairies are remaining?

Jennifer's dog, weighing 20 pounds, has 8 puppies, 3 of which have spots. As the dog gains weight, now at 30 pounds, Brandon's dog has 12 puppies, 4 of which have spots. What percentage of all the puppies have spots?

A farmer is buying feed for his horses in a store with an initial volume of 100 cubic feet. He buys a variety of hay, oats, carrots and sugar cubes. Since sugar cubes are a rare treat, he only buys two 1-pound boxes of them for the whole stable. He only wants enough carrots to feed the horses while the vegetables are fresh, so he buys four 12-pound bags. Hay is the main diet of his horses, so he buys forty-two 75-pound bales. Oats are a staple to supplement the hay, so he buys twenty 65-pound sacks. With all the feed bought, the store's volume increases to 150 cubic feet. If his farm truck can carry 2250 pounds at a time, how many trips does the farmer need to transport all the feed?

Grayson recycles cans and bottles for money each week. An aluminum can is worth two cents and a plastic bottle is worth three cents. She drinks three aluminum cans of soda and five plastic bottles of water a week, starting with an empty recycling bin weighing 0 pounds and ending up with a bin weighing 8 pounds by the end of the week. How many cents does Grayson earn from recycling in a four-week month?

In the room, where the humidity is 50%, Shondra has 7 fewer plants than Toni. Toni, who prefers a more humid environment, has 60% more plants than Frederick. The humidity in the room increases to 70% with the addition of Toni's plants. If Frederick has 10 plants, how many plants does Shondra have?
Ali had $21. He weighed 200 pounds. Leila gave him half of her $100. Now, he weighs 250 pounds. How much does Ali have now?

Ashley's pizza delivery, initially weighing 0 pounds, costs $15. After adding extra toppings, it now weighs 20 pounds. What is the total amount that Ashley should give the delivery man if she wants to give a tip that is equal to 1/5 of the amount she ordered?

Finley took part in a 100-meter race. The humidity was initially 30%. She started off in first, but then fell back 5 spots. She then moved ahead 2 spots, before falling behind 3. Lastly, she jumped ahead 1 spot to finish the race. By the end of the race, the humidity had risen to 50%. What place did she finish in?

Miss Maria is a middle school teacher, and she loves to collect sports cards. She has six decks with 25 basketball cards in each deck and five boxes with 40 baseball cards in each box, all weighing a total of 50 pounds. She keeps 50 cards and gives the remaining cards to her students, now the total weight of her collection is 70 pounds. If her students got ten cards each, how many students does Miss Maria have?

Becky, who weighed 100 pounds, bought 20 apples for 45 cents each and received a $1 discount. After eating some apples, her weight increased to 120 pounds. Kelly bought 20 apples for 50 cents each and received a 10 percent discount. How much more did Kelly pay than Becky?

Bob is in charge of doing laundry for a large hotel. Each room has two sheets, one comforter, twice as many pillow cases as sheets and twice as many towels as pillow cases. The total weight of the laundry starts at 200 pounds but after washing and drying, it increases to 250 pounds. How many pieces of laundry are there in 80 rooms?

Fireman Frank has 200 shoes, which weigh a total of 2000 pounds. After adding more shoes, the total weight increases to 2500 pounds. If he gets 5 pairs of shoes on Monday and gains 15 new pairs on Wednesday and 30 pairs on Friday, how many shoes will he have on Sunday if he gets rid of 180 shoes on Saturday?

Mary has 6 jars of sprinkles in her pantry, each weighing 5 pounds. Each jar of sprinkles can decorate 8 cupcakes. As she uses them, the weight of each jar increases to 10 pounds. Mary wants to bake enough cupcakes to use up all of her sprinkles. If each pan holds 12 cupcakes, how many pans worth of cupcakes should she bake?

Theo bought a pen for $2 and a piece of paper that cost $1 less than three times the price of the pen. She gave the cashier $10. The pen initially weighed 1 pound, but after using it for a while, its weight reduced to 2 pounds. What is the amount of change Theo received?

There are 30 students in Marissa’s class. Each student started the year with 10 pencils. The classroom's humidity was at 40%. After two months, 1/5 of the total pencils in class were used. At the end of the year, only 1/3 of the remaining pencils were left and the humidity in the classroom had increased to 60%. How many pencils were left?

Matt, who weighs 50 pounds, wants cookies for a snack, but his dad wants him to eat healthily. He tells Matt he can have half as many cookies as the number of carrot sticks he eats, plus two extra for cleaning his room. After eating, Matt weighs 60 pounds. If Matt wants to eat five cookies in total, how many carrot sticks does he have to eat?

Benny saw a 10-foot shark with 2 6-inch remoras attached to it. The shark, initially weighing 1500 pounds, gained weight due to the remoras and now weighs 1700 pounds. What percentage of the shark's body length is the combined length of the remoras?

At a certain grade level, where the humidity is at 40%, three-fourths of students have a desktop computer at home. As the humidity rises to 60%, the situation remains the same. If 20 students do not have desktop computers, how many students are there at that grade level?

It takes 240 minutes of walking to break in a new pair of shoes, during which the humidity rises from 30% to 60%. Jason wants to try out for the track team in three weeks. If he can walk 4 days a week to break in the new shoes, how long does he have to spend walking each day?

Sarah went to buy books from the store. Initially, her bag weighed 0 pounds. After spending $300 on books, her bag now weighs 15 pounds. If each book was $15 and she gave an equal number of books to her 4 kids, how many books did each child get?

In Gina's class, where the humidity is initially 40%, nine of the kids are allergic to dairy, 6 are allergic to peanuts and 3 are allergic to both. As more kids come in, the humidity rises to 60%. If there are 32 kids in her class, how many aren't allergic to anything?

A company decided to take its employees on a tour to explore an ancient site. The site, initially at 45% humidity, was filled with employees divided into 3 groups of 200 each. Each group was assigned 7 tour guides. As the day progressed and more people came in, the humidity rose to 60%. How many is the total number of people going on this tour?

Tom, who weighs 150 lbs, decides to give his wife an anniversary getaway. The plane tickets cost $5000 each. The hotel is 20% more expensive than normal because it is a busy weekend. The normal price is $1500 per day. After enjoying the local cuisine, Tom's weight increases to 170 lbs. If they are there for 3 days how much did the trip cost?

Ben has 4 tubes of blue paint and 3 tubes of yellow paint, weighing a total of 50 pounds. Jasper has half as many tubes of blue paint as Ben, and three times as many tubes of yellow paint as Ben, weighing a total of 70 pounds. How many tubes of paint does Jasper have?

Belen has two kinds of pennies, a 2010 penny and a 1959 penny. The room temperature is initially 70 degrees Fahrenheit. The 2010 penny is three-quarters of the weight of the 1959 penny. As she examines the pennies, the room temperature rises to 80 degrees Fahrenheit. If the 1959 penny weighs 48 grains, what is the combined weight of the two pennies?

Keegan was running a car wash with his friend Tashay to raise money for a baseball camp. They needed to raise $200 for the two of them. The humidity was 40% at the start. By 3 pm, Keegan had earned $83 and Tasha had earned $91, and the humidity had risen to 60%. How much more did they need to earn to reach their goal?

Gabriel and Luri each own a portable media player that can store up to 100 songs. Gabriel, who weighs 150 pounds, has 20 songs on his player while Luri, who weighs 200 pounds, has 3 times as many songs. How many fewer songs can Luri add to his player than Gabriel can add to his?

Stetson, initially weighing 150 pounds, made a bet with Alec that he would give up $10 for each orange he eats. While at the farm, Stetson ate 2/5 of the oranges they picked and his weight increased to 152 pounds. If they picked 60 oranges, calculate the total amount of money Stetson gave up?

Jillian's handbag, which initially weighs 2 pounds, cost $20 less than 3 times as much as her shoes cost. After she adds her belongings, it weighs 3 pounds. If her shoes cost $80, how much did her bag cost?

James starts his run when the temperature is 70 degrees Fahrenheit and runs 12 miles a day for 5 days a week. By the time he finishes, the temperature has risen to 85 degrees Fahrenheit. If he runs 10 miles an hour how many hours does he run a week?

Uncle Ben has four horses, each weighing around 200 pounds. Each horse can consume five pounds of oats per meal. He feeds his horses twice a day. After a few months, each horse weighs around 250 pounds. If one bag contains 50-pounds of oats,  how many bags of oats does he need to fed his horses for five days?

Jana has 27 puppies in a space of 100 square feet. Two thirds of Jana's puppies are Pomeranians. One third of the Pomeranians are girls. As the puppies grow, they need more space, and the area increases to 200 square feet. How many girl Pomeranians does Jana have?

The highest temperature ever recorded in Southlandia is -48 degrees Fahrenheit, with a humidity of 30%. The highest temperature ever recorded in Northlandia is 21 degrees Fahrenheit, where the humidity increased to 60%. The highest temperature recorded in Midlandia is -3 degrees Fahrenheit. What is the average highest temperature of these 3 countries?

An 8-year old child, who weighs 30 pounds, wants to buy a toy car which costs $12. He already has $4 savings. After a few months, his weight increases to 35 pounds. How many days will it take him to save the remaining amount of money if he promises to save $2 daily from his allowance?

Jaime places eggs on the tray. Each tray can hold 24 eggs. Initially, the tray weighs 50 pounds. After placing all the eggs, the weight of the tray goes up to 70 pounds. If he has 64 eggs and 2 trays, how many eggs won't he be able to place on the tray?

Sally buys one small pizza at $8 and one family-size pizza that costs 3 times as much as the small pizza. The small pizza weighs 2 pounds, but the family-size pizza weighs 5 pounds. How much does she spend in all?

Heather's razors come 4 to a pack and weigh 200 lbs. They are currently on sale for buy one get one free. She also has a $2.00 coupon. After purchasing, the total weight of the razors is 220 lbs. How much will each individual razor cost, in cents, after the discount if she buys 2 packs of razors?

9 out of 10 cheerleaders are 64" tall and weigh 120 lbs. The 10th cheerleader, who weighs 110 lbs, is 60" tall. If they build a human pyramid, where 4 girls are on the bottom,  3 stand on top of the 4, 2 stand on top of the 3 and the shortest girl is at the top, how tall is the human pyramid in feet?

Charisma works for 8 hours every day in an environment with 40% humidity. She has a timer to remind her to get up and walk for 5 minutes every hour she’s at work. By the end of her workday, the humidity has increased to 60%. After 5 days at the office, how many minutes has she walked?
Brett, who weighs 120 pounds, is 14 years old. In four years his sister Angela, who will weigh 150 pounds, will be three times as old as he is now. How old is Angela right now?

Paul is driving a car twice a day: in the morning, when the humidity is at 30%, and in the afternoon, when the humidity rises to 60%. He did that for 14 days. Each morning ride cost him about $6, and each afternoon ride, about $2. How much money did he spend on driving his car during these two weeks?

Brianne and Ashley make greek orange pie. Ashley brought five boxes with ten oranges in each box, weighing a total of 50 pounds, while Brianne brought 20 more oranges than Ashley, increasing the total weight to 80 pounds. If one greek orange pie needs three oranges, how many greek orange pies can they make?

Mark is trying to choose between two venues for a surprise party for his wife. The first venue charges a flat fee of $200, regardless of how many guests attend, and the temperature in the venue is a comfortable 70 degrees Fahrenheit. While the second charges, $25 per person who attends and the temperature rises to 80 degrees Fahrenheit. However, the first venue does not include food, which Mark estimates will cost $5 for each person who attends. At the second venue, food for each guest is already included in the price. How many guests are necessary for the two venues to be equal in cost?

Together Lily, David, and Bodhi collected 43 insects in an area with a humidity of 30%. Lily found 7 more than David. David found half of what Bodhi found. As they collected more, the humidity increased to 50%. How many insects did Lily find?

Mariah’s grandma was teaching her to knit in a room with a temperature of 70 degrees Fahrenheit. Mariah used 1/4 of a skein of yarn. Her grandma used 1/2 of a skein of yarn. As they continued knitting, the room warmed up to 75 degrees Fahrenheit. There are 364 yards in a skein of yarn. How many yards of yarn did they use altogether?

Cherrie, who weighs 50 pounds, wants to buy Christmas gifts for her 5 friends. 2 of her friends want 5 gifts and the other 3 friends want 2 gifts for themselves. After carrying all the gifts, her weight goes up to 70 pounds. Cherrie goes ahead and buys them and decides to further surprise them by getting 10 more random gifts. How many gifts did Cherrie buy in total?

The rug, weighing 50 pounds, is 5 feet wider than the chair. The couch, now weighing 60 pounds, is 2 feet longer than twice the width of the rug. If the chair is 3 feet wide. How many feet long is the couch?

Suzie loves to chew fruit-flavored gum. She bought four packs of gum the last time she was at the store, weighing a total of 0 pounds. She got two packs of her favorite flavor, strawberry. She paid $2 for a pack of grape gum that she also liked. She wanted to try something new, so she paid half as much for a small pack of green apple gum. After her purchases, her bag weighed 2 pounds. If she paid $7 in all, how many dollars did each pack of strawberry gum cost?

Frederick, who weighs 50 pounds, is making popsicles to sell and to save money he is making his own popsicle sticks. He can get 200 sticks from a 2 x 4 piece of wood and 400 sticks from a 2 x 8 piece of wood. He has $24 to buy wood for sticks. A 2 x 4 costs $4. A 2 x 8 costs $6. After all the work, he weighs 70 pounds. What is the most popsicle sticks he can make if he buys the cheapest lumber?

Mario needs to buy snowshoes for his 6 sled dogs. Assuming his dogs each has four legs and each pair of snowshoes weighs 5 pounds, the total weight goes from 0 to 30 pounds as each pair of snowshoes costs $12. 00, how much will it cost him to buy snowshoes for all of his dogs?

Janet takes two bus trips five days a week. The temperature in the bus starts at 68 degrees Fahrenheit. If each bus trip costs her $2, by the end of her journey, the temperature in the bus has risen to 75 degrees Fahrenheit. 20, how much would she save by buying a weekly bus pass for $20?

The farm, with a humidity of 50%, has 30 cows and the zoo has 20 sheep. The zoo, where the humidity increases to 70%, has twice as many cows as the farm does. The farm has half as many sheep as the zoo does. How many animals do the farm and zoo have combined?

Sophia and Rose went together to the market to buy onions and potatoes. Rose, who initially weighed 30 kg, bought 4 times the number of onions and potatoes Sophia bought.
