After carrying all the onions and potatoes, Rose's weight increased to 50 kg. If Rose bought 12 onions and 4 potatoes, how many onions and potatoes in total did Sophia buy at the market?

For a New Year's resolution, Andy wants to lose 30 lbs. by his birthday, which is July 19th. Today is December 31st, with a humidity of 30%. If Andy needs to burn 3500 calories to lose a pound, how much of a calorie deficit (net amount of calories burned vs. intake) does he need to create each day? As he starts his journey, the humidity increases to 45%. calories consumed) does he need each day to reach his goal?

Gerald, who weighs 180 pounds, works at a daycare that pays him $30 every day. He worked for an entire week and spent a total of $100. After a week of work, he weighed 170 pounds. How much does he have left?

Hannah needs to drink 60 ml of water for each kilometer she runs. The humidity in the gym is initially 40%. If her gym teacher tells her to run 8 laps and each lap is 0.5 kilometers, the humidity in the gym increases to 60%. 25 km, how many milliliters of water will Hannah need to drink?

Julie, who weighed 150 lbs, had $500. She spent 20% of it on clothes and then 25% of the remaining money on CDs. After all the shopping, her weight increased to 200 lbs due to the clothes and CDs she bought. How much money did Julie have left?

A house and a lot, initially covering an area of 500 square feet, cost $120,000. After some renovation, the area increased to 700 square feet. If the house cost three times as much as the lot, how much did the house cost?

Tara bought 8 packs of 5 canvas bags for $4 each, each bag weighing 2 pounds. After she painted them, each bag weighed 3 pounds. She sold them at a craft fair for $8 each. How much profit did she earn on her bags?
On average Joe throws 25 punches per minute in a room with 50% humidity. A fight lasts 5 rounds of 3 minutes, by the end of which the humidity rises to 70%. How many punches did he throw?

The eighth-grade class held a bake-off, with a starting humidity of 40% in the room. Kelsie made two times more cookies than Josh. Josh made one-fourth the number of cookies that Suzanne made. By the end of the bake-off, the humidity in the room had risen to 60%. If Suzanne made 36 cookies, how many did Kelsie make?
Royce takes 40 minutes more than double Rob to shingle a house, starting at 60% humidity. As they work, the humidity increases to 80%. If Rob takes 2 hours, how many minutes does Royce take?

Martha is knitting winter wear for her 3 grandchildren. They're triplets, so they're all the same size. She wants to make a hat, scarf, sweater, mittens, and socks for each of them. It takes 2 skeins of wool to make a hat, 4 for a scarf, 12 for a sweater, 1 for a pair of mittens, and 2 for a pair of socks. The weight of the wool increases from 0 pounds to 42 pounds as she knits. How many skeins of wool will she need to buy?

Chris, in a room with 30% humidity, is way behind on his math homework. He has 100 math problems to complete in total. He completes 12 problems on Monday night. On Tuesday, he completes 3 times as many problems as he did on Monday. On Wednesday, he completes one-quarter of the remaining math problems. By then, the humidity in the room has risen to 50%. How many math problems does he have left to complete on Thursday?

It's strawberry-picking time on Grandma Concetta's farm, where the humidity is initially at 50%. Tony can pick 6 quarts of strawberries per hour, while Bobby picks one less quart of strawberries per hour than Tony. Kathy can pick twice as many strawberries per hour as Bobby, and Ricky picks two fewer quarts of strawberries per hour than does Kathy. As they continue picking, the humidity rises to 70%. In total, how many quarts of strawberries can Tony, Bobby, Ricky, and Kathy pick per hour on Grandma Concetta's farm?

The bakers at the Beverly Hills Bakery, where the temperature was initially 70 degrees Fahrenheit, baked 200 loaves of bread on Monday morning. They sold 93 loaves in the morning and 39 loaves in the afternoon. A grocery store returned 6 unsold loaves. By the end of the day, the temperature in the bakery had risen to 85 degrees Fahrenheit. How many loaves of bread did they have left?

Jackson is planting tulips in 30% humidity. He can fit 6 red tulips in a row and 8 blue tulips in a row. As he continues planting, the humidity increases to 45%. If Jackson buys 36 red tulips and 24 blue tulips, how many rows of flowers will he plant?

Heather bought a jumbo bag of raisins with 27 cups of raisins in it, weighing initially 5 pounds. She wants to make oatmeal cookies, granola, and snack mix with the raisins. A batch of oatmeal cookies takes 3/4 of a cup of raisins, and after making them, the bag now weighs 3 pounds. How many batches of oatmeal cookies can Heather make if she divides the bag of raisins equally among the cookies, granola, and snack mix?

Ada's daily electric consumption is 12 kilowatts per hour at a room temperature of 70 degrees Fahrenheit. She is planning to add a device that will consume 2 kilowatts per hour a day, raising the room temperature to 75 degrees Fahrenheit. If a kilowatt per hour is $1. 50, how much is the difference between Ada's weekly electric bill before and after she adds the new device?

Tom, who weighs 150 lbs, bought a CD for $4, and a headphone set. After carrying his purchases, his weight increased to 160 lbs. In total, he paid $48. How many more CDs would Tom have been able to buy if he had decided not to buy the headphone set?

After tracking his workout routine for 8 weeks, Josh discovered that he had spent 4 hours working out every week in a room with 40% humidity. On some occasions, the humidity increased to 60%, at one point, he spent 5 hours each for two consecutive weeks. Another time, he spent 6 hours in one week. What is the total number of hours he has spent working out across the 8 weeks?

48 people are riding a bus, where the humidity is 50%. On the first stop, 8 passengers get off, and 5 times as many people as the number who got off from the bus get into the bus. On the second stop 21, passengers get off and 3 times fewer passengers get on. The humidity inside the bus rises to 70%. How many passengers are riding the bus after the second stop?

Jame, who currently weighs 150 pounds, will turn 27 in 5 years. In 8 years his cousin will be 5 years younger than twice his age and Jame will weigh 180 pounds. How many years separate the age of the two now?

Errol bought a computer, 2 monitors, and a printer for $2,400. The total weight of the items was initially 50 kg. After adding some additional accessories, the weight increased to 70 kg. He paid $400 less for the printer than the computer. If the computer cost $1,100, how much did one monitor cost, in dollars?

Twenty kids went out on a school trip. In one of the several activities they participated in, they were divided into two equal groups of girls and boys and then went out for a scavenger hunt of seashells. The boys went out for the search and brought back 60 shells each. The humidity at the beach started at 30% but increased to 70% by the end of the scavenger hunt. If the girls brought an amount equal to the number of shells brought by the boys plus four times as many seashells as the boys, how many seashells were brought by each girl?
Nick had twice as many candies as George, with his bag weighing 100 pounds. Then George ate 5 candies. Now George has 3 candies left and Nick's bag weighs 150 pounds. How many candies does Nick have?
Chenny, who weighs 60 kg, is 10 years old. Alyana, who weighs 70 kg, is 4 years younger than Chenny. How old is Anne if she is 2 years older than Alyana?

Four books are arranged on a shelf. The first book is 31 mm thick and weighs 1 kg, while the second book is 50 mm thick. The third book is 5 mm less thick than the second book, and the fourth book is twice as thick as the first book and weighs 2 kg. What is the total thickness of the four books?

Emma can make and upload 72 vlogs per month. But she was only able to make 18 vlogs for the first week, when the humidity was 30%. The humidity increased to 45% by the second week, and she made 21 vlogs. By the third week, she made 15 vlogs. How many vlogs should she do to complete the 72 vlogs per month?
My wife, who weighs 150 lbs, wants to evenly split the check but wants me to pay an additional 20% tip on our $50 dinner bill. After the meal, she weighs 160 lbs. How much did I end up paying?

$18 is shared among 3 boys. The eldest, who weighs 150 lbs, added $5 to his share and added another $10 the following day. He later needed some money and spent $8 from his total so far. After saving some more, he was able to triple the amount he had left after spending the $8. During this time, he gained some weight and now weighs 160 lbs. How much does he have now?

Elvis has a monthly saving target of $1125. In April, when the temperature is 68 degrees Fahrenheit, he wants to save twice as much daily in the second half as he saves in the first half in order to hit his target. By the end of the month, as the temperature rises to 75 degrees Fahrenheit, he has achieved his goal. How much does he have to save for each day in the second half of the month?

Verna, who weighs 150 pounds, loves to eat fruit. She bought three apples at $1.50 each, five oranges at $0.80 each, and six peaches at $0.75 each. After eating, her weight increases to 155 pounds. If she gave $20, how much change did she receive?

For each small task accomplished, Jairus, who weighs 150 lbs, gets $0.8 while Jenny gets $0.5. After a few months, Jairus has gained weight and now weighs 200 lbs. If each of them finished 20 tasks, how much more will Jairus get than Jenny?

Jeff and Brad, who weigh a combined 200 pounds, are trying to divide 100 dollars between them. Jeff gets 4 times as much as Brad. After a hearty meal, their combined weight goes up to 220 pounds. How much does Jeff get in dollars?

Jeff’s work is 3 miles away. He walks there and back each day he works, starting when the temperature is 70 degrees Fahrenheit and ending when it's 85 degrees Fahrenheit. How many miles does he walk if he has to work 5 times a week?

Elise is learning to write in a room with 50% humidity and decides to keep re-writing the alphabet until she knows it. She writes it in full twice, writes half of it once, then re-writes everything she has already written. By the end, the humidity in the room has increased to 60%. How many letters has Elise written in total?

In a room with 30% humidity, a phone tree is used to contact families and relatives of Ali's deceased coworker. Ali decided to call 3 families. Then each family calls 3 other families, and so on. The humidity in the room rises to 45% as the calls continue. How many families will be notified during the fourth round of calls?

Mark was unwell for 3 months, during which he lost 10 pounds per month. The room temperature where he stayed started at 68 degrees Fahrenheit and by the end of the 3 months, it had increased to 78 degrees Fahrenheit. If his final weight was 70 pounds, what was his initial weight?

Jonathan, who weighs 50 pounds, was sad to learn he needed 2 more toys than he already had to have enough toys to make a sorted play set five times larger than James's play set, which had 80 toys. After a month, Jonathan's weight increased to 70 pounds. How many toys does Jonathan currently have?

A shop sells school supplies. One notebook is sold at $1.50 each, a pen at $0.25 each, a calculator at $12 each, and a geometry set at $10. Daniel is an engineering student weighing 150 lbs, and he wants to buy five notebooks, two pens, one calculator, and one geometry set. After carrying all his purchases, his weight goes up to 160 lbs. The shop gives a 10% discount on all the purchased items. How much does Daniel have to spend on all the items he wants to buy?

Carly wants to treat her friends. She orders five hamburgers at $4 each, ten packs of potato fries at $0.30 each pack, and five cans of fruit drinks at $2 each can. The total weight of the food starts at 0 pounds and after the order, it goes up to 30 pounds. How much change does Carly get back if she gives one fifty-dollar bill?

Bill is trying to figure out how many water bottles he needs to buy for his party. He started out with 2 cases of water which have 24 bottles each, in a room with a temperature of 68 degrees Fahrenheit. He has 70 guests that will be arriving, and he wants to have 2 bottles of water for each guest. As the guests arrive, the room temperature rises to 75 degrees Fahrenheit. How many additional bottles of water will he need to buy?

When the water is cold at 70 degrees Fahrenheit, Ray swims a mile in 16 minutes. When the water is warm at 85 degrees Fahrenheit, Ray swims a mile in 2 minutes more than twice as long. How much longer does Ray take to swim 3 miles on a hot day than a cold day?

John plans to save money from working. He gets paid $2 per hour and works 5 hours a day for 4 days a week. The temperature in his workspace starts at 68 degrees Fahrenheit and rises to 75 degrees by the end of his shift. If he wants to save $80 how many weeks will it take him?

A bag of buttons, weighing 2 pounds, had 21 buttons in it. Seven buttons had two holes and the rest had four holes. After adding more buttons, the bag now weighs 3 pounds. How many holes were in all the buttons in the bag?

Timothy's locker, which weighs 50 pounds, is 24 cubic inches. Zack's locker is half as big as Timothy's locker and weighs 60 pounds. Peter's locker is 1/4 as big as Zack's locker and weighs 70 pounds. How big is Peter's locker in cubic inches?

A stickler for health, Octavia, who weighs 150 pounds, drinks half the daily recommended cups of coffee. By contract, Octavia’s husband Juan drinks 10 times the amount of coffee she drinks. After a month, Octavia's weight increases to 160 pounds. Juan’s doctor has asked him to reduce his coffee intake to the daily recommendation of 4 cups. By how many cups must Juan reduce his daily coffee intake?

A pet shop had 6 cages of rodents, weighing a total of 100 pounds. 3 of the cages have 10 hamsters and the other 3 have 5 guinea pigs. With the addition of the new rodents, the total weight increases to 150 pounds. How many rodents did the pet shop have in total?

If Mark weighs 150 pounds and Susan weighs 20 pounds less than Mark, in a room with a temperature of 70 degrees Fahrenheit. Their friend Bob, who weighs twice as much as Susan, enters and the temperature in the room rises to 85 degrees Fahrenheit. What is the average weight of the 3 friends?

The great pyramids sit at an angle of 32 degrees from the ground when you stand at the entrance of Sahir's house, where the luminosity is 5000 lumens. As the sun, moving at 5 degrees an hour straight upward from the pyramid relative to Sahir's house, the luminosity increases to 7000 lumens. If the sun starts at the tip of the pyramid and moves for 10 hours, how many degrees will there be from the ground to the sun?

James, who weighs 150 lbs, decides to buy birthday candles for his 2 sons. One of them is 12 and the other is 4 years younger. A pack of 5 candles costs $3. After buying the candles, James weighs 160 lbs. How much does James spend on candles?

In the first week, Judy read for 15 minutes each night before going to sleep in a room that was 68 degrees Fahrenheit. In the second week, she read a total of 100 pages in a warmer room at 75 degrees Fahrenheit. If she can read 2 pages per 1. 5 minutes, how many pages did she read in two weeks?

Cody and Trevor, who together weigh 200 lbs, had 12 sandwiches. Cody ate a third of the sandwiches, and Trevor ate a quarter of the sandwiches. After eating, they now weigh 180 lbs. How many sandwiches are left?
Shiloh, who weighs 200 pounds, is 44 years old today. In 7 years, he will be three times as old as his nephew, and his weight will have increased to 220 pounds. How old is his nephew today?

The tooth fairy, who weighed 50 grams, left Sharon $5.00 in exchange for the first tooth Sharon lost. Then, the tooth fairy gave Sharon $1.00 for each of the next three teeth Sharon lost. And for each of the last 2 teeth Sharon lost, the tooth fairy, now weighing 60 grams, gave Sharon half the amount of money per tooth as Sharon had received for each of the previous three teeth. How much money did the tooth fairy leave Sharon, in dollars?

Three teenagers are playing soccer on the weekend at a temperature of 65 degrees Fahrenheit. Richie, the first teenager, scored 20 more goals than Mark and scored 45 more goals than Anna. As the game progresses, the temperature rises to 75 degrees Fahrenheit. If Richie scored 80 goals, how many goals did all three teenagers score?

On a day when the temperature was 70 degrees Fahrenheit, Liam and Mitchell own competing lemonade stands across the street from one another. When Liam bragged that he had made $63 one weekend, Mitchell laughed and told Liam he had sold 21 lemonades at $4 apiece the same weekend, by which time the temperature had risen to 85 degrees Fahrenheit. How many more dollars did Mitchell make selling lemonade that weekend than Liam?

Peter, who weighs 70 pounds, has $70 and wishes to spend an equal amount each day for one week. From Sunday through Wednesday, he spent his money on wooden action figures which cost $5 each. After buying and playing with the action figures, he lost some weight and now weighs 60 pounds. For the rest of the week, he will buy plastic action figures which cost $2 each. How many total action figures will he have by the end of the week?

Leah just got a new kitten that weighed 1 pound. Spaying her cost $200, her 3 vaccines costs $20 each, and the kitten, now weighing 2 pounds, broke 4 vases that cost $12 each. How much has the kitten cost so far?

Ford owns a garden with a humidity level of 50% and he grows 40 roses every week. He supplies Roses to the local flower shops. The first flower shop orders 20 roses, the second flower shop orders 15 roses, and the third flower shop orders 30 roses per week. As the roses are picked, the humidity in the garden increases to 70%. How many roses does Ford lack to supply all the flower shops every month?

Katina, who weighs 150 lbs, has $3000 in her savings account. After a few months, her weight increases to 200 lbs. If she removes $100 from the account every month, how much money will be remaining within the account after 2 years?

A food truck, which weighs 2000 pounds, only sells grilled cheeses. They source their bread for $3.00 a loaf and each loaf makes 10 sandwiches. They spend $30.00 on different cheeses and condiments per 10 sandwiches. After stocking up, the truck weighs 2100 pounds. If they sell 10 sandwiches for $7. 00 each, what is their net profit?

At the end of the school year, Kate asked her teacher if she could have the 3 boxes of 64 crayons since they were all worn down to small pieces. The classroom was a comfortable 70 degrees Fahrenheit. The teacher agreed. Kate took the crayons home, where the temperature was a warm 90 degrees Fahrenheit, and decided to make crayon muffins by melting 8 small pieces of crayons together in a muffin tin that she placed in an oven for a few minutes. If she can sell her muffin crayons for $1. 50 each, how much money can Kate make?

Michael is replacing the carpet in his bedroom. The new carpet he's chosen weighs 0 pounds initially, but after installation, it weighs 500 pounds. It costs $12 per square foot, plus $2 per square foot for padding underneath. His contractor charges $4 per square foot to remove the old carpet, and $34 per square foot to install the new carpet. His bedroom measures 18 feet by 12 feet. How much will it cost Michael to replace the carpet?

Mack wants to count things and decided to count how many birds there are in the sky over the next week. On days one and two, Mack saw a total of 50 birds when the humidity was at 30%. On day three he saw none. On days four and five, he saw 120 birds. On day six he saw 20 and on day seven he saw 90, by which time the humidity had risen to 70%. On average, how many birds did Mack see in a day?

In a room with a starting temperature of 68 degrees Fahrenheit, Diane gave a number train a starting value of 20. This starting value plus half the number was divided by 5 and the resulting value was multiplied by the starting value minus 12. As she worked, the temperature in the room rose to 75 degrees Fahrenheit. What was the final value of the number train?
A boy, who weighs 50 pounds, has 5 cards. His brother, who weighs 60 pounds, has 3 fewer cards than he has. How many cards do they have together?

Maggie's oven is malfunctioning. When she sets it to 450 the actual temperature is 468. The humidity in the kitchen starts at 30% and rises to 45% due to the heat from the oven. If it's off by the same percentage for any recipe, what temperature should she set it at if her recipe calls for 520 degrees?

Max plans to watch two movies this weekend. The room temperature is initially 68 degrees Fahrenheit. The first movie is 1 hour and 30 minutes long while the second movie is 2 hours and 5 minutes long. After the movies, the room temperature has risen to 75 degrees Fahrenheit. How many minutes will it take Max to watch the two movies?

Judy bought a dozen cups and twice as many dishes as cups to take to the church's charity event. The total weight of the items was initially 200 pounds. At the event, she found out that her friend had brought 40 cups and 20 more dishes than she had brought, increasing the total weight to 400 pounds. What's the total number of utensils brought by the two?

90 single use contacts come in 1 box and will last Pete 45 days. Each box, initially weighing 5 pounds, is $100.00 and currently 10% off. After Pete uses some contacts, the box weighs 7 pounds. If he buys 2 boxes of contact, how much will each pair of contacts cost?

Tabitha agreed to pay John and Jill $10 an hour to help clean out her attic and basement, which was initially at a temperature of 70 degrees Fahrenheit. Jill worked 2 hours on Saturday and 1 hour on Sunday. John worked twice as long as Jill on Saturday and three times as long as Jill on Sunday. After their work, the temperature in the attic and basement rose to 80 degrees Fahrenheit. How much more money did John earn compared to Jill?

Hannah needs to drink 100 ml of water for every 200 calories she burns. She starts her workout when the humidity is at 30%. She spends 2 hours doing aerobics, which burns 500 calories/hour, and 1 hour running, which burns 600 calories/hour. By the end of her workout, the humidity has risen to 50%. How many ml of water does she need to drink?

At the Burger Palace restaurant, there is an enormous jar containing red, blue and green jelly beans. The humidity in the restaurant is initially 30%. On the outside of the jar is a note that reads, "This jar contains 1% fewer red jelly beans than blue jelly beans and 1% more green jelly beans than blue jelly beans. As more customers enter, the humidity increases to 45%. "  If the jar contains a total of 4500 jelly beans, how many more green jelly beans does it contain than red jelly beans?

Jared is trying to increase his typing speed in a room with a humidity of 40%. He starts with 47 words per minute (WPM). After some lessons, and the humidity rising to 55%, the next time he tests his typing speed it has increased to 52 WPM. If he continues to increase his typing speed once more by 5 words, what will be the average of the three measurements?

If Martin eats Cheerios every day for breakfast, he'll lose 1.25 pounds/week and the room temperature is 70 degrees Fahrenheit. If he eats donuts every day for breakfast, he'll gain 1.75 pounds/week and the room temperature rises to 85 degrees Fahrenheit. What will be the difference in his weight at the end of 5 weeks between the two breakfast options?

Alex is getting ready to attend an event that she has hosted and wants to make sure that she has enough seats for everyone. The room temperature is initially at 70 degrees Fahrenheit. She invites 100 people via email and each invited person says that they will also invite 2 of their friends. She then calls 10 of her friends to invite them too and 8 of them say they will be bringing their spouses. With the increase in people, the room temperature rises to 85 degrees Fahrenheit. How many seats will Alex need?

Four dogs sat in a line within the veterinarian's waiting room, where the temperature was 70 degrees Fahrenheit. The first dog was the Affenpinscher, who weighed only 10 pounds. Next to him sat a Dachshund, who weighed twice as much as the Affenpinscher. Next to the Dachshund sat a Papillon, who weighed one-fourth as much as the Dachshund. And at the end of the line sat a Mastiff, who weighed 44 times the weight of the Papillon. As the Mastiff sat down, the temperature in the room rose to 80 degrees Fahrenheit. How much did the Mastiff weigh, in pounds?

Marilyn wants to buy a pair of boots online. The boots weigh 2 pounds. On Amazon. com, the boots cost $16 and shipping costs $4. On eBay, those same pair of shoes are only $13, but shipping costs twice as much as it does on Amazon. After packing, the boots weigh 3 pounds. How much more expensive do the boots work out to be on eBay?

Mark plants a beanstalk below his second-story window, which is 20 feet off the ground, in an environment with 30% humidity. The beanstalk doubles its height every day, and as it grows, the humidity increases to 50%. If the beanstalk starts out 4 feet tall, how many days will it take to be taller than Mark's window?

A cup of mushrooms, initially occupying a volume of 500 milliliters, weighs 100 grams and has 3 grams of protein. As they shrink, the volume reduces to 250 milliliters. If John eats 200 grams of mushrooms every day how many grams of protein does he get per week?
Jerry, who is twice as old as he was 5 years ago, is in a room with a humidity level of 50%. As he ages, the humidity in the room increases to 70%. How old will Jerry be in 3 years?

George, who weighs 180 pounds, needs to pay for dental work. He needs 2 implants. Each implant has a base price of $2000. For one of the implants, he wants a crown made of porcelain. That feature costs an extra $500. He’s already put down a deposit of $600. He makes $15 per hour at work. After the dental work, his weight increases to 200 pounds. How many hours does he need to work before he has enough to pay for the dental work?

In a room of 50 square meters, the three angles in a triangle add up to 180 degrees. One angle is twice the smallest angle, and one angle is three times the smallest angle. The room's area increases to 70 square meters. What is the measure of the largest angle in the triangle, in degrees?

In a room with a temperature of 70 degrees Fahrenheit, Colby wants to buy some gumballs that cost a nickel each. As he buys more, the room's temperature increases to 75 degrees Fahrenheit. If he has 8 quarters, 6 dimes, 14 nickels, and 15 pennies, how many can he buy?

A pet store currently has 5 dogs, 2 cats, and 10 birds, with a humidity level of 30%. The humidity level rises to 50% as more animals are brought in. How many legs in total do the pets in the store have?

Jamaal is at the gym, where the humidity is 30%. He has been using an 8-pound weight. He increases the weight that he uses by 50%. It turns out to be too heavy, so he uses a weight two pounds lighter than that. The humidity in the gym increases to 50% due to his intense workout. What is the weight, in pounds, that he now uses?

Steve, who weighs 150 pounds, loves playing video games. His parents get him a console along with 5 games for his birthday. He saves up enough money to buy 1 game per month for a year, and then the following year he starts buying 2 games a month. For the third year he buys 4 games a month as he has a new part-time job that makes him more money. He also gets 5 games for Christmas every year. By the end of the third year, his weight has increased to 180 pounds due to lack of physical activity. How many games does Steve have after 3 years?

A plane travels 1200 miles in 3 hours, starting its journey at a temperature of 20 degrees Celsius and ending it at 30 degrees Celsius. At the same rate, how many additional hours would it take to travel an additional 2000 miles?

On Monday, when the humidity was at 30%, Howard spends $8 dollars at the arcade. On Tuesday, as the humidity increased to 40%, he spends twice as much at the arcade as he did on Monday. On Wednesday, when the humidity peaked at 50%, he spends 4 times as much at the arcade as he spent on Tuesday. If he originally had $100, how much money does he have left?

For four hours, Patrick sold 15 cups of lemonade per hour at a price of $0.50 per cup in a temperature of 70 degrees Fahrenheit. In the next two hours, as the temperature rose to 80 degrees Fahrenheit, he sold 10 cups of lemonade per hour at a price of $0.60 per cup. How much money did Patrick earn, in dollars, from selling lemonade for 6 hours?

Every 2 miles a car, which weighs 2000 kg, drives the tires rotate 725 times. After Jeremy drives 400 miles a month, the car's weight increases to 2200 kg due to accumulated dirt and debris. If each tire can undergo 10,440,000 rotations how many years before the tire needs to be replaced?

The jumbo bottle of shampoo, which initially weighs 500g, costs $24.00. The directions say to use 2 pumps of shampoo and this will give you 120 washings. After a few uses, the bottle now weighs 750g. If Jackie only uses 1 pump per wash, how much will each pump cost, in cents?

Joe, who weighs 150 pounds, has $50 to buy an outfit for his new field trip. There is a 30% off sale at the clothing store. The shirt he picks out has a price of $25. He also picks out a pair of shorts for $35. After trying on and buying the clothes, his weight goes up to 160 pounds due to the weight of the clothes. Assuming that sales tax is included, how much money will Joe have left after the purchase?

Juan wants to add croissants to his bakery menu. The bakery is initially at 70 degrees Fahrenheit. It takes 1/4 pound of butter to make 1 dozen croissants. He wants to start with making 4 dozen a day for a week. After a week of baking, the temperature in the bakery rises to 85 degrees Fahrenheit. How many pounds of butter will he need to make these croissants?

It costs $194 per meter to repave a street. Monica's street is 150 meters long. Initially, the weight of the asphalt used is 5000 kg, but after repaving, it increases to 6000 kg. How much more does it cost to repave Lewis' street, which is 490 meters long?

John decides to build a program capable of identifying cancer cells. He gets initial funding of $100,000 for the first 5 months of research, during which the temperature in his lab is a steady 68 degrees Fahrenheit. His research ends up taking 10 times that long and every month after those first 5 took 50% more funding per month. By the end of his research, the temperature in the lab has risen to 78 degrees Fahrenheit. How much did his research cost?

The basketball team went to the steakhouse to eat dinner, where the temperature was 70 degrees Fahrenheit. The first player ate a 6-ounce steak. The second player ate beef tips, containing 8 beef tips, each an ounce in size. The third player ate a one-pound steak. And the fourth and fifth players ordered vegetarian meals. After the meal, the temperature in the steakhouse rose to 80 degrees Fahrenheit. In total, how many ounces of meat were consumed by the team?

A Reddit group, which initially has a 30% active member rate, has 1000 members. The active member rate increased to 45%. If each member posts an average of 3 posts per day, what's the total number of posts that the group will have in March?

Gary, who weighs 150 pounds, does laundry twice a week. Each load of laundry uses 20 gallons of water, and a gallon of water costs $0.15. After a few months, Gary weighs 200 pounds. How much does Gary spend on water for laundry in a year?

Scarlett found an aquarium for $10.00 at a yard sale, which initially weighed 0 pounds. At the pet store, she bought 2 bags of rocks for $2.50 each and 3 pieces of coral at $2.00 apiece. She bought 20 fish at $0.50 each and she needed fish food that cost $2.00. After adding all the items, the aquarium now weighs 10 pounds. How much did she spend?

Jane planted a beanstalk in her backyard, where the humidity was initially 30%. After the first week, it was 3 inches tall. It doubled in height the second week. It grew another 4 inches in the third week, by which time the humidity had increased to 45%. How tall was the beanstalk after 3 weeks?

Prince is a butcher. He sells 15kg of meat every hour he works, and he works 10 hours a day. His friend Bill gives him a bull that weighs 750kg. The temperature in the butcher shop starts at 70 degrees Fahrenheit and rises to 85 degrees by the end of the day. How many days will it take Prince to sell the meat from Bill's bull?

The school auditorium, with a luminosity of 100 lumens, has 4 rows of seats. There are 18 seats in each row. One-fourth of the seats were occupied by the administrators. One-third of the remaining seats were occupied by the parents and the rest were occupied by the students. As more people came in, the luminosity increased to 200 lumens. How many students were there in the school auditorium?

In a room with a temperature of 70 degrees Fahrenheit, a DVD can be played 1000 times before it breaks. There are two DVDs in the public library, one has been played 356 times and the other has been played 135 times. As they are played, the room's temperature increases to 75 degrees Fahrenheit. How many total times can both DVDs be played before they break?

John injured his back and needs to go to physical therapy. The humidity in the therapy room was initially 50%. He went to physical therapy for 6 weeks. Each week he went twice for 2 hours at a time. By the end of his therapy, the humidity in the room had risen to 70%. If the sessions cost $125 per hour how much did the physical therapy cost?

Jim has a 20 pack of gum. He chews 1 piece of gum for every 2 hours he's at school over a school day that lasts 8 hours, during which the humidity in the classroom rises from 45% to 60%. He chews 1 piece on the way home from school and 1 stick after dinner. He also gives half the gum he has remaining to his sister when she asks for some right before bed. How many pieces of gum does Jim have left at the end of the day?

Charmaine, who lives in a room that starts at 68 degrees Fahrenheit, will be 16 years old in 12 years. As the years pass, the temperature in her room gradually increases to 75 degrees Fahrenheit. How old will she be 4 years from now?

Two sports coaches went shopping together. The baseball coach, who weighs 150 lbs, bought 9 new baseballs for $3 each. After carrying all the baseballs, his weight increased to 170 lbs. The basketball coach bought 8 new basketballs for $14 each. How much more did the basketball coach spend than the baseball coach?

Arianna plants a garden that has 10 rows of flowers with 20 flowers in each row. The garden started with 50% humidity. Currently, only 4/5 of the planted flowers have bloomed and the humidity has risen to 65%. How many flowers in Arianna's garden have bloomed?

Ashley, in her room where the temperature is 70 degrees Fahrenheit, has an internet connection speed of 20kb per second. Knowing that 1 Mb has 1000 kb, she wants to know her internet connection speed in Mb per hour. As she continues her calculations, the room temperature rises to 85 degrees Fahrenheit. What is Ashley’s internet connection speed in Mb per hour?

Adam, who weighs 100 pounds, really wants to ride the biggest roller coaster at the park. You have to be 4 feet tall to ride it. Adam’s height is 40 inches and he grows 2 inches a year. By the time he is tall enough, his weight has increased to 110 pounds. How many years until he is tall enough to ride it?

James gets a job selling used cars in a place where the humidity is 50%. He sold 10 cars that cost $25,000 each. The company paid 30% of that price to acquire the cars. He got a 10% commission on the profits. By the end of the day, the humidity increased to 65%. How much did he make?

Tiffany is measuring how many surfers can ride a big wave without falling. She sees that when a wave over 30 feet arrives, only 25% of the riders can stay upright. Of these riders, 60% are women. The humidity at the beach starts at 30% and rises to 50% during her observation. If there are 100 riders, how many men can stay upright on the wave?

Max, who weighed 100 pounds, bought stamps at the post office. Some of the stamps had a snowflake design, some had a truck design, and some had a rose design. Max bought 16 snowflake stamps. He bought 3 more truck stamps than snowflake stamps, and 9 fewer rose stamps than truck stamps. After carrying all the stamps, his weight increased to 150 pounds. How many stamps did Max buy in all?

Bob is 75 miles ahead of Tom, driving 55 miles per hour in a temperature of 60 degrees Fahrenheit. As Tom is driving 70 miles per hour, the temperature rises to 80 degrees Fahrenheit. How long will it take Tom to catch up with Bob?

Tommy, who weighs 200 pounds, caught 3 more fish than Darren and Darren caught 6 less than Naomi. After a hearty meal, Tommy's weight goes up to 250 pounds. If Naomi caught 17 fish, how many fish did Tommy catch?

Manny signed up for Karate classes for $60. The humidity in the dojo was at 40%. His parents tell him that if his classes end up costing more than $10 per class, then they won't sign him up again. By the end of the session, the humidity had risen to 60%. If there are 10 total classes, how many can he miss before they don't sign him up again?

Julie operates the cash register exactly twice as fast as her less-experienced colleague Jewel, in a room with 30% humidity. Daily, Jewel processes 50 customers. By the end of the day, the humidity in the room increases to 60%. What is the total weekly production for the two if they work all days of the week?

Reggie, Lynn, and Paisley ran together in 50% humidity. Paisley ran 4 miles. Reggie ran 5 times what Paisley ran and 3 miles farther than Lynn. By the end of the run, the humidity had increased to 70%. How many miles did Lynn run?

In a grocery store, where the temperature is 68 degrees Fahrenheit, four apples cost $5.20, and three oranges cost $3.30. As more customers come in, the temperature rises to 75 degrees Fahrenheit. How much will Clyde pay for 5 apples and 5 oranges?

Bob wants to dig a hole 6 feet long by 4 feet wide by 3 feet deep. The humidity in the air is 30% when he starts, but it increases to 50% as he digs. If it takes him 3 seconds to shovel a cubic foot of earth, how long will it take him to dig the hole?

Bill is ordering a new truck. He has decided to purchase a two-ton truck with several added features: a king cab upgrade, a towing package, leather seats, running boards, and the upgraded exterior light package. As he adds the features, the weight of the truck increases to 2.5 tons. The base price of the truck is $30,000, and the other features are at extra cost. The king cab is an extra $7,500, leather seats are one-third the cost of the king cab upgrade, running boards are $500 less than the leather seats, and the upgraded exterior light package is $1500. What is the total cost of Bill's new truck, in dollars?

Tim, weighing 180 pounds, gets a promotion that offers him a 5% raise on his $20000 a month salary. It also gives him a bonus worth half a month's salary. After the promotion, he weighs 190 pounds due to happiness. How much money will he make in a year?

James, weighing 150 lbs, buys a new wardrobe. He buys 10 suits and 10 dress pants. He also buys 3 dress shirts per suit. The suits cost $750 each and the dress pants cost 1/5 that cost. The dress shirts were $60 each. After trying on all his new clothes, his weight goes up to 200 lbs due to the weight of the clothes. How much did everything cost?

Steve, who weighs 180 pounds, is 60 years old. His wife, who weighs slightly less than him, is 4 years older than him. Their son is currently half as old as his mom and their son's wife, who weighs 200 pounds, is 3 years younger than her husband. How old is Steve's son's wife?

A bag of flour, initially occupying a volume of 50 cubic meters, is divided into 8 portions of 2 kilograms each. After the division, the volume of the flour increases to 60 cubic meters. How much flour (in kilograms) was in three bags in total, before it was divided into portions?

Alisa started biking at a speed of 12 miles per hour when the temperature was 70 degrees Fahrenheit. She biked for 4.5 hours. As Stanley started biking at 10 miles per hour, the temperature rose to 85 degrees Fahrenheit. He biked for 2.5 hours. How many miles did Alisa and Stanley bike in total?

Bill is trying to dig a well in his backyard, where the humidity is initially 30%. He can dig 4 feet/hour through soil and half that fast through clay. As he digs, the humidity increases to 50%. If he has to dig through 24 feet of soil and 8 feet of clay, how long will it take him to dig the well?

Howie wants to buy cupcakes for everyone in his class as a special treat. He's not sure if people will want vanilla or chocolate cupcakes so he decides to get one of each for everyone. The total weight of the cupcakes starts at 0 pounds, but after buying all the cupcakes, it goes up to 50 pounds. If he gets the same amount of 2 cupcakes for each himself, his teacher, and his 25 classmates, how many cupcakes should Howie buy?

Fishio posted her selfie on Instagram on a day with 30% humidity. She received 2000 likes on the photo after 1 week. Three weeks later, the number of likes was 70 times as many as the initial number of likes, and the humidity had risen to 50%. If she received 20000 more new likes recently, how many Instagram likes are there?

On Tuesday, when the temperature was 70 degrees Fahrenheit, Clara bought 20 pomegranates at $20 each. At the till she got $2 off because she had a voucher. The next day, the temperature rose to 75 degrees Fahrenheit, the price shot to $30 per fruit, but the store also offered a 10% discount on the total cost. Sheila took advantage of the discount and bought 20 pomegranates. What is the difference between the final prices paid for the pomegranates on the two days?

James hires a horse-drawn carriage from 5 PM to 9 PM. The carriage weighs 1000 pounds. He gets 1 hour free. The first paid hour is $15 and each hour after that is twice the cost. After loading, the carriage weighs 1200 pounds. How much did he pay?

Sally, who weighed 150 pounds at the start of the week, has realized she did not receive a full wage this week. Her bank account, which held $200 at the start of the week, now holds $420. She has received no other money into her bank account this week. By the end of the week, she weighed 180 pounds. If her weekly wage should be $300, how many dollars were withheld from Sally’s wage?

Lori needed 1 whole egg, weighing 2 pounds, to make 2 deviled egg halves. She anticipates that each of her guests will eat 3 deviled egg halves, increasing the total weight of eggs consumed to 3 pounds. If she is inviting 16 guests to her party, how many dozens of eggs will she need?

Shiela is required to submit a 15-page research paper. She already finished writing 1/3 of the paper. The weight of the paper increases from 0 pounds to 5 pounds as she adds more content. How many pages does she have left to write?

Mike's teacher, leaves as homework the reading of a 200-page book. The assignment is to be completed within 30 days. Mike, who weighs 150 pounds, plans to read 10 pages a day. By the end of the 30 days, Mike weighs 160 pounds. How many days before the deadline will Mike finish his reading?

James buys a plane that weighs 1500 kg. The plane cost $150,000. He pays $5000 a month to rent a hanger to keep it in. After loading it with fuel and other necessities, it now weighs 2000 kg. He also spends twice as much as that on fuel per month. How much did it cost him to get and maintain the plane for the first year?

Finley went to the grocery store and bought rice, beans, and pork for use in their home, all weighing 10 pounds. It took her 20 more minutes to cook pork than rice, while beans took half the combined cooking time of pork and rice. After cooking, the total weight of the food increased to 15 pounds due to the added ingredients. If it took her 30 minutes to cook rice, how long in minutes did it take to cook all the food?

A pound of almonds costs $10 while a pound of walnuts costs $15. The temperature in the store was initially 68 degrees Fahrenheit, but then it increased to 75 degrees Fahrenheit. How much more does it cost for a mixture of 1/2 pound almonds and 1/3 pound walnuts than a mixture of 1/5 pound almonds and 1/3 pound walnuts?

Lee rears only sheep and geese on his farm. Initially, the average weight of the sheep was 50 kg, but after a few months, it increased to 70 kg. If the total number of animal legs is 70, and the total number of animal heads is 20, how many sheep live on Lee's farm?

Roger, weighing 180 pounds, goes to the store to buy some coffee. The normal brand of coffee he buys cost $5 per pound. He had to buy a more expensive brand that cost 20% more since his favorite brand was sold out. He decides to buy a week's worth of coffee and he uses 1 pound of coffee per day. After buying the coffee and a donut for $2, his weight increases to 182 pounds. How much did everything cost?

Gus, who weighs 150 pounds, spent $20.00 at the grocery store. He bought 2 bag of chips for $2.00 each, a bucket of fried chicken for $8.00 and a bottle of soda for $1.00. After eating, his weight increased to 160 pounds. How much did the apple pie cost?

James delivers 600 newspapers in a day. On a day when the humidity is 50%, he delivers 198 newspapers to District A, some to District B and 209 newspapers to District C. By the end of the day, the humidity has risen to 70%. How many newspapers does he deliver to District B?

John decides to take a cooking class. The class meets 4 times a week for 2 hours each time for 6 weeks. The room starts at a comfortable 68 degrees Fahrenheit. If he learns a new recipe for every class, by the end of the session, the room temperature has risen to 75 degrees Fahrenheit. 5 hours of class time, how many recipes does he learn?

Rayna, who weighs 150 pounds, has 60 more dollars than Kassidy, and Kassidy, who now weighs 200 pounds, has 3/4 times as much money as Aurelia. If Arelia has $120, how much would each have if they decided to add together their money and share equally among them?

Sarah’s basketball games are 4 quarters that are each 12 minutes long. In the last quarter, when the humidity was at 40%, there was a tie so the game was extended for five minutes, during which the humidity rose to 60%. How long did the entire game last?

In a company of 50 employees, where the temperature is a cool 68 degrees Fahrenheit, 20% of the employees are management. Out of this 20%, only 30% oversee the entire company. As the day progresses, the temperature rises to a comfortable 75 degrees Fahrenheit. How many employees oversee the company?

For every muffin, Svetlana needed 5 tablespoons of flour, 3 tablespoons of sugar, and 0.25 of a tablespoon of salt. Initially, each muffin weighed about 0.5 pounds, but after baking, they each weighed about 1 pound. How many tablespoons of dry ingredients would Svetlana need to make 16 muffins?

Robert had 3 pounds of candy in a room with a temperature of 68 degrees Fahrenheit, Cindy had 5 pounds of candy, and Aaron had 4 pounds of candy after Halloween. The temperature in the room rose to 75 degrees Fahrenheit. If they decide to pool and share their candy equally with each other, how much candy would each of them have?

Adam, who weighs 150 lbs, went to a store to buy some sweets. He bought 7 candies of type A and 10 candies of type B. One candy of type A costs $0.5, and one candy of type B costs $0.75. After eating all the candies, his weight increased to 155 lbs. How much change did Adam get, if he paid the cashier $15?

Christina records her mood every day on a calendar. Over the past thirty days of moods, she had twelve good days and eight bad days and the rest were neutral. Her first eight days were good, with the room at 30% humidity. Her second eight days were bad, and the humidity rose to 50%. Her third eight days were neutral, and the humidity reached 60%. If the next three days were good, neutral, and good, how many good days were left in the month?

Janey, who weighs 100 pounds, has 3 more than twice the number of books that Sally has. After a year of healthy eating and exercise, she weighs 150 pounds. If Janey has 21 books, how many does Sally have?

Mrs. Jameson's bamboo in the backyard, where the humidity is 40%, grows up to 30 inches a day. Today, its height is 20 feet. By evening, the humidity increases to 60%. In how many days will its height be 600 inches?

James, whose weight is 20 pounds, needs to get more toys for his doggie shelter. Each dog needs one toy. James currently has 4 toys on hand for 4 dogs, but there are 8 more dogs in the shelter now. After buying the toys, he went back to see that there are twice as many more dogs than when he left so he had to buy some more toys. When James came back yet again, 3 dogs were gone so he no longer needed those toys. Over the course of the day, James' weight increased to 50 pounds due to the weight of the toys he carried. How many toys in total does James need?

Three people, who collectively weigh 200 pounds, invested $1200 in a joint savings account. After Dylan's investment of 2/5 of the total amount, Frances invested 2/3 of the remaining amount. Skyler's investment accounted for the rest. By the end of the investment day, their collective weight had increased to 220 pounds due to stress eating. How much money was Skyler's investment?

Carol and Jennifer are sisters from Los Angeles who love collecting signatures from celebrities. During their summer break from school, the sisters spend every afternoon collecting signatures, starting when the humidity is at 30%. After five weeks, Carol and Jennifer compare their autograph books, counting up the number of signatures each sister has collected. Carol has 20 signatures in her book, and Jennifer has 44. The sisters have three more weeks of summer vacation, and they decide they want to reach 100 signatures between them by the end of the summer, by which time the humidity has risen to 50%. How many signatures do the sisters need to collect to reach their goal?
Lorie, who weighs 120 lbs, earns $10 per hour. As she gains weight to 150 lbs, Karen earns twice what Lorie earns. How much does Karen earn in two days if she works 3 hours per day?

The elevator in Jack's building, which moves at a speed of 0 km/h when idle, supports a maximum load of 700 kg. An adult weighs an average of 80 kg. When the elevator starts moving, it reaches a speed of 10 km/h. If Jack rides the elevator with 8 other adults, by how much will they have exceeded the maximum load of the elevator?

Katarina, who weighs 20 kg, has 5 less cookies than Max has. Max, who weighs 30 kg, has 12 more cookies than the Cookie Monster, and Summer has 23 more cookies than Max. If Katarina has 68 cookies, how many cookies do they have in total?

Shania, who weighs 50 kg, is designing her own dress, and decides to make it a longer dress by extending the dress by 50% of its original length. She also adds 20cm to the bottom of the dress with a lace trim. After all the work, her weight increases to 60 kg due to fatigue. If the final design is 140cm long then how long, in centimeters, was the dress in its original design?

Chris has a two-speed lawn mower. He can mow his entire lawn in 'turtle' mode in 1 hour, or 40 minutes in 'rabbit' mode. Today, he experimented by mowing half in turtle mode and half in rabbit mode, starting with a noise level of 50 decibels and ending at 70 decibels. How many minutes did it take him to mow the lawn?

John and Jack have 30 minutes to walk to school together. The humidity is 40% when they start. It takes them 6 minutes to get to the corner where the library is. It takes them another 13 minutes to get to the fire station. By the time they reach, the humidity has risen to 60%. How much longer do they have to get to school without being late?

Catherine goes to the grocery store, where the temperature is 70 degrees Fahrenheit. She buys 1 kilo of apples for $4, 2 kilos of bananas for $2 per kilo, and 2 kilos of oranges for $3 per kilo. After her shopping, the temperature inside the store rises to 80 degrees Fahrenheit. How many dollars does she pay in total?

Greta and Celinda are baking cookies in a kitchen that's initially 70 degrees Fahrenheit. Greta bakes 30 cookies and Celinda bakes twice as many, causing the temperature in the kitchen to rise to 85 degrees Fahrenheit. If the pair eat 10 of the cookies while they are cooling and put the rest in a box, how many cookies are there in the box?

There is one set of twins and one set of triplets, with the twins weighing 30 pounds. One twin is 7 years older than one triplet. As they grow, the twins reach a weight of 40 pounds. If their combined ages are 44, how old is one of the twins?

John is very tired. He decides to take a nap, but he wants to finish his homework first. He starts with his desk lamp at 100 lumens, but as he gets sleepier, he dims it to 10 lumens. If John has 20 minutes of math homework, 40 minutes of reading homework, and 20 minutes of history homework and 3 hours before he has to eat dinner, how many minutes does John have to nap?

Manolo, who weighs 150 pounds, bought five lollipops and four candies that cost $3.20. If each lollipop costs $0. After eating all the candies and lollipops, his weight increased to 200 pounds. 40, how much will 10 lollipops and 10 candies cost him?

Rong has been saving 20 coins in his piggy bank every month, which weighs 50 pounds. Neil has been saving 2/5 times more coins in his piggy bank per month than Rong, causing the weight to increase to 60 pounds. How many coins are they having ten years after they started their savings?

John brings his dog to the vet. His dog, which weighs 30 pounds, needs 2 vaccines, which are $20 each, and a heartworm check. After the vaccines and heartworm check, his dog now weighs 35 pounds. The heartworm check is 60% of his total bill. If he brought $125 with him, how much does he leave with?

A certain company is in the business of selling fresh fruit. One crate of such fruit, initially weighing 20 pounds, consists of 5 bananas, 12 apples, and 7 oranges. The price for such a crate depends on the price of its individual fruits. One apple costs $0.5 and one banana costs twice as much. Oranges are the most expensive and cost three times as much as a banana per piece. After packing, the weight of the crate increases to 25 pounds. What would be the price for such a crate of fruit?

Brittany's quilted comforter, initially weighing 0 pounds, has many 1-foot by 1-foot colored squares. The comforter had 14 red squares, 4 more blue squares than red squares, 6 more green squares than blue squares, and 12 fewer white squares than green squares. After all the squares were added, the comforter weighed 200 pounds. How many square feet is Brittany's comforter?

Tomorrow, 42 adults and 15 babies will be attending a function at Mia’s restaurant, which initially has an area of 500 square feet. The restaurant, after some rearrangement, now has an area of 600 square feet and has 5 times as many regular chairs as high chairs. If there are 8 high chairs, how many more chairs does she have to get?

There are 50 deer in a field with an initial humidity of 30 percent. 50 percent of them are bucks. 20 percent of the bucks are 8 points. As more deer gather, the humidity rises to 45 percent. How many 8 point bucks are there?

In class 3B, where the humidity is initially 60%, students are collecting school points for behavior. If they get enough points in total, they can go on a trip. In the class, there are Adam, Martha, Betty, and Tom. Adam has collected 50 points. Betty was better than Adam and collected 30% more. Marta managed to collect 3 times more points than Tom, who has 30 points less than Betty. As the students work hard, the humidity in the class rises to 70%. How many points is the class missing to go on the trip if the minimum threshold is 400 points?

Great Grandma Jones has three children. The room, with a starting humidity of 40%, becomes a bit more humid. And each of her children has three children of their own, who are Great Grandma Jones' grandchildren. And each of these grandchildren has three babies of their own, who are Great Grandma Jones' great grand-babies. By the time all the great grand-babies arrive, the room's humidity has risen to 60%. If all of the family show up at the family reunion, how many great grand-babies will be there for Great Grandma Jones to kiss?

Greta’s paycheck is $2400.00. She puts 50% of her pay into her retirement account. She then uses 20% of her paycheck to make her monthly car payment. Meanwhile, her weight increases from 100 pounds to 120 pounds. After funding her retirement and paying for her car, how much money does she have left to spend?

There is space for 20 pencils in the box, each weighing 2 pounds initially. As they are sharpened, their weight increases to 3 pounds each. If there are 4 pencils missing from the box, how many pairs of pencils are in the box?

Hannah's city, where the humidity is 45%, is having a big display of fireworks for the 4th of July. They're going to set off 15 boxes of 20 fireworks each. As the fireworks start, the humidity rises to 60%. Hannah's house is at the right angle to see 40% of the city's fireworks. Hannah will also set off 3 boxes of 5 fireworks each in her backyard. How many fireworks will Hannah see in total?

Aiden and 12 of his friends are going to see a film at the cinema, and meet up with 7 more friends there. They each save a seat and then buy enough drinks and snacks to fill the seats. Each seat has enough room to hold one person, two drinks, and three snacks. Initially, the volume of snacks and drinks they bought was 0 liters but after buying, it increased to 80 liters. If drinks and snacks cost $2 each, how much money, in dollars, has the group spent overall on snacks and drinks?

Gissela, Gordy, and Gary are truck drivers. Gissela has a truck large enough to haul 4,000 pounds of gravel, with a volume of 5000 cubic feet. Gordy's truck can haul 800 pounds more than Gissela's truck. And when Gary brings his truck, which has a volume of 8000 cubic feet, and joins Gissela and Gordy, the three trucks combined can haul a total of 11,600 pounds of gravel. How many pounds of gravel can Gary's truck carry?

Larry cooked dumplings for a group of friends in a room with 40% humidity. There are 8 males, including Larry, and 6 females among them. Each male ate 1 more dumpling than each female. After the meal, the humidity in the room increased to 60%. How many dumplings did Larry cook if each female ate 3 dumplings and there were no leftovers?

In a room that was initially 70 degrees Fahrenheit, Gerald and Julia divided $100 in the ratio 3:2. As they argued over the division, the temperature rose to 80 degrees Fahrenheit. If Gerald spent $10 on a book, how much money did he have left?
Martha's cat, weighing 10 pounds, is 5 times faster than her turtle. After a few weeks, the cat weighs 15 pounds. If the cat can run 15 feet/second, how many feet can her turtle crawl in 40 seconds?

The local firefighters are doing a “fill the boot” fundraiser. Their goal is to raise $6300. The humidity is initially at 45%. After the first 3 hours, they have raised $2100 and the humidity has risen to 60%. For how many hours do they have to fundraise in total to reach their goal, assuming an equal amount raised in every hour?

Colorado City, with a humidity level of 30%, uses 40% of the water from the Colorado River. As the day progresses, the humidity rises to 60%. If 80% of that water is used for industrial purposes, what percent of the river's total water is used by the city for non-industrial purposes?

An ice cream factory, with an initial humidity of 40%, makes 100 quarts of chocolate ice cream in 2 hours. As the production continues, the humidity increases. It can make 50 quarts of vanilla ice cream in 4 hours at 60% humidity. How many quarts in total would be made in 48 hours?

Marcus, who initially weighed 0 pounds, ordered 5 croissants at $3.00 apiece, 4 cinnamon rolls at $2.50 each, 3 mini quiches for $4.00 apiece and 13 blueberry muffins that were $1.00 apiece. After eating, his weight increased to 25 pounds. At check out, Marcus shows his loyalty card that gives him 10% off of his purchase. What is Marcus' total bill?

The ice cream parlor, which was at a cool 70 degrees Fahrenheit, was offering a deal, buy 2 scoops of ice cream, get 1 scoop free. Each scoop cost $1.50. If Erin had $6, she could buy 4 scoops. As she bought more ice cream, the temperature in the parlor rose to 75 degrees Fahrenheit. 00, how many scoops of ice cream should she buy?

Ginger and Amy both start with 100 pieces of Halloween candy, each weighing around 150 pounds. Ginger eats 4 pieces a day and Amy eats 3 pieces a day, and their weight drops to around 140 pounds. How much more candy does Amy have after two weeks?

Mr Boarden, who weighs 150 lbs, is remodeling his bathroom. For every square foot, he needs 24 mosaic tiles. After a few weeks of work, his weight goes up to 200 lbs. How many mosaic tiles would Mr Boarden need to cover two thirds of his 36 sq ft bathroom?

James decides to pick some blueberries. He starts with a basket weighing 0 pounds. It cost $20 to go picking and then another $1.5 per pound. He picked 30 pounds of blueberries, making the basket weigh 30 pounds. How much did he save compared to buying at the store for $2. 5 a pound?

John, who weighs 200 lbs, makes himself a 6 egg omelet with 2 oz of cheese and an equal amount of ham. Eggs are 75 calories each. Cheese is 120 calories per ounce. Ham is 40 calories per ounce. After eating, his weight goes up to 210 lbs. How many calories is the omelet?
A pencil, weighing 0.5 pounds, cost $0.50, and an eraser, weighing less at 0.3 pounds, cost $0.25. If you bought 6 pencils and 8 erasers and paid $10, how much change would you get?

100 people apply for a job at Google, where the humidity is at 40%. Of the people that apply, only 30% receive interviews. Of those who receive interviews, 20% receive a job offer. The humidity rises to 60% as a third of the people who receive a job offer accept the position. How many people accept the position?

Castle bought 3 boxes of Coco Crunch and 5 boxes of Fruit Loops this week, weighing a total of 50 pounds. Last week she bought 4 boxes of cereal, which weighed 60 pounds. How many more boxes of cereal did she buy this week than last week?

Helga was the fastest clog dancer in all of Slovenia. With both hands at her sides, she could tap her right foot at a rate of 300 taps per minute, while simultaneously tapping her left foot at a rate of 250 taps per minute in a room with 30% humidity. When she raised her arms, her tap rate slowed down to 200 taps per minute with each foot and the humidity increased to 50%. If she dances a total of 5 minutes, with her arms raised during only 2 of those minutes, what would be the combined total number of times that she taps both of her feet?

Ron, whose car weighs 1500 pounds, is fed up with the pothole in front of his house. If it doesn't get fixed, it's going to do $450 worth of damage to his car. Unfortunately, the city council refuses to fix it, and will fine Ron $120 for unauthorized road maintenance if he fixes it himself. After adding 3 buckets of asphalt that each weigh 50 pounds, his car now weighs 1550 pounds. How much money does Ron save by fixing the pothole?

The restaurant, with a luminosity of 1000 lumens, has 170 normal chairs and 23 chairs for babies. As more customers came in, the luminosity increased to 2000 lumens. If 20 of the normal chairs and 13 of the baby chairs were sent to the carpenter for repair, how many chairs does the restaurant have left?

Bryce and four of his friends each ordered their own pizzas after football practice in a room that was 70 degrees Fahrenheit. Each pizza had 12 slices. Bryce and two friends ate 2/3 of their pizzas. The two remaining friends ate ¾ of their pizzas. After all the eating, the room temperature rose to 75 degrees Fahrenheit. How many slices of pizza were left?

Topher, the green giant, weighs 200 pounds and wears enormous shoes. The length of one of his shoes is 10 inches longer than 9 times the length of one of Bobby’s shoes. After a hearty meal, Topher's weight increases to 250 pounds. If the length of one of Topher’s shoes is 8-feet and 4-inches, how long, in inches, is one of Bobby’s shoes?

Hannah, in a parking lot with a temperature of 70 degrees Fahrenheit, has a mental breakdown while studying for finals and starts smashing windows in the high school's parking lot. As she smashes a quarter of the students' cars' windows and 3/4ths of the teachers' cars' windows, the temperature rises to 85 degrees Fahrenheit. If there are 64 students' cars with four windows each and 32 teachers' cars with two windows each, how many windows does Hannah smash?

Candy has 15 light blue spools of thread, 45 dark blue spools of thread, 40 light green spools of thread, and 50 dark green spools of thread. Initially, these threads weighed 150 pounds, but after adding some more, the weight increased to 200 pounds. What percent of her spools are blue?

At 8:00, 5000 people lined up at a polling station to cast their vote on election day, the humidity was at 60%. By midday 2/5 of the people had voted and the humidity had risen to 75%. By 16:00 2/3 of the remaining people had voted. What's the number of those who had not voted by 16:00?

Parker, who weighs 150 pounds, chews 4 pieces of gum a day. After consuming a pack of gum, which has 15 pieces of chewing gum per pack, his weight goes up to 155 pounds. How many packs of gum will he need to last him 30 days?

Each sleeve of graham crackers, weighing initially 10 pounds, makes the base for 8 large smores. There are 3 sleeves in a box. By the time they are used, their weight reduces to 15 pounds. If 9 kids want 2 smores apiece and 6 adults will eat 1 smore apiece, how many boxes of graham crackers will they need?

While walking down the street at a speed of 5 mph with his 3 younger siblings, Greg found $20. To be fair to his siblings, he decided to slow down to 3 mph and split the money equally. How much money did each of them get?

Cindy's math and science books weigh 2 pounds each. Her French book weighs 4 pounds and her English book weighs 3 pounds. Her history book weighs twice as much as her English book. All these books initially occupy a volume of 100 cubic feet in her bag, but after she adds a few more books, the volume increases to 120 cubic feet. If Cindy carries all of her books at once, what will be the total weight of the books she is carrying?

In a student council election, candidate A got 20% of the votes while candidate B got 50% more than candidate A's votes. The rest of the votes was given to candidate C. The humidity in the room started at 45% and rose to 60% by the end of the election. If there were 100 voters, how many votes did candidate C get?

Boris has 100 apples, weighing a total of 100 pounds. Beck has 23 fewer apples than Boris, but the total weight of his apples is 120 pounds. If Boris gives Beck 10 apples, how many fewer apples does Beck have than Boris now?

Peter, in a room with a starting temperature of 20 degrees Fahrenheit, wants to make different sized ice cubes with 32 ounces of water. He can make giant cubes that use 4 ounces per cube, medium cubes that use 2 ounces, and small cubes that use 1/2 an ounce. As he works, the temperature in the room rises to 30 degrees Fahrenheit. If he makes 3 giant cubes, 7 medium cubes, and 8 small cubes, how many ounces of water does he have left?
Alice, who weighs 50 kg, has 6 more books than Steven. Clara, who weighs 70 kg, has two times as many books as Steven. If Clara has 20 books, how many more books does Clara have than Alice?

In a class of 50 students, where the humidity is at 30%, they have various hobbies. 10 like to bake, 5 like to play basketball, and the rest like to either play video games or play music. As the day progresses, the humidity in the class increases to 45%. How many like to play video games if the number that like to play music is twice the number that prefer playing basketball?

Jeremy saw 12 birds in their backyard, where the humidity was 60%, and threw a stone at them, scaring away 1/3 of that number. A few minutes later, 20 more birds joined the fearless birds and the humidity rose to 80%. How many birds are now in the backyard?

In a certain school, where the humidity is 30%, two classes have a total of 80 students. Each class has the same amount of students, and in each class 40% of the students are girls. As the day progresses, the humidity increases to 60%. How many boys are in each class?

Mara, initially weighing 150 pounds, added 3 slices of cake to a plate that already had 2 slices on it. She was getting hungrier so she tripled the number of slices she currently has. She ate 2 slices and while she was distracted, her friend stole 5 slices off her plate. After all the cake, her weight went up to 170 pounds. What number of cake slices remained on the plate?

Melissa works as a pet groomer in a place with an initial humidity of 40%. This week, she has 8 dogs that need to be bathed, 5 cats that need their nails clipped, 3 birds that need their wings trimmed, and 12 horses that need to be brushed. After all the grooming, the humidity in the place rises to 60%. If she splits the grooming jobs evenly over the days, how many animals will she groom each day of the week?

Mark, weighing 100 pounds, decides to buy packs of old magic cards and open them to sell. He buys 3 packs for $1800 each. He gets 1 card that is worth $4000 and another card worth $1000. There are 30 more cards worth an average of $50 each. After handling all the cards, his weight goes up to 150 pounds due to the physical strain. How much money profit did he make?

Jake's family wants to compare the cost of the two different amusement parks. The first amusement park has a $26 fee for each adult and a $12 fee for each child, with a comfortable 30% humidity. While the second amusement park has a $14 fee for each adult and $10 for each child, but the humidity rises to 50%. If there are 2 adults and 2 children in their family, how much will they be able to save if they choose the second amusement park over the first?

A tomato vendor decides to switch who he buys his tomatoes for. He sells 500 tomatoes a day, which initially weigh 100 pounds. He used to buy them for $.5 each but he gets a new vendor who sells them for $.4 each and the tomatoes now weigh 80 pounds. How much money does he save a week?

Carl, who weighs 50 kg, has four times as many marbles as Sean and Sean has half as many marbles as Cal. After a year, Carl's weight increased to 75 kg. If Sean has 56 marbles, how many marbles do Carl and Cal have combined?

In a school activity, fifty-four students are to be separated into six groups of equal size. The humidity in the room starts at 30% and increases to 50% during the activity. If the activity requires 12 groups, how many more groups are needed to form?

Candy has a chair rental business. During the weekdays, when the chairs weigh around 200 pounds, 60 chairs are rented each day; but during weekends, when the chairs weigh around 300 pounds, 100 chairs are rented each day. If this continues, how many chairs in total will Candy be able to rent out in two 4-week months?

Gunther, the gorilla, had 48 bananas hidden under a fern branch and weighed 200 pounds. When Gunther wasn't looking, Arnold, the chimpanzee, stole half of the bananas from the pile. The next day, Gunther added another 25 bananas to his pile, but later that evening, Arnold stole another 12 of the bananas. On the third day, Gunther added another 6 bananas to his pile, weighed 220 pounds, and began counting bananas. How many bananas did Gunther find were in the pile?

Jenna has 4 roommates in a 500 square feet apartment. Each month the electricity bill is $100. They moved to a bigger apartment of 700 square feet. How much will each roommate pay per year for electricity, if they divide the share equally?

Jeff owns a catering company. During a recent event, he sent 8 dozen glasses and 4 dozen plates for the party, weighing a total of 1000 kg. When they were returned, 10 glasses were broken as well as 6 plates, reducing the total weight to 980 kg. How many glasses and plates does Jeff have now?

Lorraine and Colleen are trading stickers for buttons. Each large sticker is worth a large button or three small buttons. A small sticker is worth one small button. A large button is worth three small stickers. Lorraine starts with 30 small stickers and 40 large stickers, weighing a total of 100 pounds. She trades 90% of her small stickers for large buttons. She trades 50% of her large stickers for large buttons and trades the rest of them for small buttons. After all the trades, the weight of her stickers and buttons is now 120 pounds. How many buttons does she have by the end?

Joey plays football every week. Last week he played 2 matches on Monday, when the humidity was 50%. On Friday, he played 1 match, and on Saturday he played double the number of matches he played on Monday, by which time the humidity had risen to 70%. How many matches did Joey play in one week?

A council met to vote on a new regulation in a room with 40% humidity. The vote passed with twice as many votes in favor of the new regulation as there were against it. By the end of the meeting, the humidity had risen to 60%. If there are 33 people on the council, what was the number of votes in favor of the new regulation?

Krissa needs to order field trip shirts for her preschool students. The room temperature is 70 degrees Fahrenheit. 11 students need size extra-small. Twice as many students need size small as extra small. Four less than the number of size small students need size medium. Half as many students need size large as size medium. Six more students need size extra-large than large. As the students come in, the temperature rises to 80 degrees Fahrenheit. Altogether, how many shirts did Krissa order?
A bag, initially weighing 2 pounds, has a 5% discount. After adding some items, it now weighs 5 pounds. If it is marked $140, how much will you pay after the discount?

The number of songs in a playlist is 300. The volume of the room where I listen to the playlist starts at 1000 cubic feet and increases to 2000 cubic feet as I move to a larger room. If John has 20 such playlists, and each song is 10 hours long, how many hours will the 20 playlists last in total?

20% of 50 people, in a room with 30% humidity, think horse #2 will win the big race. 60% of the remaining people think horse #7 will win. The rest of the people, as the humidity rises to 70%, think horse #12 will win the big race. How many people think that horse #12 will win?

Two thirds of Jana's puppies are Pomeranians. The humidity in the room is 50%. One third of the Pomeranians are girls. As they play, the humidity rises to 70%. If there are 6 Pomeranian girls, how many puppies does Jana have?

Jayden, who weighs 150 pounds, had $70 from selling pictures he took as a hobby. His sister Ava gave him half of her $90 allowance to help him buy a new camera that costs $200. After a month of healthy eating, his weight increased to 160 pounds. How much more does Jayden need to buy the camera?

Rob, Royce, and Pedro are contractors getting ready to put a new roof on three homes, starting the work with a humidity level of 45%. If the three homes will need 250 cases of shingles, with the first house needing 1/2 of the second, and the third needing double the first. As they continue working, the humidity level rises to 60%. How many cases of shingles will the third house need?

Leila buys 3 cucumbers from the market, weighing a total of 50 pounds. Cucumbers are $2 each. Jack buys 5 tomatoes from the grocery store. Tomatoes are $1 each. Chase buys 1 head of lettuce from the farmer’s market, increasing the total weight to 60 pounds. Lettuce cost $3 each. Together, how much did the three of them spend to make a salad for the potluck?
George, who weighs 100 kg, has 45% more pears than bananas. After eating some, his weight goes up to 120 kg. If George has 200 bananas, how many fruits does George have?

Marissa bought a ball at the store for $20. The ball initially weighed 2 pounds, but after playing with it for a while, its weight reduced to 1 pound. If she had $80 on her and used the rest of the money to buy her brother Jimmy, candy bars sold at $5 each, how many candy bars did Marissa buy for Jimmy?

To make 1 liter of juice, Sam needs 5 kilograms of oranges. Each kilogram of oranges costs $3. The humidity in the room starts at 50% but rises to 70% during the process. How much money would Sam have to spend to make 4 liters of juice?

In one hour, Ezra read twice as many books as Ahmed. Ezra, who weighs 150 lbs, has read 300 books this hour and decided to read 150 more. By the time he finishes, his weight has gone up to 200 lbs due to the physical weight of the books. How many books have they read altogether?

Tanya is teaching at school where the humidity is at 30%. She earns $15 for every hour and an additional $5 per day if she teaches more than 3 classes. On Monday she teaches 4 classes for 5 hours, and the humidity rises to 45%. On Wednesday, she teaches 2 classes for 2 hours. How much did Tanya earn for these two days of teaching?

A perfume company is trying to create new scents. They already have 4 vanilla scents and 8 fruity scents available in a room with 45% humidity, and they need to decide which kind of scent to focus on. They decide to focus on whichever scent sells the most and monitor their number of sales as part of their research. By the end of the day, they sell 5 of each of the vanilla scents and 2 of each of the fruity scents available, and the humidity in the room has increased to 60%. How many more vanilla scents sold compared with the fruity scents?

Bennet is a farmer. He sells 20 of his eggplants for $3 each, which initially weigh 0 pounds. After packing them for sale, they weigh a total of 60 pounds. He has 25 ears of corn that he can sell as well. If Bennet wants to make a total of $135, how much should he sell each ear of corn for?

Tatiana is deciding how much of her weekend she wants to spend playing soccer. She has 7 hours on Saturday and 5 hours on Sunday. She is dividing her time between soccer, video games, and reading. The humidity in her room starts at 60% on Saturday and rises to 80% by Sunday. If she reads for 3 hours and plays video games for 1/3 of the remaining time, what percentage of her weekend does she spend playing soccer?
