Anthony, who weighs 100 pounds, had 50 pencils. He gave 1/2 of his pencils to Brandon, and he gave 3/5 of the remaining pencils to Charlie. After giving away the pencils, his weight dropped to 80 pounds. He kept the remaining pencils. How many pencils did Anthony keep?

Jack decides to visit a museum 150 miles from home. The temperature at home is 70 degrees Fahrenheit. He drives 75 mph there and back. He spends 6 hours at the museum where the temperature is 80 degrees Fahrenheit. How long is he gone from home?

Henry, who weighs 500 pounds, needs to assemble some toys, specifically 57 cars and 73 motorcycles. As he assembles the toys, his weight increases due to the physical exertion and the weight of the toys. After assembling all the toys, he weighs 700 pounds. Henry knows that to assemble all the toys he will need 4 wheels for each car and 2 wheels for each motorcycle. How many wheels will be left if he has a box with 650 wheels in it?
The price of a laptop is $1000. Initially, the laptop weighs 2 pounds, but after adding some accessories, it weighs 5 pounds. If you get a 20% discount, how much do you have to pay?

Mike decides he wants to replace his movie collection, which weighs 2000 pounds, with digital versions. He has 600 movies. A third of the movies are in various series and he knows he can get those for only $6 of the cost of a normal movie by just buying the series together. 40% of the remaining movies are older movies which are $5. After replacing them with digital versions, the weight of his collection is now 2500 pounds. How much does replacing the movies cost if a normal movie costs $10?

At the local Pick Your Own fruit orchard, where the humidity starts at 30%, you could pick your own peaches for $2.00 per pound, plums were $1.00 per pound and apricots were $3.00 per pound. As more people came in to pick fruits, the humidity rose to 45%. If Winston picked 6 pounds of peaches, 8 pounds of plums and 6 pounds of apricots, how much did he spend on fruit?

The Llesis family drove and hiked 6 hours to their vacation spot, starting off at a comfortable 70 degrees Fahrenheit. They drove an average of 50 miles per hour and hiked an average of 5 miles per hour less than half their speed when they drive. As they reached their vacation spot, the temperature had risen to 80 degrees Fahrenheit. If it took them 1. 5 hours to hike, how far was their vacation spot?

Ava and Emma want to know who is better at the new video game Ava got for her birthday. They are each going to play one level and whoever has the highest score wins. They receive 10 points for every enemy they jump on, 5 points for each berry they collect, and 30 points for every second left on the timer when they finish the level. The room starts at a comfortable 50% humidity, but as the competition heats up, the humidity rises to 70%. If Ava jumps on 8 more enemies than Emma and collects 3 more berries, but finishes the level 4 seconds slower, what is the difference between their two scores?

Four friends, who together weigh 200 pounds, ordered four pizzas for a total of 64 dollars. After eating, their combined weight is 220 pounds. If two of the pizzas cost 30 dollars, how much did each of the other two pizzas cost if they cost the same amount?

Chase and Rider can ride their bikes thrice a day for 5 days; but on two other days, they ride twice the times they do on usual days. The humidity in the air changes from 45% at the start of the week to 65% by the end. How many times do they ride their bikes a week?

Bob had 7 fish in his ornamental fish pond, which had a volume of 500 gallons. 3 were orange, and 4 were white. He decided he wanted to get some more, so he went to the pet store. He had a sales assistant at the pet shop dip out 17 fish out of a mixed tank of both white and orange fish. When he got them home and added them to his pond, which now had a volume of 600 gallons, he found that he now had twice as many orange fish as white fish. How many white fish did Bob buy at the store?

Andy's car, with a fuel efficiency of 10 MPG, is parked in the garage where the temperature is 70 degrees Fahrenheit. After a long drive, the temperature in the garage rises to 85 degrees Fahrenheit. If the current price for regular gas is $3/gallon, how much money is Andy's car consuming per week if he only uses his car to go to work from Monday to Friday and the one-way distance between his home and office is 5 miles?

Ricardo grows tomatoes and eggplants in his garden, which initially has 60% humidity. Each tomato plant yields 22 tomatoes while each plant of eggplant yields 4 eggplants. He planted 5 tomato plants and 8 plants of eggplant. As the plants grow, the humidity in the garden increases to 80%. How many fruits can Ricardo get from his plants?

Samwell owns an appliances store. The store has a humidity of 45%. For this week, one-fourth of their sales are smart TVs, one-eighth are analog TVs, and the rest are OLED TVs. As the week progresses, the humidity in the store increases to 60%. If they were able to sell a total of 40 TVs, how many OLED TVs were they able to sell?

John, who weighs 50 kg, is raising money for a school trip. He has applied for help from the school, which has decided to cover half the cost of the trip. After months of stress eating, his weight increases to 70 kg. How much money is John missing if he has $50 and the trip costs $300?

Carson lives in an old house where the pipes will freeze if the temperature inside the house falls below 32 degrees. The house starts at 40% humidity. Every log of wood Carson burns heats the house up by 5 degrees and increases the humidity to 60%. If it was 45 degrees during the day, and it's 33 degrees colder during the night compared to the day, how many logs does Carson need to burn to prevent the pipes from freezing?

At the trip to the county-level scavenger hunt competition, where the humidity was initially at 50%, 90 people were required to split into groups for the competition to begin. As more people gathered, the humidity rose to 70%. To break people up into smaller groups with different leaders, 9-person groups were formed. If 3/5 of the number of groups each had members bring back 2 seashells each, how many seashells did they bring?

A train, moving at 60 mph, has 172 people traveling on it. At the first stop, where the speed drops to 50 mph, 47 people get off and 13 more people get on. At the next stop, the train slows further to 40 mph, and another 38 people get off. How many people are on the train?

Damien, who weighs 150 pounds, created a currency based on bottle caps and got his friends to take part. After picking up 10 bottle caps a day on his way home, his weight increased to 170 pounds as each bottle cap is worth $.25. How much money does he make in a 30 day month?

Jamie, working in a room with a temperature of 68 degrees Fahrenheit, earns $20 per hour for 8 hours of work each day. Should she need to work additional hours, she is paid a special hourly rate that is 150% of her regular hourly rate. Last Tuesday, she worked 11 hours and the room temperature increased to 75 degrees Fahrenheit. How much was she paid, in dollars, for her work that day?

In the enclosure, where the humidity is 45%, a zookeeper is counting how many lions are there. She counts 12 female lions, half as many male lions, and 14 lion cubs. As the day progresses, the humidity rises to 65%. How many lions are in the enclosure?

Mike, weighing 180 pounds, needed a new pair of jeans. When he got to the mall he saw that his favorite jeans were advertised 25% off. The original price of the jeans was $40. After trying on several pairs and deciding on one, Mike, now weighing 170 pounds, wondered how much money will he have left over if he pays with a $50. 00 bill?

A company's HR hires 20 new employees every month to add to its total workforce. The office starts at a comfortable 45% humidity, but with the influx of new employees, the humidity increases to 55%. If the company's initial employee number is 200, and each employee is paid a $4000 salary per month, calculate the total amount of money the company pays to its employees after three months?

Carrie, in a room with 40% humidity, is planning the caroling schedule. The choir plans to sing 'Deck the Halls' twice and 'Jingle Bells' once. As they sing, the humidity in the room increases to 60%. If "Deck the Halls" is 150 seconds long and "Jingle Bells" is 240 seconds long, how long will they be caroling?

When Billy was first hired, he was paid at a rate of $10 per hour in a room with a temperature of 68 degrees Fahrenheit. After 2 months, he was given a raise of $0.50 per hour. On his first anniversary at work, he was given a raise of $1.00 per hour and the room temperature was increased to 75 degrees Fahrenheit. Sally just started working at a different business, and her starting salary is $0.50 more per hour than Billy's starting salary was. If both Billy and Sally work 20 hours, how much more money will Billy earn than Sally, in dollars?
A loaf of bread at the bakery, weighing 5 pounds, costs $2. Bagels, now weighing 10 pounds, cost $1 each. How much more do 3 loaves of bread cost than 2 bagels?

In the bowling alley, with a starting humidity of 50%, Pierson scored 278 points in one game. As Nikita scored 11 more than half as many as Pierson, the humidity in the alley increased to 65%. How many points did Pierson and Nikita have in total?

At Ashley's school, where the humidity is initially 45%, they start a reforestation campaign where each child plants a tree and each teacher plants 2 trees. The school has 40 classes with an average of 25 students and 3 teachers per class. As the trees grow, the humidity in the school area increases to 60%. How many trees will they have planted at the end of the campaign?

Bubbles collects stuffed animals. She has three stuffed puppies, five stuffed koalas, two stuffed zebras and four stuffed frogs. Initially, the total weight of her collection is 14 pounds, but after adding a few more, it increases to 20 pounds. If she wants to buy enough stuffed goats, such that the percentage of stuffed goats is 30% of all of her stuffed animals, how many stuffed goats should she buy?

Kris is trying to earn a video game achievement for playing a total of 30 hours. The volume of the game starts at 60 decibels and gradually increases to 80 decibels as he gets more immersed. If Kris plays for half an hour every day for 2 weeks then plays for 2 hours every day for a week, how many hours does she still need to play to earn the achievement?

Two cars are driving on a highway with an initial temperature of 68 degrees Fahrenheit. The first car is traveling at an average speed of 60 miles per hour when the second car passes it at an average speed of 70 miles per hour. The temperature on the highway rises to 75 degrees Fahrenheit. If both cars continue on the highway at the same speed, how many miles will separate them after 2 hours?

James buys a ring for his bride-to-be. The diamond, weighing 1 pound, cost $600 and the gold cost $300. After adding more gold, the ring now weighs 1.5 pounds. He pays a 30% premium for it to be made. How much did he pay?

Janet is collecting the results of Herbert Hoover Elementary School's annual standardized test. The humidity in the room starts at 30%. 340 out of 500 third-graders passed, along with 40 out of 100 fourth graders. The 400 fifth graders had a pass rate that was twice the fourth grades' pass rate. By the end of the test, the humidity has risen to 45%. What is the school's overall pass rate?

Milo is making a mosaic with chips of glass. It takes twelve glass chips to make every square inch of the mosaic. A bag of glass chips holds 72 chips and weighs 5 pounds. Milo wants his mosaic to be three inches tall. As he adds more glass chips, the weight of the bag increases to 15 pounds. If he has two bags of glass chips, how many inches long can he make his mosaic?

There are 10 quarts of tea left from the party, with the room temperature at 68 degrees Fahrenheit. Four students each drank 1.5 quarts of tea and the temperature rose to 72 degrees. Then, 16 students each drank 2 quarts of tea and the temperature further increased to 75 degrees Fahrenheit. How many gallons of tea were at the beginning of the party?

Dale is selling butterscotch candies to raise money for his club at school. He doesn't have the candies yet and is instead just taking orders. He started off with 100 total that he ordered and wanted to sell, but he ended up selling 150 butterscotch candies. The weight of the candies he sold was initially 0 pounds, but after selling 150 candies, it went up to 300 pounds. Then he ordered 100 more. How many does Dale still need to sell to sell all of his candy?

In one year, the number of students on campus doubles at the end of every month. The humidity on campus also changes, starting at 30% and rising to 60% by the end of the year. If there are 10 students on campus at the beginning of the year, how many additional students would have joined by the end of May, above and beyond the number of students already on campus at the beginning of the year?

Felix notices that kids in the neighborhood are always getting things stuck in trees. Since he is an expert tree climber, he decided to start charging kids to get their stuff out. He charges based on how high he has to climb. Every branch he has to climb up costs $.25. During the week he made $105. The temperature was 70 degrees Fahrenheit at the start of the week and rose to 80 degrees Fahrenheit by the end of the week. On average, how many branches did he climb per day?

Rose is out picking flowers for a vase she wants to fill. She starts off by picking 3 flowers with 5 petals each, weighing 0 kg in total. She then picks 4 flowers with 6 petals each, increasing the total weight to 0.5 kg. She then adds another 5 flowers with 4 petals each, making the total weight 1 kg. Lastly she picks 6 flowers with 7 petals each, bringing the total weight to 1.5 kg. As she's carrying these flowers over to fill the vase, she drops 1 of each and the wind blows them away. She puts the remaining flowers in the vase. How many petals in total are on the flowers in the vase?

John and DeSean bought a bag of marshmallows to make s'mores together. Initially, the bag weighs 10 pounds. The bag has 35 marshmallows. Each S'more uses one marshmallow. After making some s'mores, the bag now weighs 15 pounds. If John makes 9 S'mores, DeSean makes 9 S'mores, and they dropped 3 marshmallows on the ground, how many S'mores can each kid have with the marshmallows left in the bag?

A new arcade opens up and Jack decides to play with his 3 friends, the temperature inside is 70 degrees Fahrenheit. Jack can play a game with 1 quarter for 20 minutes. Two of his friends are significantly worse than him and can only play half as long. One of them is significantly better and can play for 1.5 times as long. They play for 4 hours and the temperature rises to 75 degrees Fahrenheit. How much money is used?

Tanya makes a salt scrub from salt, oil, fragrance, citrus zest, and sugar. She makes enough to fill a 10-ounce jar each time. She uses the same amount of citrus zest as fragrance and the same amount of salt as sugar. She uses twice as much oil as salt and twice as much salt as zest. The total weight of the ingredients she uses initially is 2 pounds but after adding some more salt and oil, the total weight goes up to 3 pounds. How many ounces of oil does she use?

John goes to the market, where the total weight of the goods is 1000 pounds, and buys 3 goats for $500 each and 2 cows for $1500 each. After his purchases, the total weight of the goods increases to 1500 pounds. How much money did he spend?

Paul, who weighs 200 pounds, needs 63 cupcakes for a birthday party happening on Saturday. He already has 8 chocolate cupcakes and 40 toffee cupcakes. After eating some cupcakes, his weight goes up to 250 pounds. How many more cupcakes should Paul buy?

Joe, whose car collection weighs a total of 2000 pounds, has twice as many cars as Robert. He sells 20% of them and gives away twice as many cars as the number he sold to his mother. Now, his collection weighs 1800 pounds. If Robert has 20 cars, how many cars does joe remain with after selling and giving some to his mother?

Twenty students are working together to raise money for a charity. Each earns the same amount. The charity raises a total of $175,000. $50,000 comes from organizations and the rest from the students. The weight of the money initially was 200 pounds but after all the earnings, it increased to 250 pounds. How much did each student raise?

Hunter counted 50 cars packed in their school parking lot when entering class one morning, with the humidity being at 60%. During the first break, he counted 20 more cars in the parking lot. When he got out of class for the lunch break, he realized that 1/2 the number of cars in the parking lot had gone and the humidity had risen to 80%. What's the total number of cars he counted during lunch break?

John does 30 cycles of work a day in 40% humidity. Each cycle has 5 different tasks and each task pays $1.20. By the end of the day, the humidity rises to 60%. How much does he make if he works a full 7 day week?

Sasha and Julie are best friends playing on opposing basketball teams. The teams have two practice games scheduled. In the first game, Sasha had the home court advantage and scored 14 points. The game started with a comfortable 50% humidity. Julie scored 4 fewer points than Sasha in the same game. Sasha always struggles during away games and their second match was at Julie's home court. Sasha scored 6 fewer points in the second game than Julie's score in the first game. The humidity rose to 70% by the end of the second game. How many total points did Sasha score during both games?

Kimberly, who weighs 10 pounds, bought 8 packages of cat food and 6 packages of dog food. Each package of cat food contained 11 tins, and each package of dog food contained 6 tins. After carrying all the packages, her weight increased to 15 pounds. How many more tins of cat food than dog food did Kimberly buy?

Becca, Smendrick, and PJ have collections of Magic Cards. There is a total of 341 cards. Becca has 12 more than Smendrick, and Smendrick has 3 times the amount of cards that PJ has. The total weight of the cards starts at 400 pounds and increases to 600 pounds. How many cards does Becca have?

On Easter Sunday Cindy went to the city park to participate in the Easter Egg Hunt, where the humidity was 40%. She ended up with a basket full of eggs. She had 5 green ones, twice as many blue ones as green ones, one fewer pink eggs than blue eggs, and one-third as many yellow eggs as pink eggs. As she collected more eggs, the humidity in the park increased to 60%. How many eggs did Cindy have altogether?

Milly needs to return a book she decided was really boring. The book weighs 4 pounds, cost $32, and needs to be returned to a distribution center 20 miles away. If the shipping company charges $0.35 per pound plus $0. The humidity in the room where she was packing the book was initially 50% but it increased to 70% by the time she finished packing. 08 per mile, and Amazon will only refund 75% of the book's purchase price, how much money will Milly lose?

Mulan, who weighs 150 pounds, has $40. Her father gave her $100. She buys two pairs of jeans at $30 each and a bag for $20. After all the shopping, she weighs 160 pounds. How much money does Mulan have left?

Boris owns a chocolate factory with a starting humidity of 50%. He produces 50,000 bars of chocolate each month. Boris produces 8,000 bars of chocolate the first week. The second week, Boris only produces half as much as the first week. But, the third week, Boris produces three times as much as the first week. By the end of the month, the humidity in the factory has risen to 80%. How much does he produce the fourth week?

Britany records 18 4-minute TikTok videos each week in a room with 40% humidity. She spends 2 hours a week writing amateur songs to sing on TikTok, and 15 minutes six days a week doing her makeup before filming herself for TikTok. By the end of her filming, the room's humidity rises to 60%. How much time does Britany spend on TikTok in a month with four weeks?

An interior design firm offers installation for $129.00. It includes hanging 4 mirrors, 2 shelves, 1 chandelier, and 10 pictures. The total weight of the items is initially 2000 pounds. They will install additional items for an extra $15.00 per item. Angela has 6 mirrors and 2 chandeliers and 20 pictures that she needs installed/hung, increasing the total weight to 2300 pounds. How much will this cost her?

Roy, who weighs 150 lbs, has saved 40% more in money earned by chores than his brother Anthony. Anthony, who now weighs 200 lbs, has saved $10.00 more than their sister Eva. Eva has saved $20.00. How much money does Roy have?

Naruto, who weighs 2000 kg, can lift a mountain ten times higher than Kagiyami can. But Kagiyami, now weighing 3000 kg, can lift a mountain 4 times higher than Saskay can. And Saskay, having gained weight to 5000 kg, can lift a mountain 12 times higher than Pompei can. If Pompei can lift a mountain 1 inch, how high can Naruto lift a mountain, in feet?

Mason is on his bike journey at a rate of 8 miles per hour in a temperature of 70 degrees Fahrenheit. He travels for 4 hours, takes some rest, and then goes on for another 6 hours as the temperature rises to 85 degrees Fahrenheit. How many miles has he traveled in total?

Jada, Rory, and Kora make clay dishes to present as art for their school project. Initially, the clay they use weighs 20 kg. Jada makes twice as many clay dishes as Rory, while Rory makes 20 more clay dishes than Kora. After they finish, the remaining clay weighs 30 kg. If Kora made 20 dishes, how many clay dishes they all make together?

Erika, who weighs 150 lbs, is saving for a new laptop. The laptop she wants costs $600. The sales assistant told her that if she traded in her old laptop, the price of the new one would be reduced by $200. She thinks this is a good deal and agrees to do it. She already has some savings in her purse, and has also been paid $150 this week for her part-time job. Her mom agrees to give her $80 to help her. After a month of hard work, she weighs 160 lbs. If Erika now only needs an extra $50 to buy the laptop, how much money does she have in her purse?

Adam, who weighs 200 lbs, wants to eat some sliced apples. A large apple can be sliced into 5 pieces, and a small apple can be sliced into 3 pieces. Adam decides to slice 3 large and 5 small apples and then eats 15 slices. After eating, Adam weighs 190 lbs. How many apple slices are left?

A farmer extracts 5 liters of milk a day from a cow that initially weighs 500 kg. After the extraction, the cow weighs 480 kg. Since he has 3 cows, how many more cows does he need to have to produce 25 liters of milk a day?

Patrick has three glue sticks that are partially used. One has 1/6 left, the second has 2/3 left and the third one has 1/2 left. Initially, the combined weight of the glue sticks was 10 pounds, but after usage, it is now 20 pounds. If a glue stick is 12 millimeters long originally, what is the total length of the glue sticks that are not used?

Gabriel, who weighs 150 lbs, wants to buy a car for $10000 and a phone for $800. After working on weekends and gaining some weight, now weighing 160 lbs, Gabriel has $5000 and his brother gave him $200 to help him. How much money does he still need?

While on vacation in Bali, where the humidity was initially at 60%, Thea bought a hat from a craftsman worth $70. As she continued shopping, the humidity increased to 80%. If she gave the craftsman four $20 bills, how much change did she get?

Craig, who weighs 180 pounds, has 2 twenty dollar bills. He buys six squirt guns for $2 each. After running around the store, he also buys 3 packs of water balloons for $3 each and weighs 170 pounds. How much money does he have left?

Peter, who weighs 200 pounds, has twice as many socks as Jack and half times as many dishes as Jack. After a month, Peter's weight increased to 220 pounds. Jack collected twice as many dishes as socks in the store. If jack collected 60 dishes, calculate the total number of socks and dishes they have together?

In Miss Susan's class, which occupies a space of 500 cubic feet, there are 20 students. 5 of them are good at math only, 8 of them perform well in English only, and the rest are good at both math and English. As the class grows in size and the volume of the room increases to 700 cubic feet. How many are good at math?

Vicki is planning a pop concert at her high school where the temperature is 68 degrees Fahrenheit. The show will be 2 hours. She is allowing each group 2 minutes to get on stage, 6 minutes to perform, and then 2 minutes to exit the stage. By the end of the concert, the temperature in the school has risen to 75 degrees Fahrenheit. If she allows a 10-minute intermission, how many groups can perform in the concert?

Brenda invested $300 into a scheme that accumulates simple interest at the rate of three-quarters of the original amount per year. The room, initially at 40% humidity, rose to 60% humidity as she sweated nervously. How much in total will she have after 3 years?

A clothing store, which is kept at a cool 68 degrees Fahrenheit, has 40 white shirts and 50 floral shirts. Half of the white shirts have collars, and 20 of the floral shirts have buttons. As more customers come in, the temperature rises to a comfortable 75 degrees Fahrenheit. How many more floral shirts with no buttons are there than white shirts with no collars?

A farmer has 900 eggs, initially weighing 0 pounds. He placed them on a tray, which holds 30 eggs each. After placing all the eggs, the total weight of the eggs is now 450 pounds. How much will the farmer earn if he sells it for $2. 5 per tray?

Mr. Smith has two farms, Farm X and Farm Y. He has 55 goats in Farm X and 45 goats in Farm Y, with a humidity of 50%. He sold 10 goats from Farm X and twice as many goats from Farm Y. The humidity in the farms increased to 70% after the sale. How many goats are left in the two farms altogether?

James, who weighs 150 pounds, buys 2 pairs of shoes a month. After a year of shoe shopping, his weight goes up to 200 pounds. He spends $2640 on shoes each year. How much does he pay on average for each pair of shoes?

A basket of green food, weighing 50 pounds, costs $25 and a basket of red food, now weighing 60 pounds, costs $18. If you buy 3 baskets of green food and red food, how much will you have to pay in total if you get $2 off for each basket of red food?

There are 90 rooms at the KozyInn Motel, with a starting humidity level of 30%. It takes housekeeping 20 minutes to clean each room. By the end of the cleaning, the humidity level rises to 45% due to the use of cleaning products. How many hours would it take to clean one-half of the rooms?

A local town is expanding and wants to build several new homes across the next three years, starting with an area of 5000 square feet. In the first year, they will build 12 homes. In the next year, they will build three times this many homes. By the third year, they will have expanded the area to 15000 square feet, count how many homes they have built and double the amount. How many homes will the town have built over the next three years?

I am three years younger than my brother, and I am 2 years older than my sister. My mom's age is one less than three times my brother's age. When you add all our ages, you get 87. My weight has increased from 150 pounds to 200 pounds. How old am I?

Mr. Jackson’s fourth-grade class has 27 students. He wants to give each student 2 glue sticks, each weighing 70 pounds. The glue sticks come in packs of 8. As he adds more glue sticks, their weight increases to 90 pounds. How many packs will Mr. Jackson need to buy so every student can have 2 glue sticks, assuming he can only buy whole packs and he expects to have some extra glue sticks left over?

A plague infects ten people. The humidity in the area is initially at 30%. Every day, each infected person infects six others. As the plague spreads, the humidity increases to 60%. How many people are infected after three days?

While working at the restaurant, where the temperature was initially 68 degrees Fahrenheit, each of the forty customers who came into the restaurant gave Rafaela a $20 tip. As more customers came in, the temperature rose to 75 degrees Fahrenheit. Julieta received 10% less money in tips than Rafaela. How much money did Julieta and Rafaela receive as tips altogether?

Jennifer bought 12 oranges from the market, which initially weighed 10 pounds. After she gave her three daughters 2 oranges each, and her only boy got 3 oranges, the remaining oranges weighed 20 pounds. How many oranges did she remain with?

In a room with 30% humidity, Claire earns 1 girl scout badge every month. The humidity in the room increases to 45% as it takes Amber twice as long to earn a badge than Claire. Wendy, in the same humid conditions, earns three times the amount of badges as Claire in the same time frame. How many more badges does Wendy earn compared to Amber in a 1 year time frame?

Every hour, Paige can bake 2 banana bread loaves in the oven, which is initially set at 70 degrees Fahrenheit. Each banana bread loaf is cut into 8 slices and wrapped individually for sale. As she bakes, the oven temperature rises to 85 degrees Fahrenheit. Each slice is sold for 50 cents for a fundraiser. If she baked from 1:00 PM - 6:00 PM straight, and sold all the slices, how much did she raise in dollars?

Gretchen has some coins, each weighing 2 pounds. There are 30 more gold coins than silver coins. As she adds more coins, the weight of each coin increases to 3 pounds. If she had 70 gold coins, how many coins did Gretchen have in total?

George, a grade six teacher, ordered 600 burritos for the sixth-grade class picnic. The total weight of the burritos was initially 1000 pounds. If there were 50 students at the picnic, and each student was given ten burritos, with Mr. George adding more burritos, the total weight increased to 1600 pounds. George eating 20 of them, calculate the total number of leftover burritos from the picnic?

A bumper car rink has 12 red cars, under a light of 1000 lumens. They have 2 fewer green cars than they have red cars. They have 3 times the number of blue cars as they have green cars. As the rink also gets yellow cars, the light dims to 500 lumens. If the rink has 75 cars in total how many yellow cars do they have?

Together, Sofie, Anne, and Fawn have 85 books. Initially, the combined weight of the books was 200 pounds, but after adding some more books, the total weight increased to 300 pounds. If Sofie has 25 more books than Anne, and Anne has 12 fewer books than Fawn does, how many books does Fawn have?

Daisy bought a bag of potatoes that weighed 5 pounds in a store where the temperature was 60 degrees Fahrenheit. She also bought a bag of sweet potatoes that weighed 2 times as much as the potatoes and a bag of carrots that weighed 3 pounds fewer than the sweet potatoes. By the time she finished shopping, the temperature in the store had risen to 70 degrees Fahrenheit. How many pounds of carrots did Daisy buy?

A three-ounce box of flavored jello makes 10 small jello cups. Greg wants to make small jello cups for his son's outdoor birthday party. He decided to use 9 ounces of jello to make enough cups. There will be 30 kids and he wants to have enough so that each kid can have 4 jello cups. Jello is currently on sale for $1.25. How much will he spend on jello?

An electronics seller bought 5 phones for $700 each, each weighing 500 grams, and gives the seller $4000 in dollar bills. The weight of the dollar bills is 800 grams. How much will the seller give back in change?

Madeline and her roommate, Keenan, share the cost of groceries. In total, they spend about $400 per month. The weight of the groceries starts at 150 pounds and by the end of the month, it goes up to 200 pounds. In a four-week month, how many dollars does Keenan spend per week if Madeline pays 60% of the cost?

Tobias, who weighs 200 lbs, bought a big pizza with 60 pieces. He ate 2/5 of the pieces on the first day, 10 pieces on the second day, and 7/13 of the remaining pieces on the third day. After all that pizza, he now weighs 150 lbs. How many pizza pieces has he eaten so far?

Seven bottles of soda, weighing initially 150 lbs, cost $21.00 while 4 bottles of water cost $8. After adding more soda, the weight increases to 200 lbs. If David wants to buy 3 bottles of soda and 2 bottles of water, how much will that cost?

David, who weighs 50 pounds, has $12.48 and wants to buy 16 bolts from a bin at the hardware store. Each bolt costs $0.03. After carrying the bolts, his weight increases to 70 pounds. How much money does David have left after paying for the bolts?

Ella, in a room with a temperature of 60 degrees Fahrenheit, earned $33 for 3 hours of dog walking. As she continued walking dogs, the room temperature increased to 75 degrees Fahrenheit. If she continues to walk dogs at the same rate, how much would she earn after 12 hours?
Paul has 52 marbles, weighing a total of 100 pounds. His friend gave him 28 marbles, increasing the weight to 150 pounds. Then, he lost 1/4 of his marbles. How many marbles does Paul have left?

Amy is taking a history test in a room with 30% humidity. She correctly answers 80% of the multiple-choice questions, 90% of the true/false questions, and 60% of the long-answer questions. The multiple-choice and true/false questions are worth 1 point each, and the long answer questions are worth 5 points each. By the end of the test, the humidity in the room has increased to 50%. How many points does Amy score if there are 10 multiple-choice questions, 20 true/false questions, and 5 long answer questions?

To make a profit of $2000, Isaias has to sell the chickens he planned to take to the market from his farm at $50 per chicken. Initially, each chicken weighed 2 pounds, but after feeding them, their weight increased to 3 pounds each. If Isaias has 300 chickens on his farm and plans to sell 3/5 of them, for how much money did Isaias buy the chicken he took to the market for sale?

Julie, Micah, and Mitchell sold 32 glasses of lemonade at their lemonade stand, where the humidity was 60%. Julie sold 14 glasses and the boys sold an equal number of glasses. By the end of the day, the humidity had risen to 80%. How many more glasses did Julie sell than Micah?

At a spa, where the humidity is initially 30%, Iris spent $400 to do her hair, 1/4 as much to do a manicure, and 3/4 as much money as a manicure to do a pedicure. By the time she finished, the humidity had risen to 50%. How much money did she spend at the spa?

Sarah has a rope that is 20 meters long and weighs 50 kg. Her friend wants to buy the rope for $2 a meter. After selling the rope, she is left with a weight of 30 kg. Sarah plans to use the profit to buy a new rope, which at the store costs $1.5 a meter. How much money will she have left over after she buys the new rope?
In 10 years, Melanie will be 18 years old. She currently weighs 100 pounds, but by then she will weigh 150 pounds. In how many years will her age be thrice her present age?

Kelly is grocery shopping at a supermarket, where the temperature is 70 degrees Fahrenheit, and is making sure she has enough in her budget for the items in her cart. Her 5 packs of bacon cost $10 in total and she has 6 packets of chicken which each cost twice as much as a pack of bacon. She also has 3 packs of strawberries, priced at $4 each, and 7 packs of apples, each priced at half the price of a pack of strawberries. As she continues shopping, the temperature in the supermarket rises to 75 degrees Fahrenheit. If Kelly’s budget is $65 then how much money, in dollars, does she have left in her budget?

Elaina is holding the final concert in her tour. The stage is lit with a brightness of 1000 lumens. To celebrate her final concert, she makes the concert twice as long as her usual concerts. At the end of the concert, she also performs a 15-minute encore, during which the stage brightness is increased to 5000 lumens. If the runtime of this final concert is 65 minutes then how long, in minutes, do her usual concerts run for?
Argo, who weighs 1000 kg, has 200 toys. He gives 40 toys to Alyssa, 80 to Bonnie, and 30 to Nicky. After giving away the toys, Argo weighs 600 kg. How many toys does Argo have now?

The Ben and Aggie Burrito Shop, with a starting humidity of 45%, makes 125 chimichangas on Tuesdays, 125 chimichangas on Wednesdays and twice as many on Friday. The humidity rises to 60% by the end of Friday. How many chimichangas do they make on those three days?

A singer has 50 microphones that he wants to arrange in pairs on a stage of 500 square feet. While making the arrangement, he realizes that 20% of the microphones won't find any space to fit in after arranging the rest in pairs, reducing the available area to 400 square feet. How many pairs of microphones was he able to arrange on the stage?

Jerry counts six birds nesting in the bushes, when the humidity was 50%. Then he saw 2/3rd of that number of birds flying overhead, and 3 groups of eight birds each feeding, as the humidity rose to 70%. How many birds does he count in total?
Lani, who weighs 200 pounds, baked 55 cookies. After she ate 5 cookies, her weight dropped to 190 pounds and she placed the rest equally into five jars. How many cookies were in each jar?

Joelle has 5 orchids and 4 African daisies on her balcony where the humidity is initially 50%. After watering the plants, the humidity increases to 70%. If the orchids have 5 petals and daisies have 10 petals, how many more petals do the daisies have compared to the orchids?

There are 100 plants in Mrs. Smith's garden, where the humidity is initially at 50%. One-fourth of her plants are indoor plants. Two-thirds of the remaining are outdoor plants while the rest are flowering plants. As more plants are added, the humidity rises to 70%. What percent of the plants are flowering plants?

A whirligig spins at five times the speed of a thingamabob in a room with a temperature of 20 degrees Celsius. As the whatchamacallit spins eleven times faster than a thingamabob, the room temperature rises to 30 degrees Celsius. A whatchamacallit spins at 121 meters per second. How fast does a whirligig spin?

Ellen, who weighs 150 pounds, is on a diet. She eats two carrots, a salad, and a yogurt every day. The salad costs her $6, while the yogurt is half the price. After a week, she weighs 145 pounds. How much does Ellen pay for one carrot every day when in total she pays $11 for her goods?

Mark, who weighs 180 pounds, works at his job for 8 hours a day for 5 days a week. He used to make $10 an hour but they raised his pay by $2 per hour. After a month, he weighs 190 pounds. How much does he make a week?

Last month, when the temperature was a mild 75 degrees Fahrenheit, Tasha made $80 from selling lemonade and mowing lawns. The first week, she mowed Kamala's lawn thrice as many times as she did Joe's. The following week, as the temperature rose to 85 degrees Fahrenheit, she mowed Alba's lawn five times as she did Joe's. If Joe paid Tasha $6 for her work, how much did she make from lemonade sales?

On a day when the temperature is 68 degrees Fahrenheit, Martin's weight is 55 kg. As the temperature rises to 75 degrees Fahrenheit, Carl’s weight is 16 kg more than Martin’s weight. Christian’s weight is 8 kg more than Carl’s weight. Harry is 5 kg less than Christian’s weight. What is the weight of Harry, in kg?

John rents his car out 10 times a month for 3 hours each time. The temperature inside the car starts at 68 degrees Fahrenheit. He gets paid $25 an hour. After the rental, the temperature inside the car rises to 75 degrees Fahrenheit. If his car payment is $500, how much profit does he make on his car?

Joseph, who weighs 100 pounds, had 3 times as many notebooks as Martha. Martha decided she needed more notebooks and then bought 5 more for a total of 7 notebooks. After carrying all the notebooks, Joseph's weight increased to 120 pounds. How many more than Joseph does she now have?

Susan, who weighs 0 pounds, made 100 cookies for Christmas and was going to equally divide them between her 6 nephews. Before Susan could package them, her husband snuck 4 cookies for himself. After eating the cookies, Susan weighs 10 pounds. How many cookies will each of Susan’s nephews get?

Denise and Daniel are reading the same book in a room with 60% humidity. Yesterday, Denise read 10 pages while Daniel read 13 pages. Today, Denise read 5 more than as many pages as what Daniel read yesterday, while Daniel was not able to read any pages today. The humidity in the room increased to 80% by the end of the day. How many more pages did Denise read more than Daniel?

Calvin is making soup for his family for dinner. He has a pot with enough soup to fill four adult's bowls or eight child's bowls. The pot initially weighs 5 pounds. He is an adult and will be eating with his adult wife and their two children. After serving, the pot now weighs 8 pounds. If everyone eats one bowl at a meal, how many times will each child be able to have a bowl of soup for lunch from the leftover soup?

The educational shop is selling notebooks for $1.50 each and a ballpen at $0.5 each. William, who weighs 150 pounds, bought five notebooks and a ballpen. After carrying his purchases, his weight increased to 155 pounds. How much did he spend in all?

Jo has been making face masks. She can make 4 small masks with 2 yards of material and 3 large masks with 2.25 yards of material. The weight of the material she starts with is 10 pounds, but after making the masks, it reduces to 15 pounds. How much material would she need to make 20 small and 8 large masks for her class?

In a theatre with a volume of 1000 cubic feet, Deepa has seen each of the 9 Fast and the Furious movies three times. As more people join, the volume of the theatre increases to 1500 cubic feet. She has spent $216 seeing these movies. What is the average price she paid per ticket?

Harold sleeps for 10 hours a night with a room humidity of 50%. He works 2 hours less than he sleeps and he walks his dog for an hour each day. By the end of the day, the room humidity rises to 70%. How much free time does Harold have left in his day?

Tim has a box with 7 blue shoe boxes and 9 red shoe boxes, weighing initially 50 pounds. After adding some items, the box now weighs 60 pounds. If he uses 3 blue shoeboxes and 1/3 red of his shoeboxes to go fishing, how many red and blue shoe boxes are left in Tim's box?
Sarah, who weighs 10 kg, has 9 books. Joseph, who weighs 20 kg, had twice the number of Sarah’s books, but he lost 2 of them. How many books does Joseph currently have?
Dean, who weighs 50 kg, has 30 marbles. He gives 1/5 of them to Jamie and his weight drops to 45 kg. Then he gives 10 to Donald, reducing his weight to 40 kg. How many marbles are left for Dean?

Eight years ago, when the temperature was 68 degrees Fahrenheit, Duncan's age was two times Adam's age. Four years later, as the temperature rose to 75 degrees Fahrenheit, Adam aged as well. If Duncan's age is 60 now, how old will Adam be in 8 years?

On a day when the temperature was a cool 60 degrees Fahrenheit, Farmer Brown's farm is 200 acres, and Farmer Smith's farm is 100 acres more than twice that. As the day warmed up to 75 degrees Fahrenheit, the work on the farms continued. How many acres do the two farms have, together?

Colby, who weighs 150 pounds, works for a manufacturing company in the packaging division. He gets paid $0.20 for every package he completes. After a year, his weight increased to 200 pounds due to less physical activity. If he completes 10 less than 50 packages per hour, how much money, in dollars, does he earn in a typical eight-hour workday?

John drinks a bottle of water every half hour in a room with 40% humidity. A normal sudoku puzzle takes him 45 minutes. An extreme sudoku takes 4 times that long, by which time the humidity in the room has risen to 60%. How many bottles of water does he drink in that time?

Benny, in a room with 40% humidity, threw bologna at his balloons. He threw two pieces of bologna at each red balloon and three pieces of bologna at each yellow balloon. The humidity in the room increased to 60% due to the activity. If Benny threw 58 pieces of bologna at a bundle of red and yellow balloons, and twenty of the balloons were red, then how many of the balloons in the bundle were yellow?

Jon's car, which is initially at a temperature of 60 degrees Fahrenheit, needs a tune-up every 1000 miles. As he drives 100 miles a day for a 30 day month, the temperature of the car rises to 75 degrees Fahrenheit. How many tune-ups does he need in that time?

Bruce works for 5 hours on Tuesday in an environment with 50% humidity. On Wednesday he works twice the time he works on Tuesday and the humidity increases to 60%. On Thursday he works 2 hours less than the time he works on Wednesday and the humidity rises to 70%. How many hours does Bruce work in all these three days?

Julia and Nadine were given the same amount of allowance by their mother. The two girls decided to combine their allowance to surprise their father on his birthday. They bought a cake which weighs 3 lbs and costs $11. They also bought 1 dozen balloons which were sold for $0.5 for 2 balloons. The remaining money was used to buy 2 tubs of ice cream, each weighing 1 lb and costing $7 each. How much did Julia and Nadine's mother give each one of them?

Kira, who weighs 150 lbs, bought 3 apples, 5 bananas and 6 oranges at the grocery store. After Lola ate 2 pieces of the fruit, Kira weighed herself again and found she was now 145 lbs. How many pieces are left?

There are 6 students playing tennis and twice that number playing volleyball, with the humidity at 30%. There are 16 boys and 22 girls playing soccer, by which time the humidity has risen to 60%. If each student only participates in one group, how many students are there in total?

To raise money for their class fund, each of the 30 students from one class sold lollipops that cost $0.8 per lollypop. On average, each student sold 10 lollipops. If they bought the lollipops for $0, initially the weight of the lollipops was 0.5 pounds but after adding some more, it increased to 1 pound. 5 each, how much money was the class able to raise from the profit of selling lollipops?

Larry loves taking care of animals in his house which is at a comfortable 68 degrees Fahrenheit. He has 3 cats. He has 3 times as many dogs as cats. He has 2 fewer rabbits than dogs. He has a fish tank with three times the number of fish as rabbits. He also has a collection of gerbils that's 1/3 the number of fish he has. After taking care of all these animals, the temperature in his house rises to 78 degrees Fahrenheit. How many pets does Larry have?

A loaf of bread has 24 slices and initially weighs 2 pounds. After adding some more ingredients, it now weighs 3 pounds. If Abby can eat 2 slices a day while Josh can eat twice as much, how many days will the loaf of bread last?

Martha has been collecting shells since she turned 5 years old, every month she collects one shell. The weight of her collection started at 50 pounds and has grown to 70 pounds. By her 10th birthday, how many shells will Martha have collected?

Lana is brewing cups of tea for her friends in a room that is 70 degrees Fahrenheit. She has 27 cups, and she divides these into 3 rows. In each row, she creates equal amounts of chamomile and mint tea cups. As she brews, the room warms up to 75 degrees Fahrenheit. She then uses the remaining cups to brew a total of 15 cups of cinnamon tea. How many cups of mint tea are in each row?

A three-toed sloth moves very slowly in the 60% humidity, and only eats when he is up in his tree. For a meal of berries, it takes the sloth 4 hours to make the trip down the tree, pick up berries, and climb back up into his tree. By the time he finishes, the humidity has risen to 70%. Assuming he picks the same number of berries on each trip, what is the least number of berries he can pick up per trip down to the ground if he wants to collect 24 berries in 8 hours?

There are 10000 gallons of water in a pool, which weighs around 2000 pounds. Using a water pump, Anthony and his father fill a tank with half the amount of water in the pool, reducing the water weight to about 1000 pounds. They use water from the tank to water their vegetable garden. If the tank is emptied at a rate of 500 gallons of water per day, how many gallons of water will be remaining in the tank after 6 days?

Colby loves going to the movies and every month his parents give him $150 to spend at the movies. The temperature in the theater starts at a comfortable 70 degrees Fahrenheit. Tickets for Fridays and Saturdays cost $10. Tickets for any other day cost $7. Popcorn costs $8 and boxes of candy cost $2. It is the last day of the month and it's a Friday. He wants to make sure he gets a popcorn and box of candy that night. As the night progresses, the temperature in the theater rises to 75 degrees Fahrenheit. How many movies can he see if he already saw 5 movies on a Friday or Saturday, 8 movies on other days, had 2 tubs of popcorn, and four boxes of candy that month?

Andrew, whose weight is initially 0 pounds, bakes 200 mini cinnamon rolls and 300 mini blueberry muffins. A normal cinnamon roll has 600 calories and a normal blueberry muffin has 450 calories. After consuming some of his baked goods, his weight increases to 500 pounds. If a mini pastry has 1/3rd of the calories of a normal version, how many calories do the pastries he baked have?

Rita hand-picks Junebugs off of her plants every summer. On Monday, she removed 39 Junebugs when the humidity was at 50%. On both Tuesday and Wednesday, she removed twice as many Junebugs as she did on Monday. Thursday she removed 48 and on Friday, when the humidity rose to 60%, she removed 57. What is the average number of Junebugs that she removes per day?

A bus, in 70 degrees Fahrenheit, travels 60 miles per hour for 5 hours. The temperature rises to 80 degrees Fahrenheit when a car travels 30 miles per hour for 8 hours. How much farther did the bus go than the car, in miles?

When Sophie watches her nephew, she gets out a variety of toys for him. The bag of building blocks has 31 blocks in it and weighs around 50 pounds. The bin of stuffed animals has 8 stuffed animals inside. The tower of stacking rings has 9 multicolored rings on it. Sophie recently bought a tube of bouncy balls, bringing her total number of toys for her nephew up to 62 and the total weight to 70 pounds. How many bouncy balls came in the tube?

Maria invited 4 of her friends over for a water balloon fight in the backyard where the humidity was initially 30%. At the start of the game, Maria gave each of her friends 2 water balloons. She had one water balloon for herself. Then her mom came out and gave each person 3 more balloons, causing the humidity to rise to 45% due to the added moisture. How many total balloons did the girls have?

A charity group decides to do a yard sale. 10 people donate 5 boxes of stuff each, initially weighing 200 pounds. They also have 10 boxes of stuff already. They can fit 2 boxes worth of stuff per table. After all donations, the total weight of the stuff increases to 500 pounds. If they already own 15 tables, how many new tables do they need?

Zoey and Sydney are having a watermelon seed spitting contest. The humidity is at 50%. Whoever spits their seeds the most total distance wins. They each get one watermelon. Zoey's has 40 seeds and she spits each one 10 feet. Sydney's has 35 she spits each one 12 feet. By the end of the contest, the humidity has risen to 70%. What is the average total distance spat?

Fern is trying to decide between buying the Widgeteer 3000, which makes 60 widgets an hour, in a room with 40% humidity. She then considers the WidgetMaster 9000, which makes 45 widgets an hour, but the humidity in the room rises to 60%. Each widget sells for $6. How much more money will Fern make from the Widgeteer 3000 vs. the WidgetMaster 9000 if it runs 24 hours a day for a month with 30 days?

A hotel in the Philippines, where the temperature is 70 degrees Fahrenheit, charges 1000 pesos for a 12-hour stay or 1600 pesos for a 24-hour stay. After 12 hours, visitors have the option to add 70 pesos for every additional hour. Cameron arrives at 5 pm at the hotel and wants to leave at 10 am the next morning. As the night progresses, the temperature in the hotel rises to 75 degrees Fahrenheit. He decides to go with the option of adding on 70 pesos for every hour after the 12-hour mark instead of paying for 24 hours. How much money would Cameron save?

Nate is feeding his livestock hay in a barn with 40 percent humidity. Each goat needs 5 pounds, and each sheep needs 3 pounds less than twice the amount each goat needs. As he continues feeding, the humidity in the barn rises to 60 percent. If there are 15 goats and 12 sheep, how many pounds of hay does Nate need?

John, who weighs 150 pounds, earned 50 dollars an hour and worked 6 hours in the week. After a week, his weight increased to 160 pounds. If he spends 50 dollars on gas and wants to deposit 100 dollars in the bank, how many 25 dollar pens can he buy after he buys 5 pencils that cost 10 dollars each?

For the children's day celebration, children are to perform mass drills in the presence of the President of the country. They stand 8 in a row and there are 7 rows each for 5 different Schools. The humidity in the air was initially 40%, but as the event progressed, it increased to 60%. How many children can there be in the drill?

In a classroom with a volume of 500 cubic feet, there are 29 pupils. The teacher has 9 coupons; each coupon can be redeemed for 100 bottles of apple juice. The teacher gives each student 2 bottles of apple juice to drink for lunch. As more students join, the volume of the classroom increases to 700 cubic feet. After redeeming all her coupons and giving each student their apple juice lunch, how many bottles of apple juice does the teacher have for herself?

On a day when the temperature was 70 degrees Fahrenheit, Patty's Plumbing charges $40 to visit a house to make a repair, plus $35 per hour, or part thereof, for labor, plus parts. One job took 2.25 hours and used $60 in parts. By the end of the job, the temperature had risen to 75 degrees Fahrenheit. How much did Patty charge?

James, who weighs 200 pounds, gets 10 new CDs. Each CD cost $15. He gets them for 40% off. After carrying the CDs, his weight decreases to 190 pounds. He decides he doesn't like 5 of them and sells them for 40. How much money was he out?

Jen is planning to sell her root crops. She has 6 yams which can be sold at $1.5 each, 10 sweet potatoes that cost $2 each, and 4 carrots which cost $1.25 each. Initially, the total weight of the crops was 50 pounds, but after harvesting more, it increased to 70 pounds. If she sells everything, how much will she earn?

James loves to go swimming in a 20-mile lake, where the temperature is 75 degrees Fahrenheit. He can swim at a pace of 2 miles per hour. He swims 60% of the distance. After that, he stops on an island and rests for half as long as the swimming time. The temperature rises to 85 degrees Fahrenheit as he then finishes the remaining distance while going half the speed. How long did it take him to get across the lake?

A bakery, which has a total bread weight of 200 pounds, has 40 less than seven times as many loaves of bread as Sam had last Friday. After baking more, the total weight of the bread in the bakery is now 250 pounds. If Sam had seventy loaves of bread last Friday, how many loaves of bread does the bakery have?

Jasmine's teacher gives stickers for reward. She was given 15 stickers for participating in class, but she lost 7 stickers during playtime. However, her teacher gave her another 5 stickers for helping her classmates. The weight of her sticker collection started at 50 pounds and increased to 60 pounds with the new additions. How many stickers does she have at the end?

Cayley markets various newspapers to get a commission on each copy sold. The room starts at 30% humidity. He gets a 10% commission on each copy of the New York Times and an 8% commission on each of the Wall Street Journal. As he works, the humidity in the room rises to 45%. How much commission will he earn in total from the sales of 6 copies of the New York Times and 10 copies of Wall Street Journal if each costs $5 and $15 respectively?

Marcus is half of Leo’s age and five years younger than Deanna. Deanna is 26. The humidity in the room was 40% when Marcus was half of Leo’s age and it increased to 60% when Deanna turned 26. How old is Leo?

Bahati, Azibo, and Dinar each contributed to their team's 45 points in a gym with a humidity of 50%. Bahati scored the most points and it was 20 more than Azibo scored and 10 more points than Dinar scored. As the game progressed, the humidity in the gym increased to 70%. How many points did Azibo score?

The book, initially weighing 1 pound, is printed on paper that, when stacked, is 100 pages to the inch. Each paper is printed on both sides, with one page of the book printed on each side. As more pages are added, the book's weight increases to 2 pounds. How many pages are in the book, if it is 1. 5 inches thick?

Vince, who weighs 150 pounds, can staple 30 reports every 15 minutes. After a meal, his weight goes up to 200 pounds, but he continues to staple reports. If he was stapling reports from 8:00 AM until 11:00 PM, how many reports did he staple altogether?

Kim sleepwalks, to monitor her sleeping hours, she installs a camera in her room. The room temperature is usually around 70 degrees Fahrenheit. Kim usually goes to sleep at 10 p. m. and wakes up at 6 a. m. She is a sleepwalker. One day, after reviewing the cameras, she finds that she woke up that day and was sleepwalking from 2:15 to 2:38 am. Also, that day she woke up 5 minutes earlier than usual to go to the bathroom. The room temperature had risen to 75 degrees Fahrenheit by then. How many minutes did she sleep on her bed that day?

Robyn, in a room with 30% humidity, sends sixteen emails a day. Seven are work emails, and two-thirds of the remainder are to family. One-third of the other emails are to her boyfriend. By the time she finishes, the humidity in the room has increased to 45%. How many emails a day does she send to her boyfriend?

Shawna's father, living in a room with 40% humidity, is five times as old as Shawna. Shawna, who is currently three times as old as Aliya, saw the humidity rise to 60%. If Aliya is 3 years old, how old is Shawna's father?

Courtney attended a concert, where the humidity was 40%, and reported that the audience was 48 in number. However, Kelly went to the same concert and said that Courtney had made the mistake of overstating the number of people in attendance by 20%. By the time Kelly arrived, the humidity had risen to 60%. If Kelly was right, how many people really attended the concert?

Coach brought one bag filled with basketballs, weighing 50 pounds, to practice and dumped them all out onto the gym floor before practice began. After the practice time was over, he asked Jordan, Jason, and Jeffrey to pick up the balls and carry them over to the bag. The three boys picked up and carried all of the balls in one trip, with the bag now weighing 70 pounds. Jordan carried twice as many balls as Jason, and Jason carried twice as many balls as Jeffrey. If Jason had picked up and carried 2 balls, what is the total number of balls that the coach brought to practice?

A pirate crew is digging for buried treasure on the island marked X on a map, where the humidity was initially 60%. They dug ten holes the first day, thirteen holes the second day, and eight holes the third day. They stopped digging early on the third day to fill in two holes the pirates kept falling in. On the fourth day of digging, they unearthed a treasure chest full of gold, jewels, and an aged hat. The island had four times as many holes by then as it did at the end of the first day. By this time, the humidity had risen to 80%. How many holes did the pirates dig on the fourth day before finding the treasure?

Amora, Lainey, and Collins, who initially weighed 100 pounds together, wanted to share corn chips equally but then realized only two people would get an equal amount of corn chips, while the other person would receive 15 more corn chips than the number the others got. After eating, they weighed 120 pounds together. If Amora and Lainey got 70 corn chips each, how many corn chips were there altogether?

Jen, weighing 150 lbs, decides to travel to 3 different countries. He has to pay $400 for the supplies he needs, in total. The tickets for travel cost, in total, 50% more than the supplies. By the end of his journey, Jen weighs 170 lbs. How much does travel cost?

Alex, Stan, and Adelwolfe are trying to catch them all, Pokemon that is, in a park with a humidity of 40%. Together they have caught 339 Pokemon. Alex has caught 5 more than Stan, and Stan has caught 13 less than 4 times as many as Adelwolfe has caught. As they continue their hunt, the humidity in the park rises to 60%. How many Pokemon has Stan caught?

John just started watching a new show at a volume of 50 decibels. Each episode is 20 minutes long, and there are half as many episodes in total as there are minutes per episode. By the end of the show, the volume is at 70 decibels. How many minutes will John spend watching the show if he watches every episode?

A bird decides to leave her summer home in the north and travel to her winter home in the south. The temperature at the start of her journey is 15 degrees Celsius. To make the journey, the bird leaves her home flying in a southerly direction for 10 hours at a speed of 30 miles per hour. Then, the bird turns direction and flies towards the north for 2 hours are a speed of 18 miles per hour. Finally, the bird changes direction and flies toward the south for 5 hours at a speed of 22 miles per hour before landing at her southern home, where the temperature has risen to 25 degrees Celsius. What is the distance, in miles, between the bird's northern and the southern homes?

Greta wanted brownies for her birthday. She made a batch for herself; one dozen cream cheese swirl brownies at a comfortable 70 degrees Fahrenheit. At her office, they threw her a party and sent her home with 1/2 a dozen brownies. When she arrived home, her friends were there to throw her a surprise party and had 4 dozen brownies waiting. During the party, the temperature in the house rose to 85 degrees Fahrenheit as 1 1/2 dozen brownies were eaten. How many individual brownies did Greta have left over from the entire day?

Nani, who weighs 30 kg, is 8 years old. His brother, who weighs 40 kg, is twice his age. Nani's sister, who weighs less than him, is 25% younger than him. What is the total age of all three of the family members?

Andy works in the pro shop of a tennis resort, where the humidity is initially 40%. He has 12 racquets that need restringing. 3 of them are to be strung with synthetic gut, 5 of them will be strung with polyester string, and 4 of them will be strung with a hybrid set (half synthetic gut, half polyester string). After all the work, the humidity in the shop rises to 60%. How long will it take Andy to string all of those racquets if it takes him an average of 15 minutes for him to string with synthetic gut, 22 minutes to string with polyester string, and 18 minutes for hybrid sets?

John, whose phone weighs 1 pound, decides to buy new phones for him, his 2 kids, and his wife. Each phone after the first 2, which weigh 1.5 pounds, is half price. If the phone price is $600 how much did he pay for them all?

Zeke's baseball team, which was practicing in 30% humidity, has 7 more players than Carlton's. As more players joined, the humidity rose to 50%. If Carlton's team has 13 players, how many players are there in both teams combined?

Robert is building a 15 foot long, 10 foot wide, rectangular wooden fence around his garden. He needs 2 wood slats for every foot of fencing he builds. The weight of the wood slats starts at 2000 pounds and increases to 2500 pounds as he builds. How many wooden slats will he need?

Mrs. Harrington, who weighed 100 pounds, bought 12 boxes of oranges at the market. She gave her mom and her sister 2 boxes of oranges each. Then she kept 1/4 of the oranges and sold the rest. After carrying all these boxes, her weight dropped to 80 pounds. How many oranges did Mrs. Harrington sell if each box contains 20 oranges?
India, where the humidity is 60%, has 4 more than half the number of states in the USA. The humidity then increases to 80%. What's the total number of states in both countries together?

Tyler, who weighs 150 pounds, wants to buy a dictionary that costs $18, a dinosaur book that costs $13, and a children's cookbook that costs $8. After eating a hearty meal, his weight goes up to 160 pounds. He has saved $14 from his allowance. If Tyler earns $5 per hour, how many hours does he have to work to afford his books?

Richard, Jerry, and Robert are going to share 60 cherries. Initially, they weighed 200 pounds together. After eating, they weigh 260 pounds. If Robert has 30 cherries, and has 10 more than Richard, how many more cherries does Robert have than Jerry?

Sunny is selling gingerbread and apple pie for a fundraiser. On Saturday, with a humidity of 30%, he sold 10 boxes of gingerbread and 4 fewer boxes of apple pie, than on Sunday. On Sunday, when the humidity rose to 45%, he sold 5 more boxes of gingerbread than on Saturday and 15 boxes of apple pie. If the gingerbread cost $6 and the apple pie cost $15, how much did Sunny earn for two days?

Pamela, who weighs 150 pounds, reapplies an ounce of sunscreen every hour she's outside. After a hearty lunch, her weight goes up to 160 pounds. Her sunscreen comes in 8-ounce bottles. While on vacation, if she will be outside 4 hours a day over 8 days, how many bottles of sunscreen will she need to pack?
The red car, weighing 2000 kg, is 40% cheaper than the blue car. The price of the blue car is $100. After some modifications, the red car now weighs 2200 kg. How much do both cars cost?

Emil, who weighs 150 pounds, is 19 years old now. When he turns 24, he will be half the age of his dad but twice as old as his brother. By then, he will weigh 200 pounds. What is the sum of the ages of his dad and his brother now?

Adrianne is collecting different kinds of beads for making bracelets. Her mother gave her 20 metallic beads, weighing initially 2 pounds. Her sister gave her ten more beads than her mother, and her friend gave her twice as many as her mother gave, making the total weight of beads 3 pounds. How many beads did Adrianne have altogether?

On Thursday, Joe caught 3 pounds of crawfish with a humidity of 40% in the air. He caught 4 times that amount on Friday and half the amount of his Friday's catch on Saturday when the humidity rose to 60%. If 1 serving of crawfish is 3 pounds, how many servings does he have?

In Mr. Roper's class of 30 students, where the humidity is initially 50%, 20% of the class are football players. Out of the remaining class, 25% of the students are cheerleaders or part of band. These 3 groups of students will need to leave early today to travel to an away game. By the time they leave, the humidity in the class has risen to 60%. How many students are leaving early?

Charlie, who weighs 150 pounds, has boots that are five times the size of Sophie's. After a hearty meal, his weight goes up to 200 pounds. If Sophie wears size five boots, what is the average size of shoe worn by the two?

Pat has a flower bed that is 111 feet long and weighs 100 pounds. Pat wants to fill her flower bed with plants. As she adds more plants, the weight of the bed increases. Pat's flowers grow 12 inches wide so she needs to leave 1.5 feet between every plant. After adding all her plants, the bed now weighs 200 pounds. Pat already owns 17 flowers. Each flowering plant costs $6 at the store,  how much money will Pat spend at the store to fill up her flower bed?
Edgar, who weighs 150 pounds, eats 18 pretzels a day. After eating, his weight goes up to 152 pounds. If his brother eats 1/2 as many, how many does his brother eat in a week?

Katherine has 5 hanging baskets to fill. In each basket, she wants to add 3 petunias and 2 sweet potato vines. The petunias cost $3.00 apiece and the sweet potato vines cost $2.50 apiece. Initially, the weight of each basket is 10 pounds, but after filling, it increases to 15 pounds. How much will she spend filling all 5 hanging baskets?

Artemis is potting flowers with her father in a 5 cubic feet pot. They buy a 30-pound bag of soil. Each rose needs 1 pound. Each carnation needs 1.5 pounds. Each Sunflower needs 3 pounds. They decide to move to a bigger pot of 10 cubic feet. If they plant 4 sunflowers and 10 carnations, how many roses can they plant?

Jessica, who weighs 150 pounds, makes $2,000.00 a month. She sets 25% of her paycheck aside to put towards fancy shoes. Each pair of shoes she buys costs $1,000.00. After a month of this routine, her weight increases to 160 pounds. How many shoes can she buy in a year?

Emily can peel 6 shrimp a minute in a kitchen with a temperature of 70 degrees Fahrenheit, and saute 30 shrimp in 10 minutes, by which time the temperature has risen to 85 degrees Fahrenheit. How long will it take her to peel and cook 90 shrimp?

An air conditioner cools a room 2 degrees an hour on low and 3 degrees an hour on high, starting at 30% humidity. The room will warm up at 2 degrees an hour with no air conditioner running. The air conditioner ran on low for 3 hours, then it was turned up to high for 4 hours. Afterward, it was turned off for 2 hours, during which the humidity rose to 45%. How many degrees lower than the starting temperature was the final temperature?

Comet Halley, with a luminosity of 70 lumens, orbits the sun every 75 years. Bill's dad saw the Comet when he was 30 years old. Bill saw the comet a second time, now with a luminosity of 100 lumens, when he was three times the age his father was when he saw the Comet. How old was Bill when he saw the Comet for the first time?

Buford writes many checks every year. Once per month he writes a check to pay the electric bill when the humidity is around 30%. He also writes a check every month for the gas bill. Twice per month he writes a check to the church. And quarterly, he writes a check to the pest and lawn service, by which time the humidity has usually risen to 45%. How many checks does Buford write per year?

An airport, where the humidity is initially 30%, has only 2 planes that fly multiple times a day. Each day, the first plane goes to Greece for three-quarters of its flights, and the remaining flights are split equally between flights to France and flights to Germany. The other plane flies exclusively to Poland, and its 44 trips only amount to half the number of trips the first plane makes throughout each day. As the day progresses, the humidity in the airport increases to 45%. How many flights to France does the first plane take in one day?

Tobias, Chikote, and Igneous are the three little wolves who live in the forest and howl at the moon every night, where the humidity is initially 60%. When Tobias howls, each howl lasts for a total of 20 seconds. Chikote howls for twice as long as Tobias. And Igneous howls for as long as the other two wolves combined. By the end of their howls, the humidity has risen to 80%. What is the combined length of time, in minutes, of the three wolves' howls?

Adam, weighing 150 pounds, bought himself some new trousers for $30. His mother gave him $6 for this purpose, and his father gave him twice as much. After eating a hearty meal, his weight increased to 160 pounds. How much money did Adam have to contribute from his savings?

Walter is collecting money for charity. First he collects $500 from his neighbors. Then he collects $1500 from a fund he set up online. His lawyer offers to donate three times as much as everyone else donates. Walter, who weighs 2000 pounds, is going to tell him about his neighbors and the online fund until his friend gives him $200 as well. After all the donations, Walter weighs 2200 pounds. How much is Walter's lawyer going to contribute?

Dylan attended a wedding where there were 100 guests in the reception. The room was initially at a comfortable 70 degrees Fahrenheit. Each guest brought a plate of 15 cookies. The bride decided to give 1/2 of the cookies to the church next door as a thank you for helping in the wedding reception. With the influx of people and activity, the temperature in the room rose to 75 degrees Fahrenheit. If each person in the church next door got 15 cookies, how many people were in the church next door?

A family of 6 (2 adults and 4 kids) are to divide a watermelon weighing 5 pounds such that each adult gets a slice that is twice as big as that of each kid. After they all had their slices, the watermelon now weighs 3 pounds. What percentage of the watermelon does each adult get?

Doctor Jones is scheduling his time for Monday. He is spending nine hours at the clinic where he works that day, starting with a comfortable 30% humidity. He has to do rounds to check on inpatients staying at the clinic, which takes twenty minutes per inpatient, and he has ten appointments, which take thirty minutes each. By the end of the day, the humidity in the clinic has risen to 45%. How many hours will Doctor Jones have left to update his records if he has 9 inpatients at the clinic?

Jordan wanted to surprise her mom with a homemade birthday cake. The kitchen was at a comfortable 68 degrees Fahrenheit. From reading the instructions, she knew it would take 20 minutes to make the cake batter and 30 minutes to bake the cake. The heat from the oven raised the temperature to 75 degrees Fahrenheit. The cake would require 2 hours to cool and an additional 10 minutes to frost the cake. If she plans to make the cake all on the same day, what is the latest time of day that Jordan can start making the cake to be ready to serve it at 5:00 pm?

Lisa and Peter are selling chocolate bars door to door. Lisa sold three and a half boxes of chocolate bars, and Peter sold four and a half boxes. They sold 64 chocolate bars together. The combined weight of the chocolate bars was initially 150 pounds, but after selling, it increased to 200 pounds. How many chocolate bars are in a box?

A dance studio offers lessons to students. It costs $25 per session to rent the studio plus $1.50 per student per session. The studio, initially at 45% humidity, has 10 students and is rented 3 days a week. As more students come in, the humidity rises to 60%. How much are the expected earnings of the dance studio in a month?

Peter has 4 boxes with the same number of chocolate bars in each, weighing initially 20 pounds. After adding more chocolates, they now weigh 30 pounds. Meanwhile, Martha has 7 boxes with the same number of chocolate bars in each. If Peter and Martha have totals of 64 and 56 chocolate bars respectively, how many more chocolate bars does Peter have in each box than Martha?

The population of porcupines in a park, where the humidity is 60%, is 50. The number of female porcupines is 3/5 of the total population. As more porcupines gather, the humidity rises to 70%. If each female porcupine gives birth to 4 babies every month, how many porcupines will be in the park after a year?

The Smith family is getting ready for summer and needs to have their swimming pool filled. The pool company instructed them to measure to find the volume of the pool, then to multiply it by 5.9 to calculate how many gallons of water they need. The cost for the pool company to come and fill the pool is $0.10 per gallon. Mr. Smith measured and found the pool is 14 feet wide, 25 feet long, and 4 feet deep. Initially, the temperature of the pool water was 70 degrees Fahrenheit, but after filling it rose to 80 degrees Fahrenheit. How much will it cost to fill the pool?

Two friends are playing pick-up sticks in a room with a humidity of 50%. While playing, they noticed that there are 9 red sticks, and 5 more blue sticks than red. Also, the number of yellow sticks is 3 less than the blue sticks. As the game progresses, the humidity in the room increases to 60%. How many sticks do they have?

Matteo traveled at 55 miles per hour for 4 hours, during which the temperature was a steady 70 degrees Fahrenheit. Shandy traveled at 45 miles per hour for 10 hours, by the end of which the temperature had risen to 85 degrees Fahrenheit. How many miles farther did Shandy drive than Matteo?

Brook Hills High School, where the temperature is 68 degrees Fahrenheit, currently enrolls 3000 students. Half of these students are over 16 years old, and one-fourth of the students over 16 years old are male. The remaining half of the students are under 16 years old, and one-half of the students under 16 are male. By the end of the day, the temperature in the school rises to 75 degrees Fahrenheit. In total, how many female students are enrolled at this school?

On a day when the temperature was 70 degrees Fahrenheit, Bethany could run 10 laps on the track in one hour. As the temperature rose to 80 degrees Fahrenheit, Trey could run 4 more laps than Bethany. Shaelyn could run half as many laps as Trey. Quinn could run 2 fewer laps than Shaelyn. How many more laps can Bethany run compared to Quinn?

A tank, located in an area where the temperature is 68 degrees Fahrenheit, has a capacity of 18000 gallons. Wanda and Ms. B decided to pump water from a pond to fill the tank in two days. On the first day, working in shifts, Wanda filled 1/4 of the tank's capacity with water, and Ms. B pumped 3/4 as much water as Wanda pumped into the tank that day. On the second day, as the temperature rose to 75 degrees Fahrenheit, Wanda pumped 2/3 of the amount of water she pumped on the previous day, while Ms. B only pumped 1/3 of the number of gallons she pumped on the first day. How many gallons of water are remaining for the tank to be full?

Maria was charging her power bank in a room with a temperature of 70 degrees Fahrenheit before going to the park. When she disconnected it, she noticed the power bank wasn’t fully charged yet. Once at the park, her friends asked her if they could charge their phones. While charging her friends’ phones, she noticed that her power bank was losing 9% of the total capacity each hour. 5 hours later the battery started to lose instead 7% of the total capacity each hour for about 3 hours. In the end, the charge remaining was 28%. The temperature in the park rose to 85 degrees Fahrenheit. What was the charge of the power bank when Maria went out to the park?

Janet, who weighs 130 pounds, gets a job as a waitress. She makes $10 an hour from wages and another $15 an hour from tips. Over time, she gains weight and now weighs 140 pounds. She wants to save up 20% of the cost of a $10000 car for a downpayment. If she works 40 hours a week how many weeks will she need to work to save the down payment?
