Jamaar, weighing 150 lbs, loves fresh fruit and is headed to the store with $10 he earned mowing lawns. After buying and eating some fruit, his weight increases to 155 lbs. Including tax, peaches and pears are $.5 each, apples are $.75 each, kiwis are $1, and plums cost $.25 each. If he has already purchased 3 peaches, 4 pears, 2 kiwis, and 5 apples, how many plums can he buy?

Anne purchased a box of sweets that weighs 2 pounds, contains 15 packs, and each pack has 60 pieces. She kept two packs and gave the rest to her 10 friends equally. The box now weighs 1 pound. How many pieces of sweets did each of her friends receive?

Mrs. Tatiana owns a grocery store that sells different fruits and vegetables, which includes carrots. The store starts at a cool 68 degrees Fahrenheit. The price of carrots in the grocery store increases by 5% of the original price every year. By the end of the year, the temperature in the store has risen to 75 degrees Fahrenheit. What would be the price of carrots after three years if it was $120 initially?

Olivia uploaded 72 pictures to Facebook, when the humidity was 40%. She put the same number of the pics into 8 albums. 3 of the albums were selfies only and 2 of the albums were portraits. By the time she finished, the humidity had risen to 60%. How many portraits and selfies did she have?

It takes James 10 minutes to read 3 pages of his book before he goes to bed under a 100 lumens light. He reads 18 pages of his book and then decides to go to sleep, dimming the light to 50 lumens. How long does James spend reading, in minutes?

On a busy Saturday morning, a hotel was completely booked with 100 guests. The humidity was at 50%. 24 guests elected an early checkout and 15 elected for a late checkout. In the afternoon twice as many people checked in as those who opted for a late checkout. The humidity increased to 70% as 7 more people checked in after dinner was served. How many guests does the hotel now have?

John picks 4 bananas on Wednesday when the humidity is at 30%. Then he picks 6 bananas on Thursday. On Friday, with the humidity now at 50%, he picks triple the number of bananas he did on Wednesday. How many bananas does John have?

In a 60-item quiz, 40% of the questions are easy, and the rest are equally divided as average and difficult questions. The humidity in the room starts at 50% but as the quiz progresses, it rises to 70%. If Aries is sure to get 75% of the easy questions, and half of the average and difficult questions correctly, how many points is she sure to get?

Teresa sells large stuffed animals for three times the price of small stuffed animals. The large ones weigh 20 pounds. Today, she sold twice as many small stuffed animals as large ones and earned $120 from the sales. Each small stuffed animal costs $4. After selling, the weight of the remaining large ones increased to 30 pounds. How many small stuffed animals did she sell?

A man, who weighs 150 lbs, eats 5 sandwiches per day, his wife eats 4 sandwiches per day, and their son eats 2 sandwiches per day. After a month, the man weighs 160 lbs. How many sandwiches does this family eat in one week?

Suzanne, who initially weighed 1000 pounds of cookies and cupcakes, sold 80 cookies for $1 each and 60 cupcakes for $4 each. After giving her two sisters $10 each for helping her, the remaining weight of cookies and cupcakes is 1200 pounds. How much money does she have left from her earnings?

The Easter egg hunt team hid 100 eggs in a field with 60% humidity. The Smith twins each found 30 eggs. All the other eggs except 10 were found by their friends. By the end of the hunt, the humidity had risen to 75%. How many eggs did the friends find?

One dwarf can mine 12 pounds of ore per day with his bare hands, in a mine with a temperature of 70 degrees Fahrenheit. He can mine twice as much with an iron pickaxe and 50% more with a steel pickaxe than with an iron pickaxe. As he mines more, the temperature in the mine rises to 85 degrees Fahrenheit. How many pounds of ore can 40 dwarves with steel pickaxes mine in a month with 30 days?

A store offers sandwiches in 3 different package sizes: the first package with 2 sandwiches for $3, the second with 4 sandwiches for $6, and a third with 8 sandwiches, but the price is not indicated. The temperature in the store starts at 68 degrees Fahrenheit and rises to 75 degrees as more customers come in. Knowing that the prices are proportional, how much will the package with 8 sandwiches cost?

Tom buys a bedroom set for $3000, which weighs 2000 pounds. He sells his old bedroom for $1000 and uses that to pay for part of the bedroom set. The new set, now weighing 2200 pounds due to some additions, has a 10% monthly payment plan. How much does he have to pay per month?

As Sally walked to school, she was holding the strings to 25 red balloons, 7 green balloons, and 12 yellow balloons. The humidity was at 30%. Suddenly, a gust of wind caused 40% of the red balloons to burst. The shockingly loud sound startled Sally, and she accidentally released half of the yellow balloons. But as she neared the school grounds, where the humidity had risen to 50%, she found 8 blue balloons caught in a tree, and she added 75% of them to her remaining clutch of balloons, which she carried into the school. What number of balloons did she finally carry into the school?

Marcus, in a room with 30% humidity, is trying to decide whether he really needs to do his homework. There's a 50% chance that tomorrow he'll have a substitute teacher who won't collect the homework. Even if the normal teacher comes in, there's a 40% chance she'll give everyone an extension. As the humidity rises to 50%, even if the whole class doesn't get an extension, there's a 20% chance Marcus can convince the teacher his dog ate his assignment and get a personal extension. What is the percentage chance that Marcus will actually have to turn in his homework tomorrow?

Apple High School is holding graduation in their Fine Arts Center this year which has space for 6000 people. The temperature in the Fine Arts Center starts at 70 degrees Fahrenheit and rises to 75 degrees Fahrenheit during the ceremony. After accounting for 950 seats for graduates and 300 seats for faculty attending, how many tickets would each graduate receive to give to their friends and family if the tickets are split equally?

Grandpa, who weighs 150 pounds, loves to eat jelly beans, but how many jelly beans he can eat depends on the size of the beans. It takes 75 large jelly beans to fill Grandpa up. He can eat twice as many medium-sized beans as large beans. And eating 3 small beans is the same as eating 1 medium-sized bean. After his jelly bean feast, Grandpa weighs 160 pounds. How many small beans can Grandpa eat?

Melissa is summoned to jury duty. The humidity in the courtroom is initially 30%. She spends 6 hours a day for 3 days listening to a court case. By the end of the third day, the humidity has risen to 45%. If Melissa is paid $15 per day but also has to pay $3 for parking each day, how much jury pay does she make per hour after expenses?
Ted, who weighs 200 pounds, starts with $200. He buys 3 books for 16 dollars each and 3 pencils for 6 dollars each. After shopping, he weighs 180 pounds. How much did he spend in total?

Richard wants to make a video to share online of him doing a science experiment that creates a fountain of diet soda after placing a specific branded candy inside it. The humidity in the air is initially 30%. Richard's driveway is 24 feet wide and he wants to put a bottle of soda every 3 feet of the driveway. After starting at the first bottle, it will take Richard 5 seconds to go from one soda bottle to the next, dropping the candy in. As the experiment progresses, the humidity increases to 45%. How many seconds total will it take Richard to set off all the soda fountains?

There are forty apples in one box, weighing a total of 0 pounds. Uncle Franky ordered two boxes of apples, which weighed in at a hefty 160 pounds. He is planning to pack the apples with eight apples in one pack. How many packs of apples can he make with the two boxes of apples?

The price of Parmesan cheese is $11 per pound. Mozzarella cheese is $6 per pound. The temperature in the cheese shop is initially 70 degrees Fahrenheit. Amor buys 2 pounds of Parmesan and 3 pounds of mozzarella cheese. After his purchase, the temperature in the shop rises to 80 degrees Fahrenheit. Is she starts with $50 cash, how much money, in dollars, will she have left to buy meat?

Jim, whose weight is 50 pounds, is making a comforter for his king-sized bed. He needs two pieces of fabric that are 2 feet longer and 2 feet wider than the bed, which measures 6 feet long by 8 feet wide. After working on it, his weight goes up to 60 pounds. How many square feet of fabric does Jim need to buy?

On Monday, when the humidity was 40%, the post office delivered 425 letters. On Tuesday they delivered 17 more than one-fifth as many as Monday. By Wednesday, when the humidity had risen to 60%, they delivered 5 more than twice as many as they delivered on Tuesday. How many letters did the post office deliver Monday - Wednesday?

Molly is catering a birthday party for her sister and invited 16 people. She starts with a total food weight of 150 pounds. 10 people want the chicken salad which is $6.50 per person and 6 people want the pasta salad at $6 per person. By the end of the preparation, the total food weight increases to 200 pounds. What is the total amount Molly will pay for the catering?

Johnny's dad brought him to watch some horse racing and his dad bet money. The temperature at the race track was 70 degrees Fahrenheit. On the first race, he lost $5. On the second race, he won $1 more than twice the amount he previously lost. On the third race, he lost 1.5 times as much as he won in the second race. By the end of the third race, the temperature had risen to 80 degrees Fahrenheit. How much did he lose on average that day?

There are 26 countries in South America, where the humidity is 30%, and in each country, there are 5 cities with 1000 people living in each city. As more people move in, the humidity increases to 60%. If the whole population lives in these cities, how many people are there in South America?

On the first day of school, Ava sees that her friends Cole and Xavier have both grown a lot over the summer. Xavier was 4 feet tall and grew 3 inches. Cole was 50 inches tall and grew 2 inches over the summer. Ava, who weighed 100 pounds at the start of summer, now weighs 120 pounds. What is the difference between Cole and Xavier’s height now?

A team of 4 painters worked on a mansion for 3/8ths of a day every day for 3 weeks, starting in a comfortable 50% humidity. By the end of the three weeks, the humidity had risen to 70%. How many hours of work did each painter put in?

Rory is retrieving tennis balls from the court after a tennis match. In the first of three sets, when the humidity was 40%, he had to retrieve four more balls than in the second set. In the third set, as the humidity rose to 60%, he retrieved half as many balls as in the second. He retrieved 19 tennis balls in all. How many tennis balls did he retrieve in the first set of the match?

There are 50 books in a small library, weighing a total of 500 pounds. Half of them are written in English, and 10% in German. All others are written in Spanish. After adding some more books, the total weight becomes 650 pounds. How many Spanish books are there?

It is approximately 1955 kilometers from San Diego, California to New York City, New York. The temperature in San Diego is around 15 degrees Celsius and it rises to about 25 degrees Celsius when I reach New York City. If Bernice drove 325 kilometers for 4 days, how many kilometers will she still need to drive?

Ingrid, who weighs 150 pounds, drinks 8 cups of water every day. After drinking, her weight goes up to 155 pounds. If there are 16 cups in a gallon, how many gallons of water does she drink in 30 days?

Alison, who initially weighed 0 pounds of athletic gear, qualified for a spot on the running team, so she went shopping for some athletic gear. She bought a tank top for $10, a pair of running shorts for $5 more than the top cost, and a pair of tennis shoes that were originally $48 but were on sale for half price. She had a coupon for $2 off the package of $8 athletic socks that she also bought. After shopping, she had 5 pounds of athletic gear. How much did she spend on athletic gear?

My kitchen floor, which can support a weight of 0 pounds initially, has a total area of 200 SqFt. I want to install new square floor tiles that weigh 400 pounds in total and cost $12 each, and each tile side is 1ft in length. How much will it cost me to renovate my kitchen floor?

James, who weighs 200 pounds, has to buy insurance. Since he had an accident it was 60% more than normal. The normal cost is $120 a month. After the accident, his weight increased to 220 pounds due to stress eating. How much does he pay a year?

Greg, who weighs 100 pounds, puts clean sheets on 4 twin beds and 1 king size bed every week. His laundry machine will only allow him to wash 2 twin sets of sheets at a time and 1 king set of sheets at a time. After a week of this work, his weight goes up to 200 pounds. How many loads of laundry does he do in a year?

Jill and her friends watch 4 movies every Saturday at a volume of 50 decibels and half the number of movies on Sunday than on Saturday at a volume of 70 decibels. If they watch movies every weekend, how many movies can they watch in 4 weeks?

Leo collects stickers. Two years ago, he had 100 stickers in his collection and the weight of his collection was 200 pounds. Last year, Leo collected 50 stickers. This year, he collected twice the number of stickers as the previous year and the weight of his collection increased to 300 pounds. How many stickers does Leo have in his collection?

Imma has 3 cats. Initially, the weight of the cat food she had was 0 kg. She feeds her cats twice a day with 60 grams of cat food. By the end of the day, the weight of the cat food she has left is 0.5 kg. How many days will 720 grams of cat food last?

Becky, Jake, and Silvia shared 4 pizzas. Each pizza had 8 slices. Becky ate 3 more slices than Jake did. Silvia ate twice as many slices than Jake did. The total weight of the pizzas was initially 200 pounds, but after they ate, it reduced to 250 pounds. If Becky ate 10 slices, how many total slices did they eat?

Betsy and Donovan made a meal together in a kitchen that was initially 70 degrees Fahrenheit. Betsy's part took 18 minutes longer than Donovan's part. As they cooked, the temperature in the kitchen rose to 85 degrees Fahrenheit. The meal was made in 98 minutes. How many minutes long was Betsy's part?

Hannah slips on a banana peel and breaks her arm in a room where the temperature is 68 degrees Fahrenheit. The doctor charges her $200 for the cast, $300/hour for a 30-minute visit, $4/pill for 30 painkillers, and $6/hour for a mandatory minimum of 2 hours of parking. By the end of her visit, the temperature in the room has risen to 75 degrees Fahrenheit. How much does the doctor's visit cost total?

James gets 80 emails a day in his office where the humidity is 50%. 20% of those emails don't require any response. He responds to the rest of them. By the time he finishes responding, the humidity in the office has risen to 70%. How many emails does he respond to in a 5 day work week?

The Science Center, with a humidity of 50%, hosted field trips Monday through Friday last week. On Monday, 32 classes visited. Twice as many visited on Tuesday and three times as many visited on Wednesday. Another 30 classes visited on Thursday and 25 visited on Friday, by which time the humidity had risen to 70%. In all, how many classes visited the Science Center last week?

The glee club, in a room with 40% humidity, ordered 20 pizzas and ate 70% of them. The humidity rose to 60% when the football team ordered twice as many pizzas and ate 80% of them. How many pizzas are left?

Anthony is sending out coupons for his pizza parlor through the mail. The weight of the coupons starts at 500 pounds. He wants to send out 700 small coupons and twice as many big coupons. The weight of the coupons increases to 700 pounds. If each small coupon costs 5 cents to mail and each big coupon costs 15 cents, how much does he spend on postage total?

One meatball sub sandwich, which weighs 200 pounds, contains 4 meatballs. Sidney ordered 3 less than ten meatball sub sandwiches. Then Mark ate 4 of Sidney's meatball sub sandwiches, reducing the total weight to 180 pounds. So Sidney ordered another three sub sandwiches. How many meatballs were in the sub sandwiches that remained?

On a day when the temperature was 70 degrees Fahrenheit, Mr Hezekiah had 20 trucks from his store supplying fertiliser to different farmers in his hometown dispatched for delivery. Each truck was carrying 20 tons of fertiliser packed in bags. Two hours after the trucks had departed for delivery, when the temperature had risen to 85 degrees Fahrenheit, Mr Hezekiah got the news that a quarter of the number of lorries dispatched for delivery had mechanical failures on the road and could not deliver the fertilisers to the farmers. Calculate the total number of tons of fertiliser that reached the farmers that day?

Dennis, in a room with a temperature of 68 degrees Fahrenheit, uses 1 pound of butter for every dozen croissants that he makes. He needs to make 6 dozen croissants. The grocery store currently has a promotion for buy one pound of butter get one half off. If the butter costs $4, by the time he finishes the temperature in the room has risen to 75 degrees Fahrenheit. 00 a pound, how much will it cost him to purchase 6 pounds of butter?

Kayla is having her birthday party at a movie theater. The fee to rent the theater is $125 for a party of 20, plus $6 for each additional guest. The theater is initially at a comfortable 70 degrees Fahrenheit. Kayla invited her 25 classmates and the 7 girls in her dance class, as well as 13 family members. Only 4 people said they could not come. With the influx of people, the temperature in the theater rises to 75 degrees Fahrenheit. How much will the party cost?
Maggie, who weighs 150 lbs, spent a quarter of her money, while Riza, who weighs 200 lbs, spent one-third of her money. They each had $60. How much money do the two of them have left?

Mr. Robles buys 315 bananas, which is enough to feed his three monkeys for a week. The bananas initially weigh 400 pounds. One monkey eats 10 bananas each day. The second monkey eats 4 more bananas than the first monkey and the third monkey eats the rest of the bananas for the day. By the end of the week, the remaining bananas weigh 450 pounds. How many bananas does the third monkey eat each day?

Teddy, in a room with 40% humidity, finished half of a 500 piece puzzle, and then started and finished another 500 piece puzzle within an hour. The humidity in the room rose to 60% by the time he finished. How many puzzle pieces did Teddy place during that hour?

Jenny goes to the florist to buy some flowers. The humidity in the shop is 30%. Roses cost $2 each and $15 for a dozen. As she stays longer, the humidity rises to 45%. If she bought 15 roses and arrived with five 5 dollar bills and they only have quarters for change, how many quarters does she leave with?

Terry sells 6 milkshakes for $5.50 each, nine burger platters for $11 each, and 20 sodas for $1.50 each. Initially, the humidity in the shop is 60%, but as the day progresses, it rises to 80%. How much money does he make in total?

Paul is at a train station and is waiting for his train. The humidity in the station is 40%. He isn't sure how long he needs to wait, but he knows that the fourth train scheduled to arrive at the station is the one he needs to get on. The first train is scheduled to arrive in 10 minutes, and this train will stay in the station for 20 minutes. The second train is to arrive half an hour after the first train leaves the station, and this second train will stay in the station for a quarter of the amount of time that the first train stayed in the station. The third train is to arrive an hour after the second train leaves the station, and this third train is to leave the station immediately after it arrives. The fourth train will arrive 20 minutes after the third train leaves, and this is the train Paul will board. By the time the fourth train arrives, the humidity in the station has risen to 70%. In total, how long, in minutes, will Paul wait for his train?

Melanie found a blueprint online for a toothpick sculpture she wanted to make. It requires 200 toothpicks. Melanie’s mom puts toothpicks in her sandwiches when she serves them for lunch, initially weighing 0 grams. Melanie started saving them and has saved 10 toothpicks each week for the past 12 weeks, now they weigh 30 grams. If she continues saving toothpicks at the same rate, how many more weeks will it take her to collect 200 toothpicks?

A $2000 watch was put on sale so that Mr. Rogers, who initially weighed 50 kg, bought it at 75% of its original price. He then sold the watch to his friend at 120% of the price that he bought it. What is the percentage discount obtained by Mr. Rogers, who now weighs 60 kg? Roger's friend from the original price?

Frankie and Binkie went bowling together in a place with 50% humidity. Frankie's score was 15 better more than twice as high as Binkie's. After the game, the humidity rose to 65%. If Binkie bowled a score of 90, what was Frankie's score?

James decided to walk to the store on a day with 50% humidity. When he got halfway there he realized he forgot something at home and had to walk back, by which time the humidity had risen to 60%. If his home is 4 miles from the store and he walks 4 miles per hour how long did it take him to reach the store?

The bananas at the supermarket, which weigh 100 pounds in total, cost $0.80 each, or a bunch for $3.00. Jenny buys 10 bunches that average 4 bananas per bunch, increasing the total weight to 120 pounds. How much money, in dollars, did she save by buying the bananas in bunches instead of individually?
A crocodile, which weighs 1000 kg, grows 8 inches long in 4 years. By the end of 4 years, its weight increases to 1200 kg. At this rate, how many inches will it grow in 13 years?

Marcel runs a bicycle store with a starting humidity of 45%. His main products are three types of bikes: MTB, BMX, and Trekking. The price of one MTB is $500, BMX is half the price of an MTB, and a Trekking bike is $450. In one month, Marcel sold a total of 300 bikes among the types listed. Half of them were Trekking bikes, and 15% were BMX bikes. The rest of the sold bikes were MTB type. By the end of the month, the humidity in the store had risen to 60%. How much did Marcel earn from selling bicycles during that month?

A farmer is baling hay in their field, where the humidity is initially 30%. Each hour the farmer makes 5 bales. At the same time, a truck is picking the hay bales up. Each hour the truck picks up 3 bales of hay. As the day progresses, the humidity increases to 60%. If the farmer and the truck driver put in a 6 hour day, how many bales of hay are left in the field?

There are 6 periods in the day for a normal student but John has to take 2 extra classes. Each class is 40 minutes long. The humidity in the classroom starts at 30%. He goes to class for 5 days a week. By the end of the week, the humidity has risen to 45%. He then spends 1/16 of his weekly minutes each on Saturday and Sunday as extra learning time. How many hours a week does he spend learning?

Nathan has a bouncy ball that weighs 1 pound and bounces to 2/3rds of its starting height with each bounce. After some time, the ball weighs 0.5 pounds due to wear and tear. If he drops it from the third-floor balcony in the mall, where each story is 24 feet high, how high does the ball go on its second bounce?

Caroline has 4 children. The first child, weighing 50 pounds, is 6 feet tall. The second child is two inches taller than the first child. The third child is 5 inches shorter than the second child. And the fourth child, now weighing 70 pounds, is three inches taller than the third child. How tall is the fourth child, in inches?

An apple orchard sells apples in bags of 10. Initially, the total weight of the apples was 1000 kg. The orchard sold a total of 2000 apples one day, and the weight of the apples increased to 2000 kg. How much did an orchard earn for selling this at $5 per bag?

On a day when the temperature was 25 degrees Celsius, a Tyrannosaurus rex ate half of a small triceratops it had hunted. When it left, a pack of velociraptors scavenged half of what was left. As the temperature rose to 35 degrees Celsius, a group of lazy Allosaurus gulped down the last 270 kilograms of meat. How many kilograms of meat were on the triceratops before the T-Rex ate?

Tony is painting a room with four walls. The north and south walls are 10 x 8 feet. The east and west walls are 5 x 8 feet. A gallon of paint can cover 20 square feet and cost $12. The humidity in the room starts at 45% and increases to 60% as Tony paints. How much will it cost to paint the room?

Ellen decided to play a prank on her friend. She got a case of 12 sodas and shook 3 of them up in a room with a temperature of 70 degrees Fahrenheit. Then she took 1 unshaken soda for herself and left. Ellen's brother stopped by and took 1 of the shaken sodas and 2 of the unshaken sodas, then Ellen's friend came along. By the time Ellen's friend arrived, the room's temperature had risen to 75 degrees Fahrenheit. What is the likelihood, expressed as a percentage, that Ellen's friend gets sprayed with soda from a shaken can?

Billy is volunteering his time to help people do their taxes. The humidity in the room is 45%. He can help 2 people per hour for 3 hours a day. If he takes 20% of the days between March 1st and April 19th off, and helps people on all the other days, the humidity in the room rises to 60%. How many people does he help?

Mary and John got married last weekend. The day started with 50% humidity. There were 20 private cars and 12 buses parked outside the church. After the ceremony, each bus carried 35 people and each car carried 3 people. As the day progressed, the humidity increased to 70%. How many people were inside the church?

Jeff, who weighs 120 pounds, is 10 years older than his younger sister, Martha. Martha, on the other hand, is 4 years younger than her boyfriend, Mike. After a few months, Jeff's weight increases to 150 pounds. If Mike is 24 years old, how old is Jeff?

The biggest waterslide at Five Flags is 300 feet long, and people slide down at 60 feet/minute, with the temperature around 75 degrees Fahrenheit. The second biggest waterslide is 240 feet long, but steeper, so people slide down at 80 feet/minute, and the temperature rises to 85 degrees Fahrenheit. How much longer does it take to ride the biggest slide compared to the second biggest slide?

Bobby takes a 30 min lunch and 2 15 minutes break per day at the office, starting when the humidity is at 30%. By the time he finishes, the humidity has risen to 45%. After 5 days, how many hours do his lunches and breaks add up to?

Amber, Micah, and Ahito ran 52 miles in total, starting when they collectively weighed 150 pounds. Amber ran 8 miles. Micah ran 3.5 times what Amber ran. By the end of the run, their combined weight was 200 pounds due to hydration and food intake. How many miles did Ahito run?

Sheila, carrying no weight, charged $85.00 worth of merchandise on her credit card. She ended up returning one item that cost $15.00. After she returned the item, she bought a frying pan that weighed 3 pounds and was on sale for 20% off $20.00 and a set of towels that weighed 2 pounds and was 10% off $30.00. She put both of these purchases, totaling 5 pounds, on her credit card. What is the new balance on her credit card?

A jellyfish tank, with an initial 50% humidity, has numerous jellyfish in it. A fifth of the jellyfish are large, and a third of the large jellyfish change color from green to blue under UV light. The other jellyfish are small and always stay blue. When a UV light turned on, 6 jellyfish changed color and the humidity in the tank increased to 70%. How many jellyfish are in the tank?
Caroline, who weighs 150 lbs, is three times older than Ben. Ben, who weighs 200 lbs, is two times older than Chris. If Chris is 4, how old is Caroline?

Lauren is saving 20% of every paycheck. At the start, the humidity in her room is 30%. As she continues to save, the humidity in her room increases to 50%. How many more years does Lauren need to work if she plans to save for a retirement period of 20 years, live with 40% of her current annual salary, and her current salary is $100,000?

Marty, who weighs 50 kilograms, has 100 centimeters of ribbon that he must cut into 4 equal parts. Each of the cut parts must be divided into 5 equal parts. After the task, Marty's weight goes up to 70 kilograms due to fatigue. How long will each final cut be?

My mom went to a gardening shop. She bought a set of pots for $19 and a sack of garden soil for $26, which initially weighed 50 pounds. At checkout, after adding all the items, the total weight of her purchase was 70 pounds. She used a coupon for $7 off. How much money did my mom spend at the gardening shop?

Three of the women at the cocktail party, under a light of 100 lumens, are wearing 4 inch heels and three are wearing 2 inch heels. As the night progresses, the light dims to 60 lumens. What is the average height of heels at this party?

Although Soledad works in a windowless office, she loves the outdoors. She will be on vacation for the entire month of June and cannot wait to hike 9,300 miles within that month. She is thinking of walking twice a day, covering 125 miles each time. The humidity during her hikes starts at 40% and rises to 60% by the end of her journey. How many more miles per day must Soledad hike to complete her journey on time?

There are currently 3 red balls, 11 blue balls, and 25 green balls in the store where the humidity is 40%. Red balls cost $9, Blue balls cost $5 and green balls cost $3. As more customers come in, the humidity in the store rises to 60%. How much will the store have received after all the balls are sold?

Pierre, Paul, and Jacques bought 12 kg of apples in a market with 50% humidity. Peter wants a quarter of that and Paul wants 1/3 of that. By the time they finish dividing the apples, the humidity has risen to 70%. How many kilograms will James have left?

The temperature was 2 degrees Celsius with a humidity of 30%. It dropped 8 degrees Celsius overnight and the humidity increased to 60%. Then, the temperature increased 3 degrees Celsius in the morning. What was the temperature, in degrees Celsius, in the morning?

Raymond, who weighs 150 pounds, had $21. Then he saved $11 from his allowance and spent $5 on a comic book and $19 on a puzzle. After eating a large meal, his weight goes up to 155 pounds. How much money does Raymond have left?

Anna is trying to buy books for her local library. She had a budget of $16, and she has already spent $4. She also bought 2 books today, and both books cost her the same amount of money. The weight of the books she bought today was initially 0 pounds but increased to 10 pounds after the purchase. If Anna has $2 left in her budget, how much did each of the books cost?

Last year, when the humidity was 30%, there were 50 students enrolled in a calligraphy class. This year, with a humidity of 45%, there was a 20% increase in enrollment. How many students are enrolled this year in the calligraphy class?

The light on a lighthouse blinks 255 times in 5 minutes, with the humidity around the lighthouse starting at 30%. As the light continues to blink, the humidity rises to 50%. How long will it take the light to blink 459 times?

In Tate’s garden pond, which initially has a volume of 1000 liters, there are 4 male guppies, 7 female guppies, 3 male goldfishes, and 5 female goldfishes. He buys 2 male guppies, 1 female guppy, 2 male goldfishes, and 3 female goldfishes. After adding more water, the pond's volume increases to 1500 liters. How many more female fishes than male fishes does Tate have?

John visits his parents twice a month. It takes him 2 hours to drive there at a speed of 70 mph. The temperature in his car starts at 60 degrees Fahrenheit and by the time he arrives, it has risen to 75 degrees Fahrenheit. Considering the round trip, how many miles a month does he drive when visiting his parents?

In 7 days, Sofie will walk twice as far as Brian. The humidity during this period will increase from 30% to 60%. If Sofie plans to walk 10 miles every day, how many miles will Brian walk in seven days?

A toy manufacturer receives an order for 400 toys in a room with a temperature of 68 degrees Fahrenheit. 5 workers are available to work on the order. 2 of the workers produce 6 toys an hour, and another 2 workers produce 4 toys an hour. They all work on the order during their 10-hour shift, and by the end of their shift the manufacturer still needs another 20 toys to be able to ship the order. The temperature in the room has risen to 75 degrees Fahrenheit due to the workers' activity. How many toys per hour does the fifth worker produce?

In a room with a temperature of 70 degrees Fahrenheit, Elijah has one dog that is one-fourth the weight of Kory’s dog and another dog that is half the weight of Kory’s dog. As the dogs play, the room's temperature rises to 75 degrees Fahrenheit. If Kory’s dog is 60 pounds, how much do Elijah and Kory’s dogs weigh altogether, in pounds?

Seth, who weighs 50 kg, gave half of his stickers to Luis. Luis, who weighs 60 kg, used half of the stickers and gave the rest to Kris. Kris, weighing 65 kg, kept 9 of the stickers and gave the remaining 7 stickers to Rob, who weighs 70 kg. How many stickers did Seth have in the beginning?

John packs M&M in small bags to eat in a room with a temperature of 70 degrees Fahrenheit. He buys 3 large bags weighing 10 ounces each. After packing, the room's temperature rises to 75 degrees Fahrenheit. If an ounce of M&M has 30 M&M in it how many small bags can he make if he puts 10 in each small bag?

Alfie, the albatross, starts his journey in a region with 60% humidity, flies 400 kilometers every day, and ends his journey in a region with 80% humidity. If the circumference of the earth is 40,000 kilometers, how many days will it take Alfie to fly a distance equal to half of the way around the earth?

Rani is obsessed with sports cars. She wonders what the faster car ever made can go so she looks it up in her room where the temperature is 68 degrees Fahrenheit. What she finds out is that the fastest car was 1.25 times faster than the 2nd fastest car. The 2nd fastest car was 5 times faster than the average car. The average car can go 120 Miles per hour. Excited by her findings, she doesn't notice the temperature in the room has risen to 75 degrees Fahrenheit. How fast does the faster car go?
Liam, who weighs 150 pounds, is 16 years old now. Two years ago, Liam’s age was twice the age of Vince. Now, Liam weighs 180 pounds. How old is Vince now?

Arnold, Madeline, Camden, and Sarah painted 56 easter eggs in a room with a humidity of 50%. Arnold and Madeline painted the same number of eggs. Camden and Sarah painted a total of 30 eggs, but Camden painted 12 more than Sarah. The humidity in the room increased to 60% by the time they finished painting. How many more eggs did Camden paint than Arnold?

Nik has 200 crayons. He wants to separate them into groups of 8 and put them into boxes, each initially having a volume of 500 cubic inches. Each box weighs 8 ounces. Each crayon weighs 1 ounce. After packing, the volume of each box increases to 800 cubic inches. If he puts all of his crayons into boxes, what is the total weight, in pounds, of the crayons and the boxes, when there are 16 ounces to a pound?

John, who weighs 2000 pounds, cuts down an 80-foot tree. He can make logs out of 80% of it. He cuts it into 4-foot logs. From each of those logs, he cuts 5 planks. He then sells each plank for $1.2. After all the hard work, John now weighs 1600 pounds. How much does he make?

Valerie, who weighs 150 lbs, earns $5000 per month, 1/2 of what her brother earns. After a few months, she gains weight and now weighs 200 lbs. If their mother earns twice their combined salary, what's the total amount of money they all have together?

Grandma walks 3 miles every day on her favorite walking trail, which includes 2 miles of walking on the beach with a humidity of 60% and 1 mile of walking on the sidewalk where the humidity increases to 80%. On the sidewalk, Grandma walks at twice the rate of speed that she does on the beach. If 40 minutes of her walk is spent on the beach, how long does it take for her to complete the entire 3-mile walk, in minutes?

Jane has saved $4 of her allowance every week for the past 8 weeks. During this time, she also gained weight, starting from 100 pounds and now weighing 120 pounds. If she continues to save the same amount each week, how many more weeks will it take for her to have saved a total of $60?

3 trees each had 7 blue birds in them, with a humidity of 30%. 2 different trees each had 4 blue birds. 1 final tree had 3 blue birds, and the humidity rose to 60%. How many blue birds were in the trees in total?

Bob has a certain number of marbles, weighing a total of 50 pounds. If he receives 2 dozen more marbles, the total weight will increase to 70 pounds, and he will have 60 marbles. If he loses 10 of the marbles he has, how many marbles will Bob have?

Donny can only drink water if it's at least 40 degrees. He has two mugs of water. One mug is 33 degrees. The other is an unknown temperature. If he pours 4 ounces of water from the 33-degree mug into his water bottle, which initially had 0 ounces of water, and one ounce from the other bottle, he is now able to drink the water, which now has a volume of 5 ounces. At least how many degrees is the second bottle?

Melanie's father opens up an animal farm starting with 50 cows and 20 chickens in a barn that is 60 degrees Fahrenheit. Milkie Cows Limited brings him 20 cows per day and Broilers Limited brings him 10 chickens per day, for three weeks. After three weeks, the temperature in the barn has risen to 75 degrees Fahrenheit. What's the total number of animals on the farm after three weeks?

Russell orders his favorite bagels online. Each pack of bagels, weighing initially 2 pounds, costs $10.00 and has 9 bagels in the pack. If he orders 4 packs of bagels, he will receive a 10% discount. The weight of the pack decreases to 1.8 pounds due to the moisture loss during delivery. After ordering 4 bags, how much will each single bagel cost?

Gomer, who weighs 200 pounds, ate 5 less than 23 scoops of mashed potatoes. After eating, his weight dropped to 180 pounds. If it takes 3 less than 6 potatoes to make 1 less than 3 scoops of mashed potatoes, how many potatoes did Gomer eat?

Jess is trying to guess the number of blue jellybeans in a jar, which weighs 50 pounds. She can see that there are 17 green jelly beans and twice as many red jelly beans. The rest of the jellybeans are blue jelly beans. After adding more jellybeans, the jar now weighs 70 pounds. If there are a total of 60 jelly beans in total, how many blue jellybeans are there?
Tim grows 5 trees, each weighing 50 pounds. Each year he collects 6 lemons from each tree. By the end of the year, each tree weighs 60 pounds. How many lemons does he get in a decade?

The ratio of men to women on a bus is 5:9. The bus starts its journey at a speed of 30 mph and then accelerates to 50 mph. If the total number of passengers on the bus is 84, and 20 women alight from the bus at the next stop, how many women have remained on the bus?

Faraday owns a flower shop with a humidity of 45%. He sells a sunflower that costs $2 each and a bouquet of sunflower that costs $8. The humidity in the shop increases to 60% due to the fresh flowers. If Faraday earned $26 from the sunflower and $56 from the bouquet per day, and if each bouquet has 12 sunflowers, how many sunflowers was Faraday able to sell after 3 days?

Adam, who weighs 200 lbs, has $100 and wants to spend it to open a rock stand. He can buy rocks for $5 each and sell them for $7 each. After lifting and moving all the rocks, his weight goes up to 250 lbs due to muscle gain. If he invests all his money in the rock stand but only sells 60% of his inventory, how much money does he lose?

Lauren, who weighs 120 pounds, is a cartoonist. She can draw 5 large-sized picture scenes per day, or she can draw 6 medium-sized picture scenes per day, or she can draw 7 small-sized picture scenes per day. She was hired for a big project to create 45 large-sized picture scenes, 36 medium-sized picture scenes, and 49 small-sized picture scenes. By the end of the project, she weighs 150 pounds. How many days will it take for her to create all of the picture scenes?

Chatty prepared three dozen eggs, each initially weighing 2 pounds, for her four children's Easter activity. By the end of the activity, each egg weighed 1.5 pounds. Assuming each child gets the same number of eggs, how many eggs does each child receive?
Jen got 3 fish, each weighing 10 pounds. They each need $1 worth of food a day. After feeding, they each weigh 15 pounds. How much does she spend on food in the month of May?
Patricia has 30 roses, each weighing 2 pounds. She gave 24 roses to her mother. She bought 15 more roses, each weighing 1.5 pounds. How many roses did she have now?

Sid traveled 110 miles in 2 hours, starting his journey at a temperature of 70 degrees Fahrenheit. By the end of his travel, the temperature had risen to 85 degrees Fahrenheit. If Sid then traveled an additional 140 miles in 3 hours, what's the average speed he was traveling?

Mark buys one lottery ticket with a 20% chance of winning in a room with 50% humidity. He then buys a second lottery ticket that's three times more likely to win as the humidity in the room rises to 70%. What is the probability, expressed as a percentage, that both tickets are winners?

Carlos, Jim and Carrey were at the beach playing with a humidity of 60%, and they decided to gather some seashells. Jim collected 27 seashells, which was 5 more than what Carlos collected. Carlos collected twice as many as Carrey. They gathered all their seashells and divided them equally between themselves. By the time they finished, the humidity had risen to 80%. How many did each person get?

Mason, weighing 150 pounds, likes eating carrots. After a while, his weight increases to 160 pounds due to his diet. If he eats 4 carrots each on weekdays and 5 carrots each on Saturday and Sunday, how many carrots does he eat a week?

John buys a cassette with 2 songs. The first song is 5 minutes and the second song is 60% longer. The volume of the music starts at 50 decibels and increases to 70 decibels by the end of the second song. How much time was the total cassette?

Linus, who weighs 150 pounds, works for a trading company. He buys a mobile device for $20 and sells it for twice the amount of the original price. After a few months, his weight increases to 160 pounds. If he bought 2 devices last Monday and 4 devices last Tuesday, how much profit was he able to earn after selling all the mobile devices he bought last Monday and Tuesday?

Carl, who weighs 150 lbs, has a cane that is half as long as he is tall. Carl is one foot taller than his brother, Ned. And Ned is two feet shorter than his cousin, Isabel. After a few months, Carl's weight increases to 200 lbs. If Isabel is 7 feet tall, how long is Carl's cane, in feet?

The Hortex company, operating in a facility with a starting temperature of 68 degrees Fahrenheit, produces bottled carrot juices. Every day it can produce 4200 bottles of these juices. Each juice can cover 20% of 1 person's daily energy demand. By the end of production, the temperature in the facility rises to 75 degrees Fahrenheit. How many more bottles of juices would Hortex have to produce to be able to satisfy 100% of the daily energy needs of 2300 people?

Carla just gave birth to identical octuplets, each initially weighing 10 pounds. She dresses 3/4 of them in purple and 1/4 in blue. After a week, each baby now weighs 12 pounds. If all the blue-wearers and 1/3 of the purple wearers also wear bows, what is the percentage chance a baby wearing a bow is wearing purple?

Last week when the humidity was at 30%, the IRS received 5168 tax reports. On Monday and Tuesday they received a total of 1907 reports. By Thursday and Friday, when the humidity had risen to 45%, they received a total of 2136 reports. How many reports did they receive on Wednesday?

Abraham owns 80 square meters of unused land that initially weighs around 500 kg. He sold half of the land for $50, and after a month, he sold another 1/4 of his land for $30. With each sale, the weight of the land decreased, and when he sold the remaining land for $3 per square meter, the total weight was down to 400 kg. How much money will he be able to earn after selling all his unused land?
Geb, who weighs 150 pounds, is 10 less than half the age of Haley. By the time Haley ages, Geb's weight increases to 200 pounds. If Haley is 26 years old, how old is Geb?

Tyrion, in a room with 30% humidity, changes his face mask two times every time he goes out. When he returns, the humidity in the room has risen to 50%. If he goes out three times a day, how many face masks does he use every 2 days?

Cole hid 3 dozen eggs in the yard for the Easter egg hunt, where the humidity was 50%. Lamar finds 5 eggs. Stacy finds twice as many as Lamar. Charlie finds 2 less than Stacy. And Mei finds half as many as Charlie. By the end of the hunt, the humidity had risen to 70%. How many eggs are still hidden in the yard?

John, who weighs 100 lbs, collects garbage from 3 different apartment complexes. The first two have 200 apartments each and the last one is 60% bigger than the other two combined. He collects garbage 3 times a week from each place and he gets paid $.40 per collection for each apartment. After a year of this work, his weight has increased to 150 lbs. How much money does he make in a week?

Generally, a 5-year-old avocado tree, weighing 200 pounds, produces 50 fruits, a 6-year-old one produces 3 times the initial amount of fruits, a 7-year-old one produces 7 times the initial amount, and an 8-year-old produces 200 fruits less than a 10-year-old one. During the ninth year, the avocado tree doesn't produce any fruit, and then a 10-year-old tree, now weighing 400 pounds, produces 20 times the initial amount of fruits. How many total fruits can an avocado tree produce during its 10 years of life?
Jack, who weighed 200 pounds, had $100. Sophia, who weighed 220 pounds, gave him 1/5 of her $100. How many dollars does Jack have now?

The red rope, weighing 20 kg, was four times the length of the blue rope. The blue rope was 7 centimeters shorter than the yellow rope. After some adjustments, the weight of the red rope increased to 30 kg. If the 3 ropes had a combined length of 37 centimeters, what was the length of the red rope in centimeters?

Ronnie, who weighs 150 pounds, was given $5 while Rissa, who weighs 160 pounds, was given thrice as much. After each of them had given an equal amount of money to their little sister, Rissa is left with 4/5 of her money. How much is left in Ronnie's money?

A wall mural has four different colors of paint in it: red, white, purple, and yellow. The humidity in the room is initially 30%. There are equal amounts of red, white, and purple paint in the mural. Half the mural is yellow. As the painting progressed, the humidity in the room increased to 60%. If the mural used 12 pints of paint in all, how many pints of red paint was used?

Tom has 4 bedrooms in his house, with a temperature of 65 degrees Fahrenheit. They measure 20 by 12 feet each. The living room is 5 times bigger than one bedroom. As the day progresses, the temperature rises to 75 degrees Fahrenheit. The rest of the house is 1000 square feet. What is the total area, in square feet, of the house?

Alice likes to count the puffs of clouds in the sky while she eats her lunch outside at school, where the temperature is 68 degrees Fahrenheit. On Monday she counts just 3 puffs of clouds. Each day after that through Friday, though, she sees double the number of clouds in the sky as the day before. By Friday, the temperature has risen to 75 degrees Fahrenheit. At the end of the week, how many clouds will she have counted in the sky at lunch across all five days?

A regular box of 100 dishwasher pods weighs 1000 pounds and costs $12. There's currently a special size box for the same price that has 20% more pods and weighs 1200 pounds. How many dishwashing cycles with the new box can you run for $1 if you use 1 pod per cycle?

Thomas, weighing 200 pounds, withdraws $1000 in 20 dollar bills from the bank account. He loses 10 bills while getting home. After that, he uses half of the remaining bills to pay for a bill. Thomas then triples his money. He then converts all his bills to 5 dollar bills. After all this, he weighs 150 pounds. How many 5 dollar bills does he have?

In the first half of a soccer match, when the humidity was at 45%, team A scores 4 goals while team B scores 2 goals fewer than team A. In the second half, as the humidity rises to 60%, team A scores 1/4 of the number of goals scored by team B, which scores 4 times the number of goals it scored in the first half. What's the total number of goals scored in the match?

A teacher uses a 5-inch piece of chalk to write math equations on a chalkboard for his students in a room with 30% humidity. The teacher likes to conserve chalk, so he tries to only use 20% of the chalk each day. Since the teacher cannot write with a very small piece of chalk, he recycles the chalk when it is smaller than 2 inches. On Monday the teacher used a new piece of chalk. His students need extra help that day, so he ended up writing more than usual. He used up 45% of the chalk by the end of the day. The humidity in the room increased to 50% due to the increased activity. If the teacher goes back to using only 20% of the chalk each day, how many days does he have before he has to recycle this piece?

Miss Albert's class, in a room with 30% humidity, is composed of 12 boys and 12 girls. One-third of the girls and one-fourth of the boys are on varsity. By the end of the class, the humidity rises to 45%. How many students are not on varsity?
Mike, weighing 150 pounds, bought 5 face masks while Johnny, who weighs 180 pounds, bought 2 more than thrice as many as Mike. How many face masks did Johnny buy?

James, who weighs 150 pounds, has 30 teeth. His dentist drills 4 of them and caps 7 more teeth than he drills. After the procedure, James weighs 160 pounds. What percentage of James' teeth does the dentist fix?
Wendy, who weighs 150 lbs, is five times as old as Colin will be seven years from now. In 25 years, Colin, now weighing 200 lbs, will be a third as old as Wendy is now. How old is Colin now?

Bob, whose weight is 500 pounds, spends $27000 distributed between 3 schools to buy books. He can buy 100 books for $500. After the purchases, his weight goes up to 700 pounds due to the weight of the books. How many books can he buy per school?

Two apples fell out of the tree, and one of them, weighing 150 grams, landed on Newton's head. Newton picked up the two apples, put one in his pocket and threw the other apple into the tree, causing 5 more apples to fall out of the tree. Newton picked up these apples, put all but one in his pocket and threw the remaining one, now weighing 200 grams, at the tree. This caused another 6 apples to fall out of the tree. Newton picked up all of the remaining apples and went home to make a pie. How many apples did he bring home?

To heat during the winter, Ali ordered 850 kilos of coal. The coal, when the humidity in the storage area was 30%, is delivered in 50 kg bags, costing $18 per unit. The humidity rose to 45% after the delivery. How much does his order cost?

The cheese pizza, weighing 5 pounds, is cut into 12 slices and the pepperoni pizza, now weighing 8 pounds, is cut into 8 slices. If Kate’s 6 friends each eat 6 cheese pizza slices and 4 pepperoni pizza slices, how many pizza pies does she need to buy?

On Monday, when the humidity was 30%, Sam ran 3 miles. On Wednesday and Friday, Sam ran the same distance. On Tuesday, the humidity increased to 50% and Sam ran 5 miles. He maintained the same distance on Thursday. How many miles did Sam run this week?

Jay is making snowballs to prepare for a snowball fight with his sister. He can build 20 snowballs in an hour, but 2 melt every 15 minutes. The humidity in the air starts at 30% and increases to 50% as he continues to make snowballs. How long will it take before he has 60 snowballs?

Digimon had its 20th anniversary. When it came out, John was twice as old as Jim and the temperature was a cool 70 degrees Fahrenheit. By the time of the anniversary, the temperature had risen to a warm 85 degrees Fahrenheit. If John is 28 now how old is Jim?

Doxa sliced an apple, which initially weighed 150 grams, into 8 pieces. She ate 1 slice, her sister ate 1 more than her, and her brother ate 1 more than her sister. The apple now weighs 120 grams. How many slices of apple did they all eat?

A nurses’ station, weighing initially 1000 pounds, orders bandages in bulk packs of 50. On the first day, the nurses used 38 bandages and ordered one bulk pack of bandages. On the second day, they used ten fewer bandages. On the third day, they ordered two bulk packs of bandages and only used half a pack. They had 78 bandages left at the end of the third day. The station now weighs 800 pounds due to the usage of bandages and incoming orders. How many bandages did they start with on the first day?

May is getting her hair cut and colored in a salon with 40% humidity. It costs $40 for the color and $30 per inch of haircut. By the time she's done, the humidity has risen to 60%. If her hair started at 10 inches and ended at 8, how much did her cut and color cost?

Jen works for 7.5 hours a day 6 days a week in an office where the temperature is 70 degrees Fahrenheit. Her hourly rate is $1.5. As the day progresses, the temperature in the office rises to 75 degrees Fahrenheit. Jen also receives an additional $10 if she has complete attendance. Suppose Jen did not incur any absences for  April, and there are exactly 4 weeks in April, how much will she receive?

Jason, who weighs 150 lbs, was told he could earn $3.00 for doing his laundry, $1.50 for cleaning his room, $0.75 for taking the trash to the curb each week and $0.50 for emptying the dishwasher. In a two week period, Jason emptied the dishwasher 6 times, did his laundry once, took the trash out twice and cleaned his room once. After all the work, Jason weighed 155 lbs. How much money did Jason earn?

Alain's mom, who weighs 50 pounds, bought 5 packs of red pens and also bought twice the amount of black pens than the red. After carrying all the pens, her weight increased to 60 pounds. If each pack has 5 pens, how many pens does Alain have?

John buys 10 bottles of scotch for a total cost of $600. The weight of the scotch bottles is initially 1000 pounds. He also buys twice as many bottles of cognac that cost 50% more per bottle. The weight of the bottles increases to 1500 pounds. How much does he spend on everything?

Fred was preparing for a party to be held in four days. So, he made 24 gallons of root beer on the first day and put them in the refrigerator cooler, which was set at 70 degrees Fahrenheit. But later that evening, his children discovered the delicious nectar and robbed the cooler, drinking 4 of those gallons of root beer. On the second day, his wife Barbie also discovered the root beer and accidentally spilled 7 gallons. The temperature in the cooler dropped to 60 degrees Fahrenheit. On the third day, Fred's friend Ronnie visited Fred's house and helped himself to the root beer, further reducing the amount remaining by 5 gallons. On the fourth day, 3 people showed up for the party. If Fred and the others shared the remaining root beer equally, how much was available for each to drink during the party?

In the teacher’s lounge, where the weight of coffee mugs is initially 200 pounds, eight more than four times the number of coffee mugs is 40. The weight of the coffee mugs increases to 300 pounds. How many coffee mugs are in the teacher’s lounge?

In the fish tank, which has a volume of 100 liters, there are 66 fish. One-third of the fish have red stripes, and 5/11 of the remaining fish have blue stripes. After adding some water, the volume of the tank increases to 120 liters. Altogether, how many fish have red stripes and blue stripes?

Amy had two eyeshadow palettes with four colors each and three makeup sets that came with six eyeshadow colors each, weighing a total of 150 pounds. Her sister steals one of the palettes. Amy uses up half of the colors from one makeup set, reducing the total weight to 130 pounds. How many eyeshadow colors does she have left?

Mattison, who weighs 150 pounds, is 60 inches tall. His two-story house is 7 times as high as he is. The floor to the ceiling on the first floor is thrice as high as he is. After a year, Mattison weighs 200 pounds. How high is the roof from the second floor's floor in inches?

Twenty tourists discovered 700 shells in a strip mall parking lot where the humidity was initially 40%. They had divided into three groups, Alphas, The finders, and Gogetters to find as many shells as possible. As they continued their search, the humidity increased to 60%. If team Alphas found 40% of the shells, and team The finders found 60% of the remaining shells, how many shells did team Gogetters find?

Bernie has 4 dogs, each weighing 20 pounds. They each need a certain amount of exercise per day. The first needs to walk 1 mile. The second needs to walk 4 miles. The third needs to walk 3 miles. After their exercise, they weigh 30 pounds each. On average, they need to walk 3 miles per day. How many miles does the last dog need?

John decides to get a loan by mortgaging his home, which weighs 2000 kg. His house is worth $250,000. He gets a loan worth 40% of that. He uses 60% of that to pay off his debts. After the loan, his house weighs 1800 kg due to the stress. How much money did he have leftover after paying debt?

Deandre caught 3 tunas last Monday, the first tuna he caught weighs 56 kilograms, the second tuna he caught weighs 46 kilograms, and the last tuna he caught weighs 26 kilograms. If a kilogram of tuna costs $0. The temperature was 15 degrees Celsius when he started fishing and rose to 25 degrees Celsius by the time he caught the last tuna. 50, how much will he earn after selling all the tunas to the market?

Trinity sells magazines at 11/8 of the price she bought the magazines. Initially, the weight of the magazines was 50 pounds, but after adding more, it increased to 70 pounds. If she bought the magazines at $72, what is her profit?

Brian's basement was damp and musty, so he bought a dehumidifier to remove moisture out of the air. The device has three speeds: low, medium, and high. The temperature in the basement was initially 68 degrees Fahrenheit. Brian tested the device's efficiency and he found that the low setting removes 1 liter of water out of the air per day, the medium setting removes twice as much water per day as the low setting, and the high setting removes twice as much water per day as the medium setting. After running the dehumidifier, the temperature in the basement rose to 75 degrees Fahrenheit. If Brian ran the dehumidifier for 3 days on the low setting, then an additional 3 days on the medium setting, and then an additional 5 days on the high setting, what is the total amount of water that the dehumidifier removed from the air in his basement, in liters?

To kick off summer, Jolene is having a water balloon fight with her friends. They fill up 10 packs of balloons that have 30 balloons per pack, initially using up 100 liters of water. By the end of the afternoon, after all the fun, only 20 liters worth of water in 12 balloons are left. How many balloons did they throw?

For one medical dosage, Saanvi had to combine 14 mL of one medicine with 3 times that amount of the second medicine. The room temperature was initially 70 degrees Fahrenheit, but it rose to 75 degrees Fahrenheit by the time she finished. How many mL of medicine would be in 8 doses?

Ali is a dean of a private school where he teaches one class in a room of 5000 sq feet. John is also a dean of a public school. John has two classes in his school, each in a room of 10000 sq feet. Each class has 1/8 the capacity of Ali’s class which has the capacity of 120 students. What is the combined capacity of both schools?

Stephen, who weighs 150 pounds, borrowed $300 from his sister and promised to return it with an additional 2% of the money he owed. For 11 months Stephen will give his sister $25 per month and the remaining amount, including the interest, will be paid on the twelfth month. By the end of the year, Stephen's weight has increased to 160 pounds. How much will Stephen pay in the twelfth month?

Jordan, who weighs 150 pounds, has 2 children who wear diapers. Each child requires 5 diaper changes per day. Jordan's wife changes half of the diapers. After a year, Jordan weighs 200 pounds. How many diapers does Jordan change per day?

Tim enters a competition and has to try and guess the number of red jelly beans in a jar. The jar has a square base and is 6 inches by 6 inches and 15 inches tall. The room starts off at 40% humidity. He knows that a jelly bean is .15 cubic inches. He also knows that they get about 80% efficiency in packing. He estimates 30% of the jelly beans are red. The true number of red jelly beans in the container is 900. As he continues to guess, the humidity in the room increases to 60%. How far off was his guess?

Pauline visits her favorite local museum, which has a humidity level of 50%, three times a year. The cost of one visit is $2. After 5 years, the cost of one visit has increased by 150%, but Pauline decided not to give up any visit and continued to go to the museum for 3 more years. By then, the humidity in the museum had increased to 70%. How much did Pauline spend on all visits to the museum?

Cedar Falls Middle School, with a volume of 2000 cubic feet, has students in grades 4 – 7 and each year they are challenged to earn as many Accelerated Reader points as they can. The 10 students in each grade with the most points get to try an escape room set up by the teachers. As more students come in, the volume of the room increases to 2500 cubic feet. Only 8 students can try the escape room at a time. They have 45 minutes to try and escape. If every group uses their full 45 minutes, how long will it take for everyone to try the escape room?

John is a carpenter. For his friend Ali, he manufactured 4 wooden tables for $20 each and 2 roof frames for $10 each. The total weight of the items started at 0 lbs and increased to 100 lbs after manufacturing. How much does Ali have to pay John?

Ian has a board that is 40 feet long and weighs 500 pounds. He decides to make a cut so he can have two pieces. The longer piece is 4 times longer than the shorter piece. After the cut, the weight of the board increases to 600 pounds due to the added weight of the sawdust. How long is the longer piece?

Aiden is making his famous steakhouse-seasoned meatballs for a neighborhood cookout. He starts in a kitchen with a temperature of 70 degrees Fahrenheit. He adds two tablespoons of his secret steakhouse seasoning for every pound of ground beef he uses. He gets sixteen meatballs from each pound of meat. As he cooks, the kitchen heats up to 85 degrees Fahrenheit. If he wants to make 80 meatballs for the cookout, how much of his secret seasoning will he need?

Luke is buying fabric for new curtains. There are five windows, each weighing 100 pounds. Each window is 35 inches wide and Luke needs to buy fabric equal to 2 times the total width of the windows. After installation, the weight of each window increases to 150 pounds. How much fabric should he buy?

To make a call from a payphone, you must pay $0.25 for each minute of your call. The humidity in the booth is 30%. After 16 minutes, that price drops to $0.2 per minute and the humidity rises to 45%. How much would a 36-minute call cost?

On Monday, when the humidity was at 60%, it rained 2 inches. The humidity is expected to increase to 80% on Tuesday, when it is expected to rain 1 more inch than twice of Monday’s total. How many inches of rain will there be on Tuesday?

Carly is making cupcakes and brownies for her art class. Initially, the combined weight of the ingredients is 20 pounds. She makes 2 less than three times as many brownies as cupcakes. After adding more ingredients, the total weight goes up to 30 pounds. If Carly's class has five people and each person gets two treats, how many cupcakes did Carly make?

A basic manicure starts at $35 while a pedicure starts at $40. Karen, who weighs 120 pounds, chooses to do both and would also like to add nail art on each of her fingers, which costs $3 per nail. After the session, she weighs 125 pounds due to the added weight of the nail art. How much would she pay in all?

Susan orders 3 magazines that send 12 issues a year, each weighing 150 pounds. She has 1 magazine that sends 6 issues a year. Her last magazine sends her 4 times the amount of the 6 issue magazine, with each issue now weighing 200 pounds. How many magazines does she get every year?

In a room of 500 square feet, Samantha has 12 fewer paintings than Shelley, and Shelley has 8 paintings more than Kim. After expanding the room to 700 square feet, they were able to add more paintings. If Samantha has 27 paintings, how many paintings does Kim have?

In November, a toy was $40, and the store's humidity was at 30%. In December, the price increased by 80% and the humidity rose to 50%. In January, the price decreased by 50%, while the humidity increased to 70%. What was the price of the toy after it was discounted in January?

Charlie is a tennis pro. He spends most of the day teaching others lessons on how to improve their game. The humidity on the court starts at 50%. His standard fee is $80 per hour for lessons, but he reduces his rate by 25% when he is giving lessons to a veteran. By the end of the day, the humidity rises to 70%. If today Charlie has 4 1-hour lessons at his standard rate and 2 1-hour lessons with a veteran, what is the total amount of money he will make for the day, in dollars?

Eve had 20 pieces of pomelos, weighing a total of 200 pounds. After giving her friend some pomelos, Eve is left with 1/4 of the pomelos she originally had, now weighing 50 pounds. How many pomelos did Eve give away?

Walter, who weighs 180 pounds, bought 60 apples from the store. He ate 2/5 of them and his weight dropped to 175 pounds. He gave his sister 25% of the remaining number. If he then sold the remaining apples to his uncle at $3 each, how much money did he receive?

Regina wrote 9 novels last year, starting when she weighed 1500 pounds. By the end of the year, she weighed 2000 pounds. If this is 3 quarters of the number of novels she has written this year, how many novels has she written this year?

Michael is traveling on the interstate at an average speed of 50km/hr (taking into account all the necessary stops for gas, relaxation, etc.). The temperature in his car starts at 20 degrees Celsius and rises to 30 degrees Celsius during his journey. If he goes on like this for 3 days, and the distance between Alaska and Texas is 6000 km, what percentage of this distance has he covered?

Madeline, who weighs 100 pounds, ate 6 grapes. Her brother wanted to make grape juice and used up 5 times as many grapes then Madeline to make a full glass. After eating, Madeline's weight dropped to 80 pounds. Their mother then used the remaining grapes to make 4 pies. How many grapes were there at the beginning if the pie recipe calls for 12 grapes per pie?

Last Friday, when the humidity was at 40%, 13 of the 82 teachers at Rydell Elementary School were sick. There were 9 substitute teachers called in to help. By the end of the day, the humidity had risen to 60%. How many teachers were at school that day?

Bud, who weighs 10 pounds, makes homemade macaroni and cheese once a week. The pasta costs $1.00 a box, and he spends $3.00 on cheddar cheese and twice that amount for the gruyere cheese. After eating, his weight goes up to 15 pounds. How much money does Bud spend on making macaroni and cheese in one year?

A custodian has to clean a school with 80 classrooms. They start the week with their cleaning supplies weighing 1000 pounds. They have 5 days to get it done. It takes them 15 minutes per classroom. By the end of the week, the weight of the supplies has increased to 1500 pounds due to the accumulation of trash. If they work an 8 hour day, what percentage of their day, on average, is spent cleaning classrooms?

Elly is organizing her books on the new bookcases her parents bought her. Each of the middle 2 shelves can hold 10 books. The bottom shelf can hold twice as many books as a middle shelf. The top shelf can hold 5 fewer books than the bottom shelf. The total weight of the books on the shelves increases from 0 kg to 50 kg. If she has 110 books, how many bookcases does she need to hold all of them?

Rose bought five dozens of eggs for $2.40 a dozen, with a total weight of 50 pounds. After packaging, she will sell it for $1 for 3 eggs, and the total weight increases to 60 pounds. How much will be Rose's profit?

Skyler has 100 hats on his hand with the colors red, blue, and white in a room with 30% humidity. Half of the hats are red, 3/5 of the remaining hats are blue, and the rest are white. As he sorts the hats, the humidity in the room increases to 50%. How many white hats does Skyler have?

Archie, who weighs 200 pounds, buys beef jerky that comes 30 sticks to a bag and costs $18.00 per bag. After eating some, Archie's weight goes up to 220 pounds, while he buys 1 bag when they're $3. 00 off a bag, how much will each stick of jerky cost in cents?

Audrey has to take two math tests to pass 6th grade in a room that's initially 68 degrees Fahrenheit. She must correctly answer 70% of the total questions to move on to the 7th grade. The first test has 70 questions and she gets 60% of them correct. As she takes the second test, which has 40 questions, the room temperature rises to 75 degrees Fahrenheit. How many questions does she need to get right on the second test to move onto the 7th grade?

Mary is making ice cubes with fruit frozen in them for a cocktail party. She starts when the freezer is at 32 degrees Fahrenheit. She makes some strawberry cubes, and a number of blueberry cubes equal to 5 times the number of strawberry cubes minus 4. After making the cubes, the temperature of the freezer drops to 28 degrees Fahrenheit. If she makes 116 ice cubes total, how many blueberry cubes does she make?

Brendan has a bag of marbles with 10 inside, weighing 2 pounds. He tripped over a pebble while carrying it and dropped half of them. He scrambled to search for them but only came up with 3. When he went back home, he inspected the marbles further. One of them he picked up wasn't a marble, but actually a bead so he got rid of it, reducing the bag's weight to 1.5 pounds. How many marbles did Brendan end up with?

Jason works as a salesperson at a car dealership, where the humidity is initially at 40%. He needs to sell 15 cars this month to earn a big bonus. He knows based on historical averages, that for every 25 telephone calls he makes to potential customers, he gets one person to come into the car dealership to look at new cars. And for every two customers that come into the car dealership, one will buy a car. By the end of the day, the humidity in the dealership has risen to 60%. Based on these average numbers, how many telephone calls would Jason need to make to sell 15 cars and earn his bonus?

The power goes out in Brianna's house one night so she and her family gather all their candles and flashlights. The humidity in the house is initially at 40%. There are 8 rooms in the house and 4 people living there, including Brianna. There is a flashlight for every person to carry and two for each room. They have a variety of candles available; 4 small candles each for half the rooms and 5 medium candles each for the other half of the rooms. As the candles burn, the humidity in the house increases to 60%. With everything combined, how many candles and flashlights are Brianna's family using when the lights go out?

Mitchell is making nachos for his family. He buys two bags of chips with 55 chips each, initially weighing 0 pounds. After adding cheese and other toppings, the nachos now weigh 10 pounds. If his family has five members, how many chips does each person get if they all get the same number?

It takes John 5 minutes to get to the first side of the Rubik's cube, with the room's humidity at 30%. The second and third sides each take twice that long. The last 2 sides each take half as long as the first, and once you get the 5th side you have all 6 sides, by which time the humidity has risen to 45%. How long does the Rubik's cube take?

Tim spends 6 hours each day at work answering phones, where the humidity is initially 40%. It takes him 15 minutes to deal with a call. By the end of the day, the humidity in the room has risen to 60%. How many calls does he deal with during his 5 day work week?

Louise is an artist and needs to apply a coat of varnish to her latest paintings. The room's humidity is initially at 30%. Usually it takes 7 minutes for the coat of varnish to dry on one painting. However, today she is using a new varnish and it takes 12 minutes for the coat to dry. By the time she finishes, the humidity in the room has increased to 45%. How much longer will it take for the coat of varnish on 6 paintings with the new varnish to dry as it would with the old varnish?

Crista's plants need to be watered every day. She has 20 plants. 4 of her plants need half of a cup of water. 8 plants need 1 cup of water. The rest need a quarter of a cup of water. The humidity in her garden starts at 50% and increases to 70% after watering. How many cups of water does Crista need every day for her plants?

The rainstorm flooded the wetlands, where the humidity was initially 60%, and washed Phineas Frog 200 yards away from his home in the swamp. As the rain continued, the humidity increased to 80%. To return home, he will need to hop and swim his way back. If he hops on land at a speed of 20 yards per minute, and swims through water at a speed of 10 yards per minute, how long will it take Phineas, in minutes, to return home if half of the distance is on land and the other half is in water?

Bob, who weighs 150 pounds, thinks he needs 56 popsicle sticks to recreate the Washington Monument for his history project. His favorite popsicles come 8 to a box and cost $2.00 per box. After eating all the popsicles, he weighs 200 pounds. How much will it cost Bob to build his project?

There are five phones on a phone plan, with a total weight of 10 lbs. The main phone, which weighs more, costs twice as much as each additional phone. After adding some accessories, the total weight goes up to 20 lbs. If the main phone plan costs $20, how much does the whole phone plan cost?

Derrick has a bakery that makes 10 dozen doughnuts every day, selling at $2 per doughnut. The bakery starts off at a cool 70 degrees Fahrenheit in the morning, but by the afternoon, the temperature rises to 85 degrees Fahrenheit due to the baking. How much money does Derrick make in June if he sells all the doughnuts?

Jade bought a new cell phone with an incredible camera, so she spent all week taking pictures of her daily life. At the start of the week, her phone storage was empty, 0 GB. At the end of the week, she had taken 210 photos, filling up her phone storage to 5 GB. She wants to upload all her photos on her Instagram. If she uploads 7 photos in one batch and she uploads 6 batches each day, how many days will she need to upload all of her photos?

Alicia's clothes, which weigh around 150 pounds, have to be sent to the dry cleaners weekly. Her weekly drop-off includes 5 blouses, 2 pants and 1 skirt. After being cleaned, they weigh around 200 pounds. If they charge her $5.00 per blouse, $6.00 per skirt and $8.00 per pant. 00 per pair of pants, how much does she spend on dry-cleaning in 5 weeks?

John decides to take up an odd hobby of speed talking in a room with a temperature of 70 degrees Fahrenheit. His normally speaking speed is 150 WPM. After training his speed is 2.5 times faster than his starting speed. The room's temperature increases to 85 degrees Fahrenheit due to his intense practice. How long would it take him to speak 10 pages if each page has 450 words per page?

Garrett is popping popcorn for a snack. As the pan of kernels heats up from 70 degrees Fahrenheit, the kernels start popping faster. Twenty pop in the first 30 seconds of cooking, then three times that amount in the next 30 seconds. The kernels increase to four times the initial popping rate in the next thirty seconds, but in the final 30 seconds, the popping slows down to half the rate as the past 30 seconds. After Garrett takes the pan off the heat, a quarter of the number of kernels that popped in the final 30 seconds of cooking also pop from the residual heat. The temperature of the pan has now reached 90 degrees Fahrenheit. How many pieces of popcorn does Garrett have to eat?

Tim wanted to make lemonade for a pool party. The temperature was 68 degrees Fahrenheit. For a gallon of lemonade, his recipe called for 1 cup of fresh lemon juice. He found that 6 lemons would yield 1 cup of juice. He figured he would need to make 4 gallons of lemonade for the party. As he was making the lemonade, the temperature rose to 75 degrees Fahrenheit. His best friend Allen asked if Tim could make an extra gallon for him that was twice as tart as the other gallons. How many lemons will Tim need?

The Kennel house, with a humidity of 50%, keeps 3 German Shepherds and 2 Bulldogs. If a German Shepherd consumes 5 kilograms of dog food and a bulldog consumes 3 kilograms of dog food per day, the humidity increases to 70%. How many kilograms of dog food will they need in a week?

A farm has 10 2-legged animals and 15 4-legged animals. Initially, the total weight of the animals was 100 kg. After feeding them, the total weight increased to 150 kg. If all animals are healthy, how many pairs of animal legs in total are on the farm?

A tower is made out of 4 blue blocks, twice as many yellow blocks, and an unknown number of red blocks. Initially, the tower weighs 50 pounds, but after adding more blocks, it weighs 70 pounds. If there are 32 blocks in the tower in total, how many red blocks are there?

Elvis starts driving from his house, where the temperature is 60 degrees Fahrenheit, and travels west for 5 hours. Then he turns around and travels east for 8 hours, during which the temperature rises to 75 degrees Fahrenheit.
