If he was driving at an average speed of 18mph for both parts of the journey, how far is he from his house now?

Gary bought a boat for $9000, weighing 2000 pounds. Over the first year it depreciated 30%. The second year it depreciated another 30%. By the third year, as it depreciated 20%, it also lost weight and now weighs 1800 pounds. How much is the boat worth after the three years?

A large bag of Starbursts candy, initially weighing 2 pounds, has 232 pieces of individually wrapped candies. As more candies are added, its weight increases to 3 pounds. If this bag has 54 red candies, twice that amount of orange candies and half as many yellow candies as red candies, how many candies are pink?

Helen went on a trip through Germany. She started her journey with a speed of 60 mph. She booked a hotel for 3 nights and rode the bus 7 times during that trip. One night at the hotel was a cost of $80, and every bus trip was 10% of the price of one night at the hotel. Towards the end of her trip, her speed reduced to 30 mph. How much did Helen pay for the hotel and bus travels during that trip?

Mazie, who weighs 200 pounds, has 52 marbles and gives them to twins, Dallas and Darla. After a hearty meal, she weighs 400 pounds. If Dallas has a total of 21 marbles after dropping 4 of them in the playground, how many did Mazie give to Darla?

A family of parents and a child go to the cinema. The cost of an adult ticket is $12 and a child ticket is $8. Then they buy 2 popcorns for $3 each, which weigh initially 0 pounds but after popping, they weigh 6 pounds. How many dollars do they pay in total?

John's car breaks down. The car, with a starting luggage volume of 15 cubic feet, weighs 1200 pounds and he has luggage in it weighing 250 pounds. He also has his two young children who weigh 75 pounds each in it. After packing some more items, the luggage volume increases to 25 cubic feet. If the force to move the car is 1% of the weight how much force does he need to push the car?

James wants to hang crepe-paper streamers from his backyard fence for his birthday party. His backyard fence, which initially has a humidity of 40%, is a rectangle that measures 20 feet on the long side and 15 feet on the short side. By the time he finishes hanging the streamers, the humidity has risen to 60%. How many feet of crepe paper does James need to buy?

Mia and Emma are currently 16 years apart in age. The humidity in the room where they are sitting is initially 50%, but it increases to 80% as they continue their conversation. If Mia, who is younger than Emma, is 40 years old, what's the average of their ages?

Tom found 214 seashells, Nancy found 432 seashells, and Benny found 86 seashells on the beach. The total weight of the seashells was initially 50 pounds. When they cleaned them, they discovered that 67 were cracked, increasing the total weight to 70 pounds. How many good seashells did they find together?

Avery needs to buy a 3 piece place setting (dinner & salad plate and a bowl) for her holiday dinner. She’s having 12 people over for dinner. If the dinner plates cost $6.00 each and bowls each cost $5.00 and the salad plates cost $4. Initially, the total weight of the place settings is 0 pounds. After buying all the place settings, the total weight is 180 pounds. 00, how much will she spend on place settings?

Steve, weighing 150 lbs, put together a puzzle that took 10 hours of hard work to complete. After a meal, his weight increased to 200 lbs. Anna put together the same puzzle in 2 hours more than half Steve's time. How long did it take Anna to finish the difficult puzzle?

Dexter has five pigs. Each one eats 4 pounds of feed, twice a day. The weight of the feed bag decreases from 40 pounds to 20 pounds. If Dexter ordered 300 pounds of feed, how many pounds of feed is left after a week?

John invited 20 people to a birthday party, held in a room with a temperature of 70 degrees Fahrenheit. Each guest will eat 2 hot dogs. He already has 4 hot dogs left over from a previous party. As the party progresses and the room fills with people, the temperature rises to 75 degrees Fahrenheit. If a pack of hot dogs contains 6 hot dogs and costs $2, how much does he need to spend on hot dogs?

Frances, whose weight is 500 pounds, sells 20 cupcakes for $2 for each cupcake and 40 cookies at $1 each. She buys five trays at $4 for each tray. After all the selling and buying, her weight increases to 600 pounds. How much money does Frances have left?

An ice cream truck is traveling through a neighborhood at a speed of 30 mph. Children from various homes have started chasing the truck and, by the time the truck has reached the end of the first street, there are 5 children it. On the second street, each child is joined by another child and the truck slows down to 20 mph. On the third street, each child in the existing group is joined by another 2 children and the truck slows further to 15 mph. The original 5 children then give up and leave the group. How many children are now following the truck?

The recent floods in Mamou’s country, where the humidity was initially at 40%, have left many families without food or shelter. To help, Mamou has volunteered to distribute 1,360 meals to the affected families. She gave out 64 meals on Friday, 30 meals on Saturday, and 48 meals on Sunday. By the end of Sunday, the humidity had risen to 60%. How many meals does she have left to distribute?

James likes to check the coin return of the vending machine for change, especially when the humidity is at 50%. One day he finds a quarter, two nickels, and 7 dimes. By the time he finishes, the humidity has risen to 70%. How much money in cents does James have?

In a family, there are 2 brothers and 3 sisters. All sisters are the same age, which is 16. One of the brothers is 12 years old, which is half the age of the older brother. The weight of the older brother is 120 pounds, but after a few months, he gains weight and now he weighs 140 pounds. What is the total age of all these siblings?

Every day Charisma meditates for 15 minutes when she first wakes up in a room with a temperature of 68 degrees Fahrenheit and again before she goes to sleep when the temperature has risen to 78 degrees Fahrenheit. 5 days a week she practices 1 hour of yoga. in 4 weeks, how much time has she spent on meditation/yoga practice?

Octavia wants to make a quilt for her sister. She is going to build it from small, medium, and large t-shirts that her family is done with. A small t-shirt is 3 square feet of fabric and weighs 2 pounds. A medium one is 4 square feet and weighs 3 pounds. A large one is 6 square feet and weighs 5 pounds. If she uses 11 small shirts, 8 medium, and 6 large shirts, how many square feet is the quilt?
A small sunflower, weighing 4 pounds, has 3 dozen seeds and a large sunflower, weighing 5 pounds, has 50% more seeds than a small sunflower. How many sunflower seeds are there altogether?

Timothy, who weighs 50 pounds, has three times the number of pens that George owns. Sarah, who weighs 70 pounds, has half as many pens as Timothy. If George has 18 pens, how many pens does Sarah have?

Jackie, who weighed 150 lbs, grew 3" over the summer. She is now 2" shorter than Anne, who is twice the size of Albert. By the end of summer, Jackie weighed 200 lbs. If Albert is 36" tall, how tall was Jackie before summer?

A company produces chocolate in bars, initially weighing 5000 kg. In one day, it can produce 5000 bars. The company sells all the produced bars for $2 per bar. By the end of the day, the total weight of the chocolate bars produced increases to 6000 kg. How much money will the company receive for selling produced chocolate bars during two weeks?

Jake is shopping at a clothing store where the temperature is 70 degrees Fahrenheit. The store has a buy one get one 50% off deal on T-shirts. Jake buys 2 T-shirts. The original price of each T-shirt is $8. Then, Jake buys a pair of shoes that is 40% off the original price. The temperature in the store rises to 75 degrees Fahrenheit as Jake continues shopping. The original price of the shoes is $40. What is the total amount of money Jake spends at the store?

Ryan’s allowance is $6 each week he completes his chores. He did his chores for 3 weeks. Then he bought ice cream cones for himself and 3 friends at $1.25 each. Now they all want to go to the movies and tickets cost $6.50 each. Ryan, who initially weighed 150 pounds, after eating the ice cream, now weighs 155 pounds. How many movie tickets can Ryan buy?

Ellen and her sister, Lani, went to the mall to buy presents for their mom. The mall's humidity was initially at 30%. Ellen bought a pair of leggings for $100 and a photo frame for $5. Lani bought a pair of sunglasses at $30 and two bathrobes at $100 each. By the time they finished shopping, the humidity in the mall had risen to 50%. How much did they spend in all?

Tim makes a special honey and jam mix in a room that starts at 70 degrees Fahrenheit. To make 1 jar of the mixture it takes 2 pounds of passion fruit and 1.5 pounds of jackfruit. It also takes 2 pounds of special honey. The passion fruit costs $6 per pound, the jackfruit is $8 per pound, and the honey is $10 per pound. As he finishes making the mix, the room temperature rises to 85 degrees Fahrenheit. He sells each jar for $50. How much profit does he make selling 10 jars?

Justin has a jar with many coins in it. The jar, initially weighing 10 pounds, has 32 quarters, 95 dimes, 120 nickels, and 750 pennies. After adding more coins, the jar now weighs 15 pounds. What is the total dollar amount in the jar?

Janet goes to the mall, where the temperature is a cool 65 degrees Fahrenheit, and spends $3.50 on ice cream, $7.50 each for movie tickets for herself and her younger sister, and $8.50 on a bracelet. By the time she's done shopping, the temperature has risen to 75 degrees Fahrenheit. If her parents gave her $40, how many dollars does she have left?

Josh runs a car shop and services 3 cars a day. The shop starts off at a cool 70 degrees Fahrenheit. He is open every day of the week except Sunday and Wednesday. As he works, the temperature in the shop rises to 75 degrees Fahrenheit. He gets paid $4 per car. How much does he make in 2 weeks?

Randy, who weighs 150 pounds, has 9 oatmeal cookies, 4 chocolate chip cookies, and 5 sugar cookies. He ate 3 cookies for an early day snack, one of each flavor. He ate 2 oatmeal cookies for lunch. He gives 2 sugar cookies to his friends. Then, he bakes 4 of each flavor for dinner, and his weight goes up to 155 pounds. How many cookies does he have now?

Matthew has a collection of 12 unique toy soldiers, each weighing 1 pound. He wants to sell them for a fair price. He found a buyer who is willing to pay for half his collection $5 per toy, and for the other half $7 per toy. The buyer noticed that the toys in the latter half were slightly heavier, weighing 1.5 pounds each. If Matthew would agree to that offer, how much money would he earn?

Nate's dog can dig six holes a day, with the humidity at 50%. He digs for 14 days while Nate is on vacation. When Nate gets home, he starts filling in 9 holes a day, but the dog keeps digging 6 new holes every night. The humidity rises to 70% due to all the digging. How many weeks does it take him to fill in all the holes?

Norman High School, which has a campus area of 2000 square feet, enrolls an average of 4000 students every year. Butler High School, the neighboring school, enrolls an average of 3/4 as many students as Norman High School. The campus area of Butler High School is 3000 square feet. How much greater is the average enrollment at Norman High School than the enrollment at Butler High School?

The Adams family is busy making cookies. Initially, the weight of the cookies was 2000 pounds. So far, they've made 7995 cookies. They have 2595 rainbow cookies, 3075 oatmeal cookies, and some chocolate chip cookies. Now, the total weight of cookies is 3000 pounds. How many chocolate chip cookies have they made?

Dr. Hugo Grumpus and his assistant, Igor, were preparing to perform a laboratory experiment in a room with a temperature of 68 degrees Fahrenheit. Dr. Grumpus told Igor to gather 16 test tubes, 7 beakers, and 14 Petri dishes, and to place them all on the lab bench. By accident, Igor gathered half as many test tubes as requested, two more than the number of Petri dishes requested. And while he had picked up the correct number of beakers, he lost several on the way to the lab bench. In total, the number of items Igor had placed on the lab bench was 29. The temperature in the room rose to 75 degrees Fahrenheit due to the activity. How many beakers did Igor lose?

James, weighing 50 pounds, is putting together 4 tables. Each table has 4 legs and each leg needs 2 screws. He has 40 screws. After the work, his weight goes up to 60 pounds due to fatigue and sweat. How many screws will he have left over?

The girls are trying to raise money for a carnival. Kim, who weighs 50 pounds, raises $320 more than Alexandra, who raises $430, and Maryam, who weighs 70 pounds, raises $400 more than Sarah, who raises $300. How much money, in dollars, did they all raise in total?

Aaron and Vanessa were relay race partners on a running team. The humidity was initially at 50%. Aaron was able to run each mile twice as fast as Vanessa, but Vanessa was able to run twice as far as Aaron did. By the end of the race, the humidity had risen to 70%. If Vanessa ran 4 miles and Aaron completed his part of the race in 16 minutes, how long in minutes did Vanessa take to complete her part?

The caretaker of the docks, which weighs 500 pounds, needs to buy some new line. He wants 3 feet of line for every foot of dock. Right now, there is 200 feet of dock, and he has 6 feet of new line. After the addition of the new line, the weight of the docks increases to 600 pounds. How many feet of line does he need to buy in total?

At Tom's restaurant, which is kept at a comfortable 68 degrees Fahrenheit, they get 6 reservations a night. As the evening progresses and the restaurant gets busier, the temperature rises to 75 degrees Fahrenheit. They normally order 2 meals that cost $5 each and a $5 bottle of wine. How much do they make a week if they are open 2 days a week?

A fruit vendor bought 50 watermelons for $80, weighing a total of 4000 pounds. After adding packaging materials, he sold all of them at a profit of 25%, with the total weight now being 4500 pounds. How much was each watermelon sold?

John, who weighed 180 pounds, had a son James when he was 19. James is now twice as old as his sister Dora, who will turn 12 in 3 years. Over the years, John's weight increased to 200 pounds. How old will John's youngest son, who was born when John was 32, be in 3 years?

There are some oranges in a basket, each weighing 5 pounds. Ana spends 3 minutes peeling an orange and Jane spends 4 minutes doing the same. After peeling, the oranges weigh 8 pounds each. If Ana and Jane start picking oranges from this basket to peel at the same time, how many more oranges will Ana have peeled than Jane after an hour?

Mark's car breaks down and he needs to get a new radiator. The cost for a new radiator is $400 but he goes to get it at a junk shop and gets it for 80% off. The temperature in the junk shop is 70 degrees Fahrenheit. He then hires a mechanic to install it and it takes 3 hours at $50 an hour. By the time the mechanic finishes, the temperature has risen to 75 degrees Fahrenheit. How much did he pay?

Farmer Brown has 20 animals on his farm, all either chickens or cows, weighing a total of 2000 pounds. They have a total of 70 legs, all together. After feeding them, their total weight increases to 3000 pounds. How many of the animals are chickens?
